1.content:
*Beep, Beep!* Ryan sat in his BMW honking the horn for his three best friends to jump in.

Leiah is in the bathroom touching up her make-up and hair until they are perfect, knowing she can have anything or anyone she wants. She finishes and walks out of Casian's grandmother's estate waiting for her other two friends.

Jake is in the kitchen sampling some of Gram's mouth-watering double chocolate caramel cookies.

Casian is in the sitting room chatting with her Gram(who she lives with because her parents died in a car crash when she was three.)"Well I better tear Jake away from your cookies or we'll never get to the mall"

"Alright darling have fun"

"Casian! Jacob! Ryan say he will leave if you don't get out here!" Leiah shouts from the bottom of the steps.

Casian and Jake come out and go down the steps. Meeting Leiah on their way down, they all get into Ryan's car (Jake and Leiah in the back and Casian sitting shotgun)

"Man, what too you guys so long?"

"Ryan can you be anymore impatient?" Casian asked buckling her seat belt.

"Anyways last night was really fun, even though it couldn't be a real sleepover because of these two guys." Leiah said.

"Hmm... I wonder why your Gram wouldn't let us all sleep on the livingroom floor together Cas." Jake joked. We all laughed, and Ryan hit the gas speeding off towards the Santa Monica westbound freeway.

"Get ready malls! Cuz' my credit cards are ready for anything!" Leiah yelled out the window.

Ryan was exiting the freeway to get to all of the major shopping centers in Los Angeles when suddenly things went pitch black........
1.title: Speeding Down the Freeway

11.content:
"Ryan I knew you were driving to fast....is everyone okay?" Casian says, checking herself for bruises.

"What happened?" Leiah says.

"I dunno, but I think Ryan crashed into a tree or something." Jake says startled at the sudden non-movement.


"You guys, I don't think I crashed into one tree. More like a whole forest!" Ryan exclaimed. "Look through the windshield."

Ryan was right.... stuck in the middle of a forest

"Okay there are no forests in Hollywood or Beverly Hills!!! So where are we?!" Leiah wail.

"Well we should all get out and check to see if we can figure out where exactly we are and what we can do about it." Casian says getting out of the smashed Beemer.

"Sounds good Cas." Jake agrees with her as he climbs out of the backseat. Ryan and Leiah both exit the car wordlessly.

The silence lasts for minutes, but it seems like hours. When Ryan pipes up and says" So are just gonna stand here or are we going to grab whatever we can carry and explore a little? Casian you usually know what to do so should be leave or go?"

"Well we should probably check for signs of life. you know get a lay of the land." She says thoughtfully.
11.title: The Forest?

111.content: Are you a male or female?
111.title: What gender are you?

1111.content:
Choose who you are?

Jake has a boundless imagination that has gotten him out of many scrapes.

Ryan is strong and swift a wonderful athlete, but with an ego to match.
1111.title: Who are you?(Male)

choices: They wait for you and Leiah
11111.content:
Why does Ryan always get Casian's approval? You ask yourself.
"Jacob!" That was Leiah interupting your thoughts... she always calls you by your full name.

"What?"

"Well are you coming?"

"Oh yeah. I was just checking the trunk for anything useful. I found Ryan's Emergency Car Kit. It has a couple blankets, some food, two flashlights, a MP3 player, and a gallon of Evian." Leave it to Ryan to put an MP3 player in an "Emergency" kit.

"Ok well grab it and get your butt over here, Cas and Ryan are leaving."Leiah says.

You grab the kit and jog up to Leiah, then both of you continue on trying to catch up with Ryan and Casian.

"Would you guys hold up!" You yell.
11111.title: Jake feels unloved

111111.content:
You and Leiah catch up to them. You notice a look that Ryan and Casian share, and you feel extremely jealous.

"So you guys I found some stuff in Ryan's trunk." You state trying very hard to keep your voice in check.

"Really Jake? Well what did you find? Anything usefull?" Casian asks.

"Well I found Ryan's Emergency Car Kit, there are two blankets, some food, a bottle of Evian, a couple flashlights, and an MP3 player...although I couldn't figure out what the hell an MP3 player was doing in an EMERGENCY car kit. But whatever" You spit out.


"Shut up Jake! Just because I don't wanna be bored out of my mind if I'm stuck somewhere doesnt mean you have to ask like my freakin' mother!"

"Would you guys chill out?" Leiah says before you two get into a full blown fist fight.

"Yeah really I mean there are more important things at hand here!" Casian adds.

You are about to say something smart-assish back when you begin to feel you fingers tingleing. "Do you guys feel thet weird sensation too?"

"Yea..." Leiah

"It's kinda freakin me out, man!" Ryan

"Ryan chill out if all of us feel something maybe its a good thing?"

"She is quite correct in her thinking patterns my childern." A voice says quietly behind you and your best friends.....
111111.title: The Voice

1111111.content:
*SHRIEK* You hear Leiah scream with fright as her stance begins to falter. You rush to her side and catch her before she faints. "Look dude what the hell is your problem. You scared the crap outta Leiah!"

"I AM NO DUDE INSOLENT ONE!" The voice belongs to a older man who sustains a very youthful aire about him. They all could tell he was not happy at you... "I am Maltir the Wise, Seer of all things great, small, past, future, or present! No one has EVER spoken to me in such a tone, but because you four have the power to mold my beloved Esylla's future I shall let it pass. THIS ONE TIME ONLY!"

"Excuse me, Maltir the Wise, what exactly do you mean 'powers' and 'shaping the future of Esylla' (did you call it)? It doesn't make sense with all due respect, sir." Casian timidly asks.

His face softens and he smiles looking at Casian in the eyes "My dear intelligent studius wonderfully complicated Casian. You always ask the right questions and for that you have been granted the power of the Mystic. Leiah awaken!" With those words she slowly wakes.

"You my charming sophisticated one you are given the power of the Healer.

"Ryan strong, swift, steady, and sure! You my son are given great neverending strenth, and heightened senses." He looks at you almost expecting you to smart mouth off.

"Then there is you Jake, you are bold and ingenious, though if i had my way you would not have any power because you mock me inside, you are given Matamorphosis." Each of the four feels that same tingleing excepyt this time it is in your whole body not just your fingers. "The gifts have been given I depart you with these words- Esylla is not as peaceful as it seems and you must ALWAYS stay together friendship never faultering for even one second!" With that a he disappeard.

Leiah looks at the ground where he was a moment ago and finds a amethist pendant. "Umm.. you guys I found this cool looking amulet thingy."
1111111.title: Maltir

choices: You notice horses only a few feet from you...
11111111.content:
A whisper arose on the air as soon as Leiah showed the amulet to the rest of the group. "Each of you touch the pendent with your right hand."
The voice was so soft but so incredibly firm and precise, so all of you did as the voice instructed.

You closed your eyes, it just seemed like the right thing to do.You felt like an awakening was taking place in your body, as if a part of you that had been surpressed for so long was let loose. It was an incredible sense of freedom. You did not know if the others were feeling this freedom, but you were so caught up in the euphoria of it all that it didn't matter. The voice reaches your mind again, "If you ever need me, I shall be here. All you need know is that the pendent is key."

You open your eyes and notice that each of you has different clothes on resembling what you would think of as hunting attire-Tunics, pants, boots, for you and Ryan. A dress, short cloak, and slippers for Leiah knee high boots. A mini-dress thigh high boots and a floor length cloak for Casian.

Also each is equipped with a weapon. Ryan has a broad sword at his hips. You have a pair of daggars at your hips and a javalin. Leiah has a bow and arrow across her shoulders and a long knife at her thigh.Casian has a staff: one end has a lethal looking jagged blade imbeded into it, the other side has a large blood-red crystal attached.
11111111.title: Change in Attire

choices: Forest...don't say i didn't warn you...........
111111111.content:
You also notice five incredible purebred horses(you know this because of your equstrian nature, knowing purebreds carry themselves differently) only a few dozen yards away. You immediatly fell in love with the Friesian, a very rare pitch black horse (origionating from the Netherlands.) You walked over to it and it nuzzeled against your chest. It seems as if the Friesian stallion, that you named Baron, wanted to be yours. Leiah claimed the Andalusian for her own, that breed being know for its noble, almost regal, Spaniah heritage, naming her Majesty. Casian made her way to the Golden American Saddleback, a bold and intelligent breed, coat the color of an untarnished gold coin, mane and tail that of creame, and a white marking on her forehead. She promtly named her Starburst, its namesake being that the white marking on its forehead resenbled that of a star. Ryan was usually timid with horses because he had been bucked off as a small child, but nonetheless he promtly found his way to the Salle Francais this breed that was known for being the epitome of the sporting horse: athletic stong and swift. Normally midnight black colored with hints of brown along the back, flanks, and legs this magnificent horse was no exception though it had a white diamond between its eyes. Ryan named him Chavallier (for Maurice Chavallier a french actor renouned for being the epitome of the french gentleman.)

Each of you had chosen a horse for your own, but you realized that there was one more horse left unclaimed and on its back were traveling packs. You knew what type of horse this fine animal was at once, an Ardennais(yep french again guys.) You remember reading about this perticular breed it was Napolean's favorite breed due to it's incredible endurance. Chesnut brown coat and black mane and tail. Size much like that of a Clydesdale except it was quicker and bred for mountain life. Ryan noticed that Chavallier and this Ardennais were like best friends though Chavallier was acted as mentor to him. Ryan announced. "I think that since these two are both friends, and the fact that that named my horse after Maurice Chavallier the most gentile man on the planet, my hero, this horse's name should be Grant, Cary Grant. The second most genitle man on the planet."

"Yeah, hello Ryan this horse is not an american breed so you obviously cannot give him an american name! He is a french horse deserving of a french name. And besides the second most gentile man is not Cary Grant it's Louis Jordan." (sidenote- Maurice Chavallier was Jordan's Uncle in Gigi and Loius Jordan is the french actor who co-starred with Leslie Coron in Gigi, the best movie ever!) Leiah corrected him. "Wouldn't that be cute Jordan and Chavallier, they were both in Gigi. The two most debonaire men ever know to grace a woman with their presence." With that she sighed.

"Leiah you have a point these two are obviously French breeds and Jordan would fit this one perfectly."Casian agreed.

"Then it's settled." You said. "It shall be Her Majesty, Baron, Starburst, Chavallier, and Jordan. Our faithful companions!"

**************************************************
You guys realize by know, my love for horses right? lol.... back to the story........
**************************************************

There are two paths one into the mountains eastward, and one going into what seems to be a another forest to the north.(south and west is the forest you started in)

Sidenote: If you go into the forest, you will have to give up these horses, and it will be harder to travel without them and without Jordan's back to carry all your stuff. If you go into the mountain it will probably get colder, but the traveling will be much easier. (Hint Hint: You want to go into the mountains...)
111111111.title: Gorgeous Horses

1111111111.content:
Everyone else is busy repacking their personal sparse belongings and the other various "Gifts" that you had gotten from Maltir. Including four leather backpacks that were attached to each of the claimed horses, a few changes of clothes, and in your left saddlebag you found what looked like pure gold pieces weighing quite a bit. You believed that each horse had a matching satchel of gold pieces. Jordan had supplies strapped to his back. You had felt a certain distain towards that magician when you first met him, but now you were eternally gratefull and thankful that he had taken an interest in you and your three closest friends.


You already feel a special bond to Baron. It seems like he can read your thoughts. You mount him and ride over to where Ryan, Leiah, and Casian were. Noticing that they were ready, mounted and each looking a bit more confidant, though Casian could not figure out where to put her deadly looking staff. Leiah always being the perfectionist and noticing the details, pointed out a small button near the red crystal. Casian pushed it and the blade retracted and the staff seemed to shrink. It stopped shrinking at, what you would assume was, sceptre size. You got their attentin and asked the all important question. "So now that we're out of that stupid forest, do you guys want to go into another one or into the mountains?"

"Mountains." Ryan quickly answered.

"No way I'm going into another gross forest!" Leiah announced.

"Majority rules." Casian replied.

It was settled you would set off eastward into the the mountains looming in the distance.

The question is: will you set off promptly while there are still a few hours of daylight left and plan on the way?

Or wait until morning and plan your path tonight, and do some powers training (or trying out whichever you perfer?)
1111111111.title: The Way is Clear

choices: Skip the boring stuff....ur at the base of the mtns now...
11111111111.content:
You set off quickly wanting to get as much distance between you and that Godforsaken forest as possible, though Ryan was a bit reluctant to leave his birthday present(the Beamer) in the middle of nowhere. The going is easy, but after a few hours of planning, thinking and riding, your mind, mouth, and butt are ready for a rest. It seems you've been riding for countless hours, though the sun is just now starting to set behind you. At least you know the sun rises and sets the same on this planet.

The plan has been made: the group will work it's way into the mountains, until someone who can help is found, riding when it is coolest(for your sake and the horses), and eating as little as possible, not knowing how long the food strapped to Jordan's back will last. You stop when the moon(that you noticed was not the grey white color of home, but rather white with a blue hue about it) begins to make its climb towards the heavens. You and Leiah set about getting a dinner ready, while Ryan sets up "camp", and Casian tends to the horses. The horses seem unwilling to be tethered so he lets the roam free a bit, then they decide that they want to sleep with the four of you. They make a loose circle (each closest to it's master except Jordan who slept nearer to Chevallier) about the camp, acting as if they were your guardian angels. You eat a dinner consisting of meat pasties, some fruit, and a clear cool sweet tasting drink, that you named Ambrosia because it was what you would think ambrosia would be like.

You are getting ready to sleep, when you decide to look in your Maltir provided backpack. You notice a cloth inside. You promptly open it and lie it on the ground beside you, then four pillows, four fleece blankets, and five horse blankets appear within its' borders.

"Wha..?" Ryan says looking at the space beside you. You shrug and then look at the edge of the cloth a note is attacted it reads: My last gift, it will sometimes give you what your heart desires, but it will always give you what you need. You read the note outloud. Your friends are speechless, but you disperse the pillows and blankets and cover each horse with a blanket that has his/her name engraved upon it. Each of you is warm, almost full, and peacefull as you fall asleep....
11111111111.title: Guardians

choices: You try for one last look at the person and go on a sled ride for you mistake...
111111111111.content:
The next morning was bitterly cold you notice as you get up and your covers fall off. You are the first one up to see the wonderful sunrise. You think of waking them just to see the mulit colored sky, but you deside against it. You kinda sat and watched them rest before you desided to look at the surrounding area. After a little bit of searching you found a rock overhang that looks at the forest below.

You look over the edge and see some kind of person watching you. "Hey!" you call out. But they ran away! "Hey you!" Suddenly you feel the rock your on lurch forward.
111111111111.title: Oops

choices: The others awake and find out what happened.
You decide to climbed down the now climbable slope to look for the person
1111111111111.content: You leap off just in time. You watch as the rock starts a land slide that rumbles through the area leaving everything in complete din. The slide takes out a good chunk of forest which makes you think suddenly... I did that...
1111111111111.title: Land Slide

11111111111111.content:
"Jake! Are you okay?" Casian asked.

"What'd you do! I swear Jake you are so clumsy!" Leiah said with a sigh.

"Dude, you killed the forest. Totally massacred it!" Ryan laughed.

"First of all, thank you Casian for asking about my wellfare, and secondly it wasn't my fault. Some person was watching us, and I leaned over a rock for a closer look. My weight accidentally caused the hill to shift, causing a rockslide." You say remembering that odd person.

"Eww. Some guy was watching us?" Leiah said making a face.

"I dunno if it was a guy or not, but whoever it was, was creepy."

"I don't want to be watched by some creepy dude." Ryan said combing his hair.

"Let's see who it was. I mean it hasn't been that long, has it?" Casian suggests
11111111111111.title: Creepy Person....

111111111111111.content: The four of you carefully make your way down. Each loking for any sign of the person.Ryan whispers and points at a shadow flitting between the trees. You take off running, assuing that the others are running as well. You come across a small hut.
111111111111111.title: Flitting Shadow

choices: Wait for your friends to arrive
1111111111111111.content:
In all your excitment you forget your manners and burst through the door. It is dim lighted inside; with only a few dim candles around. There is simple furniture around, a wooden table, wooden chair, and a bed. You notice a small wooden shelf on the right wide with few sitting dolls.

There is no one around.
1111111111111111.title: Go inside?

choices: Shrug it Off--it's Just Your Imagination
1111111111111112.content:
You come to a stop, panting for air. Hey, it's been a long time since you ever had to run anywhere! That's what cars were for . . .

As you stand in front of the hut, you begin to feel uneasy. No one else has caught up (were they even following?) and it's weird to be all alone in such an unfamiliar place. Things didn't seem quite so odd when Casian, Ryan and Leiah were around. Now that you are alone . . . You glance back, somewhat anxiously. "It's cool. They'll be here soon. Maybe I'll just check out the hut while I wait." Your confident words do nothing to ease your mind.

Then again, you wouldn't want them to miss out on anything . . . You decide to wait for the others to catch up before you investigate any further.

As you wait, you begin to feel like you're being watched. What should you do?
1111111111111112.title: To Enter of Not to Enter

11111111111112.content:
Curiosity getting the better of you, you decides you really want to know who could have possibly been down there this early in the morning. Maybe they can help you? Or maybe....

You push that thought out of your head.

Slowly and steadily, you climb your way down, and make it safely to the bottom. You recognize the path the strange person took and follow it.
11111111111112.title: You decide to climbed down the now climbable sl...

choices: Brace yourself for a pain like no other...
1111111111112.content:
You lean forward to see the person dissapear behind a group of trees. Suddenly, the rock begins moving. You grab onto it like a sled and begin to move at a high speed down the hill.

You look up to see the trees heading to you...
1111111111112.title: Fun till someone looses an eye...

11111111111121.content: Somehow you survive your near extreme-pain experience. You brush yourself off. "Who was that person?" You ask aloud.
11111111111121.title: Who's That?

choices: They are looking frantically for you!
111111111111212.content: You make your way back up the hill. IT's slow going, as you feel battered and beat up all over. You have several bruises and even places where the skin was broken. But at least nothing is broken.
111111111111212.title: Nothin's broken

choices: Go Into The Cave With All Your Belongings (Horses Included)
Decide Not To Go Into The Cave It Might Be Dangerous
111111111112.content:
It took the four of you two slowpaced riding days to get to the base of the mountains that loomed before you. Nothing eventful had happened in those two days just riding, eating, sleeping, good-natured chatting, and some harmless flirting. The bond of friendship that was shared by the four of you before 'the landing' as you refer to it, is now so stong it could not be broken by the outside world. In those two days you spent talking with your friends their(and your) dreams, fears, hopes, desires, and much more had poured out. There were no secrets in this communal friendship.

You had been revisiting the last two days in your mind, going over everything that had transpired, when Casian's voice interuppted your thoughts. "Hey guys I think there's a cave of some sort over here."

Leiah was just finishing preparing the horses for a rest. She suggested that the cave should be expolored for any salvagable items seeing that the trek up the mountains would be a hard, and maybe even deadly journey and being over prepared is rarely ever a bad thing.
111111111112.title: A Cave In The Mountains

1111111111121.content:
"Maybe we should wait until tomorrow morning,it's almost sunset, and we need to make camp." You say.

The party agrees, and together you set up camp for the night.
1111111111121.title: Maybe Tomorrow

11111111111211.content:
The trip thus far had not only bonded the young adventurers to each other, but also allow them some safe time to explore the special talents that Maltir said they had been gifted with.

Casian had found she was excellent at getting the nightly fires started with nothing more than a soft spoken word. She was daily becoming more adept and slightly more annoying with her ability to send telepathic messages. I was afraid she was reading my thoughts as well as sending me messages. If she knew how I felt about her, we would both glow red.

Ryan could easily find water and detect animals throughout the trip. He is also noticably faster and more nimble than ever before.

I have the ability to change my appearence, and even my shape. So far I have been rather conservative in my efforts, but I have some fantastic things I want to try.

Leiah has shown the remarkable ability to heal our cuts and scrapes, as we return from battle with the underbrush.

Anyway....as was getting to be the pattern we set up camp, but Ryan had concerns about the entrance to the cave. "I smell some kind of animal, and it seems to have been here recently."

"Well lets take a look inside before we bed down" I suggested. "I certainly don't want to wake up as bear breakfast tommorrow". Everyone had a little laugh. As Leiah continued getting some food ready, and Casian removed the gear from our mounts, I pulled the 2 flashlights out of the packs and headed to the cave entrance with Ryan.

The cave entrance and as far as we could see into the gloomy depths was at least 7 - 8 ft high. As we walked inside Ryan remarked that the scent was definitly getting stronger and pulled the sword free from his hip. I began thinking of what I could defend myself with other than these two daggers.

Soon we came to a bend in the tunnel, and around the corner we found:
11111111111211.title: Inspecting before bed

111111111112112.content: As we rounded the turn in the cave we could see it was widening out into a cavern or a very wide spot in the tunnel. We could also tell by the scurrying sounds that something had seen our flashlight beams and was moving about. Slowing down I pulled one of my daggers and we panned our lights back and forth around the chamber.
111111111112112.title: The Cavern

1111111111121121.content: The cavern floor was uneven with stalagmite growth evident in many different areas. The chamber itself had an uneven ceiling that was only visible on the lower portions, and the deminsions of the space was hard to determine due to all the rough outcroppings and shadows cast everywhere.
1111111111121121.title: Cave...

11111111111211211.content:
<<Are you guys ok??>> Popped into your head, and by the look on Ryan's face it told you he got the message too. "Something or things are in here. If we come running out be ready to give us a spot of help..please", I asked. <<ok..becareful.>>

You see some items on the floor and pointed it out to Ryan. As the flashlights played across the area you identified the objects as piles of bones.
11111111111211211.title: Pile of... bones?

111111111112112111.content: In silent agreement you began backing up, but as one of the beams illuminated a shadowy section of cave you were treated to a host of reflections shining from many eyes.
111111111112112111.title: What's this?

1111111111121121111.content: Suddenly a rock flew out of the darkness catching you hard in the arm, and knocking the light from your grasp. You bent to retreive it but rocks began bouncing all around both you and Ryan and if one of them connected with a head, then you'd be in worse trouble than we already were in.
1111111111121121111.title: Rocks...

11111111111211211111.content: "Let's get out of here", became your battle cry as you scrambled for the tunnel and yelled the entire way as you ran for the outside. Ryan easily outdistanced you, but you could still follow the beam from his flashlight playing off the walls. You were spurred to greater speeds by the sounds of numerous scrabbling feet or claws behind you, but although they didn't fall behind, they didn't appear to be getting any closer.
11111111111211211111.title: Running

111111111112112111111.content: Finally you could see the light from the end of the tunnel and as you made your best speed to get out, something whipped throuh the air past your head going back into the cave. The objects departure was followed closely by screams and falling sounds behind you. As you broke out into the light of a decending sun, you saw that Leiah was pumping arrows into the cave as fast as she could grab them. You have rarely seen her so calm and focused.
111111111112112111111.title: Go Leiah!

1111111111121121111111.content:
Casian then yelled for everyone to get back as three or four twisted little furry bipeds came boiling out of the cave entrance. Ryan was right on top of them providing Casian with protection as she sent flaming orbs darting into the dark entrance from which they came. It was but a blink of an eye, then there came muffled explosions as flame and smoke curled up out of the cave.

The little creatures that ran out of the cave(we've been calling them Goblins) were laying in pieces at Ryan's feet. You all backed away from the mouth of the cave as the screams of the dying were upseting to all.
1111111111121121111111.title: So much death...

choices: Decide to not seperate and try the Flint and Steel
Make a quick run back to the car and get a lighter.
11111111112.content:
Looking up at the sky you notice that it will be getting dark in a few hours, and make the suggestion that we stop here and get started fresh in the morning.
Ryan suggest getting started now and Casian seems inclined to agree, but you point out that if we wait too much longer we'll be trying to find wood for a fire and make camp in the dark. As sort of a compromise you suggest to Ryan that while you and Leigh find wood, he and Cassian should ride up the way a bit and see if anything is in the area. (Who knows there could be a town or farm near).
To keep everyone from straying too far you ask Ryan and Cassian to return if they can't find anything after an hour. Ryan teases you, "Don't worry Grandpa, we'll be alright", and him and Casian trot off in the direction the Mountains.
You share a look with Leigh as you both dismount and Baron nuzzles against the back of your head. "Is this an alright spot?" You ask. "...actually I don't like being out in the open like this", says Leigh, and points to some large boulders "What about over there?" You nod, "Agreed", and you pick up a few sticks off the ground and head over to clear a fire pit. Baron follows behind like an oversized pup. Even though you're not looking at Baron you can sense he is right behind you, and watching you intently.
Before long you and Leigh have gathered an impressive amount of wood. Certainly enough to last the night. You have also cleared a small area for the horses and removed their saddles and riding tack. The sun is rapidly descending to the horizon and you look out hoping to see Ryan and Casian returning, but no sign yet. You inwardly cuss Ryan for always having to be so pig headed.
Looking through the supplies you notice a flint and steel, and debate with Leigh over trying the ancient firestarting technique or going back to the BMW to get hunt for a lighter. You decide to:
11111111112.title: First Night

111111111121.content:
"There really is no need to splitup is there Jake?" Leiah asks you.

"Well I've been camping with my Dad, and he could start a fire with a flint and a piece of metal. I'll try see if I can." You answer her. You set up a ring of rocks around where you will have the campfire.Leiah had already made a tent like stucture with the wood, three large pieces of wood standing up, grass, pinecones and brush underneath. You try to light the brush unsuccesfully. After over ten minutes of trying, you finally see a spark fly.It latches onto a blade of grass, you blow lightly. The grass withers and snuffs out.

"Dammit I wish we had that fire going already!" You hear Leiah shout from behind you.

Casian rides up to the campsite, Ryan following closely behind her. "Bout time you two got back."

"Shut up Jake, and watch me work." Casian says. "Fire" She shouts. A small flame appears in her upturned hand, she places the flame underneath the wood tent Leiah had made. Withing seconds the flame has graduated into a well burning campfire.
111111111121.title: Watch Her Work

1111111111211.content:
Leiah stares at her, speechless. Her mouth was agape and she seemed frozen where she stood.

"H...How... How did you do that!?!?" You stammer. Speaking for the both of you.

"Elemetery Watson," Casian giggled. "Remember our dear friend Maltir? He gave us powers! Ryan is ten times stronger, faster than the Beamer ever could have been, and all of his senses are at least double what they used to be. Maltir gave me magic! Can you believe it I feel like Merlin! Cept for the old guy part." She exclaimed.

"What can I do then, Cas?" Leiah asked.

"Well he said that you were the Healer, so I presume that you can fix just about anything. Also we figured out that we are both experts with the weapons he gave us. So that means that you are also our archer. Jake." She paused wanting your full attention. "Jake he said that you had the power of Metomorphosis. So you can turn into anything you want, or for that matter anyone you want."
1111111111211.title: Elementery My Dear Watson

choices: Turn Into A Wizard And Challange Casian!
11111111112111.content: Casian continued speaking about her discoveries, but all you could think about was your power. Metamorposis. What should I turn into? You think. Oblivious to what Casian was explaining.
11111111112111.title: What Should I be?

111111111121111.content: Well Casian continues talking, you decide to turn into a dragon. You interrupt Casian. "Watch this," you say and you turn into a dragon.
111111111121111.title: Can't Change Back?

1111111111211111.content:
You step on to the fire and it goes out. "Hey! You made the fire go out. I just made that fire." says Casian.

"Watch this. I can also make fire." And you breathe fire on to the fire pit. "See. Plus, my fire is a lot hotter than yours. Now, I'm gonna change back."

You try to change back, but you can't. "Ummmmmm," you say," I can't seem to change back. I haven't practiced my Metamorphosis yet. I'm not strong enough with my powers. Leiah, do you think you could use your Healer powers to try to change me back?
1111111111211111.title: In trouble...

choices: Flee by yourself into the forest
11111111112111111.content:
"Idiot" she mutters under her breath before waving an arm in a circular motion and shouting "Return!"
You feel the same tingling sensation as the first time but this time it feels forced, almost...painful. However before you realize it, you are back to normal, "Now that was cool!" You say.
"Yhea, real nice dude, you turn into a dragon, put out the fire nearly trample us to death. Real 'cool'" say Ryan mockingly.
"Stop it" Leiah says before you two can get into a fight, "We have bigger worries, look at the fire." You look down to see that the wood is burning incredibly fast and that the blue flames that came out of your mouth were flickering.
"Uhh... guys maybe we should" At that exact moment the fire goes out and a piercing cry radiates through the forest. The only thing you could think of when you heard this was a raven that has survived for centuries just to feast on the dead rotting carcasses of the light. You don't know why you had this thought but you knew before the flame appeared in Leiah's hand that the creature was perched on the tree directly above you, it's black souless eyes staring at you, unaffected by the darkness that holding to you. And when the flame did appear you did not notice the shouts or the person clinging on to you but you saw it's eye's first and you saw it's beak joining with the head of a human, and you knew that before this quest even started you could all die here.
"Foolish children" It said with perfect clarity but in a rasping cracking voice. Ryan was gripping the hilt of his sword with white knuckles but was too terrified to move. And your horror rose as the creature stood. The body was that of a grown man, bare chested and lean strong and taunt. But its head was that of a raven, its black and mangled feathers continued down it's shoulders and down the back to form in to a pair of giant wings that it folded around it's body like a robe. "The magician has blessed me by sending me such lovely play-things." He cackled mad laughter in that same shriek. You could now only think two words 'fallen angel'.
He leapt from the thirty foot high branch and effortlessly and landed in front of your group. He look at each of your faces inquisitively and when he came to you you couldn't help but look away, it was those eyes, those black, animal's, eyes! And he would not stop staring, and to look into those eyes you knew what it was to die. At last Leiah stammered "Wh-what are you?"
The feathers raised, you could sense that he was waiting for you to ask this question. What seemed to be a hundred voices spoke at once as his eyes turned red and this sentence chilled you to the bones more than any other, because it wasn't a trick, but it was voices and they spoke from many miles. "I am a small part of Legion and I work for he who goes to and fro' from earth, he who is belittled and by that he wins because he will not belittle himself with killing, he who was in the desert-" You felt like arms were reaching from the groung and grabbing at you, hurting you "And tempted He Who Never Was for thirty days." This fear was growing, you couldn't move, you couldn't fight it, you were fading, fading...fad-
"STOP IT!" Casian shrieks! "Please stop it!" Whatever trance this thing had you in was now broken and you could finnaly move but the fear remained. And your legs wanted to carry you into the forest. Stay- fight-your friends might need you, or find whatever saftey there might be in the forest. Yourself or them. Because you couldn't help it, when it's eyes turned red you forgot what it was like to die, but gained the knowledge of what it was like to go to hell.
All this happened in less than a minute though it seemed a century.
11111111112111111.title: The Fallen Angel

choices: Try to call the wizard using the pendant
Try to turn into one of the creatures and talk your way out.
111111111121111111.content:
You look at the forest longingly and you almost run, but you think They're my friend, I can't leave them! I can't... And you turn and did one of the hardest things in your life, stare at that creature, that horrid creature. No , you think, That damned creature.
Casian was the first to act and simultaneously lifted here arm palm facing the creature and yells "Fire!" The small flame in here hand earlier did not compare, this was a flaming mass easily half the size of you. You think this could be over before it starts. The creature however was not phased, but rather the moment the fire was seven feet from him he flapped his wings once so fast that you could barley see them, and cry's "Kee-en-ti-ti!" Like a raven in that half growl half shrike.
Before you knew what was happening Casian was on the ground shrieking (like a raven you couldn't help but think) with a giant black burn covering her entire chest and by the time you turned around Ryan was confronting the beast his double edged sword drawn. This is happening too fast, what's going on!?!
"What did you do to her!" The creature cawed laughter.
"I simply gave an example," His laughter tapered down as he slowly spread his wings to their full and imposing length of seven feet while opening his hands to reveal five inch talons where there should have been nails,"an example as to the beginning of a long and painful death that each one of you will experience." This was the signal that started the fiercest one-on-one battle you had ever seen in your life.
Ryan swung his sword sideways sideways so fast you could hear the air being cut, and the creature grabbed it in one of it's taloned hands. Ryan held on to the sword with one hand while turning forward and high kicking. The creature flapped his wings once to propel him back and dodge the blow. "If I had not know your origins, I would have thought you were an elf by the way you fight." It snapped his beak "A young and inexperienced elf." It once again used his wings, only this time to propel him forward with the speed of a bullet. Ryan rolled onto his back and when the Creature was directly above him he kicked both legs straight up catching the thing directly in the chest, but as the creature is sent flying into the air it sunk it's talons into Ryan's shoulders and takes him with him. You see the creatures black eyes and realize that it was enjoying itself. He then threw Ryan through the air as he took flight. Ryan landed square on his back. You thought surely he was dead, no one could survive a fall that intense, you had let him die but really you doubted the wizard's abilities. He stood back up and pointed his sword at the creature. This little feat served to bring you back to reality.
What am I doing? You look and see Leiah putting her hands on Casian trying to heal her, and you see Ryan risking his life and I'm just watching. You know that if you confront the creature head on you will be killed, even Ryan with his enhanced abilities was losing. You have to think what can you do or change into to save them. You think of two ideas, the wizard said if you ever need his help simply use the pendant, but he never said how, or you could possible turn into one of these bird creatures and try trick the beast. But how would you do that either!?!
111111111121111111.title: Battles of Fire and Sword

1111111111211111112.content:
You activate your power.

Your nails extend into talons. Your arms grow feathers and extend into wings.

You feel the creature's magic rise in you and you say to it "LEAVE HERE NOW"
1111111111211111112.title: Try to turn into one of the creatures and talk ...

11111111112111111121.content:
The creature stands still.

"LEAVE HERE NOW" you repeat.

While this is going on Ryan has recovered and slices the head off.

"You can't kill me that easy" the creature says.

He turns into smoke and goes straight into you.

You try and turn back to human but you seem to be stuck.

countine
11111111112111111121.title: Kind of.

choices: Everyone is still and doesn't know what to do.
111111111121111111211.content: You don't what is happening and suddenly the dragon stops. Everyone looks in complete shock as the dragon falls to the ground. No blood. No attacker. Not even a scream.
111111111121111111211.title: continue

111111111121111112.content:
No, no you thought not those eyes!!! You can't take it, this is too much, you have to get out of here! I mean, you never asked to come here! They can't hold you to it! So what do you do, how to escape? Transformation but into what?... A rat. Small compact, fast sly, manipulating, coward. You try to deceive yourself that you didn't think that because you were really a rat, but as the transformation began and you took a final glance at your friends you knew that's what you were.
But I'm safe and they're not
Yes, but at what cost?
You scurry out of the clearing and amidst the dying grass now taller than you, and dead rotting leaves, you felt as this place was reflecting your soul.
You rat!
I'm not really a rat, I just look like one!
And you run from that greater than your self, truth.
You argued with yourself. You were starting to feel safe, you must have gone at least a mile. Never daring to change. Then there is a short, majestic, and mysterious cry. It brings fear to you inside your spine, but you knew it wasn't the creature... But what was it?
Soon you realized it. An owl and before you could move it's talons ripped into your spine. Your last thought I sacrificed so much to get away from the creature; My friends, and by doing that perhaps even my soul. Just to be killed by another bird.
You rat
111111111121111112.title: Rat

111111111121112.content: "Up for a challenge Casian?" You ask smirking at her. You think 'wizard' in your mind.... You look down and notice your long white beard, your bright blue robes, a wand in one hand, and a spellbook in the other. Of course! Merlin! Merlin was what you had always thought wizards looked like. "If I presume correctly, I now have all of Merlins powers." You pause. "Care for a Wizards' duel?" You ask with a smug smile on your face.
111111111121112.title: You Up For It?

1111111111211121.content:
"Wana duel?" you ask Casian.
She stops her explanation and stares at your new figure. She rolls her eyes. "Sure I will," she says.
You swing your arm at her concentraiting on throwing a ball of fire, but nothing happens.
Casian blows you on your back knocking the wind out of you. You give up and Revert to your normal self.
"Now if you would have waited you would have heard me say that your powere is to change into whatever you want. That doesn't mean you can change powers," Casian says.
Leiah giggles at your embarrasing deafeat.
"What are you laughing at?" you ask.
"Oh, nothing" she says.
You grind your teath, not being used to having two bad ideas in such quick succsession.
"Now if we continue, I think--"
you cut her off, "You think! who made you the eader? What just because you can do some magic you think your the leader? I think we should vote!"
"You guys we can't argue like this no one gets to be the leader. We all work together," Leiah says.
"We'll be more deciseive if one person makes the decisions. If we have a vote though no one can vote for themselves," says Ryan.
1111111111211121.title: Who's the leader?

choices: Try changing into a Mountain Lion
Try taking it easy and changing the color of your hair
111111111122.content:
As you turn around to look, Baron is almost on top of you, just like if you had called. You tell Leigh not to wonder off, and you'll be back in a sec. Deciding not to both with the saddle, you vault up onto Baron's back and surprised at how easy it seems you swiftly head back to the BMW.

Back at the car you rifle through the glove compartment and fish out 2 lighters and a pocket knife. Feeling fotunate for your good luck you head back to the camp site to show off your provisioning skills.

The wind whistles about your ears, whipping your hair back and you and Baron move as one. You never thought bare back riding was this easy. In just a few minutes you arrive back at the site and you find Leigh has cleared and area and laid out the bedrolls.

Leigh looks up smiling and slightly relieved as you enter the camp. You slide off Barons back, you see it's about time to get the fire started and hope your other two friends arrive soon.

Brandishing your valuable discoveries, you quickly have the fire blasing away. Suddenly it feels more like camping at home, than lost on another world. You pull up a log and sit down with Leigh by the fire chatting quietly. You talk about the new abilities the Wise-One said you now had and wondered how it worked.

Leigh said she guess she wouldn't find out her's until someone was hurt, but that I should try mine.

"Change into something", she says. "The Old man said your power was metamorphisis" You hold out your hands and wait but nothing happens. Leigh gets impatient..."No...do like in the movies... close your eyes and imagine that you are what you want to be".

Closing your eyes you have no idea what to be. Finally you decide to try:
111111111122.title: Fire.....just like camp

choices: Warn the others of what you saw.
1111111111221.content:
You imagine how a mountain lion looks and slowly, you feel different. Your hands grow massive amounts of hair and your teeth turn sharper and longer. Your eyes become slanted just like a mountain lion's and you finish your transformation.

Leiah gasps and Ryan starts laughing.

"Awesome, Jake. You look better now than you have since...I don't know when!" Ryan jokingly laughs.

"Shut up, Ryan!" Cas yells. "What if he can't turn back into a human?" Cas asks as you begin to feel appreciated.

A sudden wave of fear hits you as you see a shadow move behind Ryan.
1111111111221.title: A Mountain Lion You Are

choices: It tells Ryan What He Wants To Know
11111111112212.content:
"Ryan! Look behind you, quickly!!!" You cried out to him, half roaring, half shouting.

He whipped around. Fast. He grabbed the shadow, it was a...? "What the hell are you?! And what were you doing?" Ryan screached. The creature he had grabbed was about four feet tall, with green leathery skin, huge catlike eyes, it looked quite harmless, until you saw the immense claws it had on its' hind feet. The creature whimperd as Ryan held it by the scruff of its' neck. "I'll ask you again," He said calmly starring straight into the creature's eyes. "What are you and what were you doing?"
11111111112212.title: What Are You?

111111111122121.content:
Ryan shook the creature again, "Tell me!" He shouted.

"Pali pleads with good sir, do not kill Pali. Want only munchies for Pali's sick friend Chiru. Want Chiru live!" The creature named Pali cried. Ryan put him down.
111111111122121.title: Pali

1111111111221211.content:
Casian bent down to Pali's level. "Pali was it?" Casian started. He nodded. "Well my friend Leiah can heal very well." She said as if she were speaking with a small child.

"Which friend? Not scary friend, hopes Pali!" He replied refering to Ryan. We all laughed.
1111111111221211.title: Which friend?

11111111112212111.content:
"No scary Ryan isn't the healer, I am." Leiah said.

"Ohh well pretty lady not mean to poor Pali, Pretty lady will help Pali's friend?" He pleaded to her.
11111111112212111.title: Help please

111111111122121111.content:
"Of course where is your friend?" Leiah added, blushing a little bit.

"Not far, only over there." He said pointing to a small grove of trees.
111111111122121111.title: Over There

1111111111221211111.content:
"So guys are we packing and going with him?" You say piping up. You focus on changing back to your regular human self. Pali's eyes grow wide with fear as you finish your transformation.

"Big kitty no big kitty no more!" Pali said astonished.

"Yea Pali it's okay though." You say. "Take us to your friend so we can help, or Leiah can help I mean.
1111111111221211111.title: AHH!

11111111112212111112.content:
You had been walking for a few minutes, but then Ryan gets the feeling that something, or someone, was following them. Ryan noticed you as you kept glancing over your shoulder.

"Hey what's wrong?" he asked. You were about to tell him that you though that something was following them.

"Hey you two are falling behind." Leiah said, grinning. There was a sudden crack behind you and you swiftly turned around. You were facing a small gray fox-like creature, but it had three black fluffy tails and very long white bunny-like ears.

"Sapphy here is! Found her Pali has!" Pali cried in joy. He hugged the fox-bunny-thing called Sappy. Cas hears something else.

"If we're going to help your friend, then I suggest we get going." she said. You nodded in agreement.
11111111112212111112.title: A Strange Creature

choices: Remembering the Gargoyles cartoon you add some wicked looking wings to your own
You change your skin to that of a chameleon, and turn the color of the rocks.
1111111111222.content:
Wanting to minimize the potential for disaster, and realizing that you can try the harder stuff later you concentrate on transforming you long brown hair to a shorter spiked look with blond tips. The gasp form Leigh lets you know that something has happened, and it's probably time to look. Opening your eyes you see Leigh frowning and smiling at the same time.

"Well it's cute, but hardly a dragon", she says. You just smile, and shrugg "I never even thought of a Dragon, but I guess I know how it works".

"Do something else" she says, and you tell her you'll try one more thing. "What should it be?" you ask, "but no dragon ....yet".
Leigh thinks for a second..."Try something that flies...at least it would be useful". You get a crazy notion and smile as you close your eyes.
1111111111222.title: Blond, Spiked Hair

choices: Go fly off and look for the others
11111111112221.content:
"Ok...how's this?" You close your eyes, then quickly open them and start removing your shirt and jacket. "Don't want to rip them up", you say as you re-close your eyes. You never even see the slight smile that creases Leiah's lips as she looks at your bare chest.

Envisioning your new wings and a large leathery wing span, you feel an electric tingling running up and down your back. You can also sense other changes taking place as your upper body muscles enlarge to handle its new assignment. The sensations soon reach a climax and then begin to gradually subside.

Sensing that the transformation is complete you open your eyes to find Leiah standing with her mouth half open in amazement. Looking over your shoulder you flex your new muscles and your wings spread out, sturdy and powerful.

Pumping your muscles lightly, your new wings beat the air sending clouds of dust swirling off in all directions. With just a bit more effort you feel yourself growing lighter as your feet gradually leave the dirt. Two feet in the air, then three, you realize that your wings are an excellent size for your body, and you feel like you could do this all day without getting tired. You could probably even carry someone.
11111111112221.title: Airborne

choices: You listen to Ryan and Casian, as Leiah continues to rumage
111111111122211.content:
Before your feet even hit the ground you hear..or did you sense it in your mind...the sound of someone clapping..applause. You gain the ground under your feet, and your wings automaticly fold up against your back. You walk over to Leiah as you look around, and at the edge of your camp you see two riders approaching. You quickly identify them as your two friends.

As they approach, Ryan begins clapping and you realize that his clapping wasn't what you heard before. "I see you two have been busy" as he walks his horse around behind you to see your wings..."Very impressive". "Thank You", you say as you smile, proud of your accomplishment. {"I like them too"}, and once again you feel rather than hear the sounds. You look to Casian as she smiles smugly.

Ryan and Casian dismount and you all walk over to the fire. You pull up another large log (This time it feels like it weighs almost nothing), and you four sit down to talk, as you ask Ryan if they found anything.

Still listening to the conversation, Leiah walks over to the supplies removed from Jordan the pack horse. She picks up a large pack and brings it back to the fire, and starts pulling out various articles from the pack.
111111111122211.title: End of the first day.

choices: You decide that everything is safe and everyone can go to sleep
You are uncertain of what is out there, and decide to split up the night and sta
1111111111222111.content:
Ryan tells you how they found a worn trail just a little ways off to the north west. The trail then heads through some sparse forrest growth leading up to the foothills of the mountains. Despite the mountain appearing close, he says they must be enormous "because for all the riding we did we never reached the base".

Casian mentions that although they didn't see any people, they did see horse tracks and a boot print along the trail in the foothills. She says that her and Ryan also tried to see what they've each been gifted with.

"And...?" you ask impatiently.

Casian smiles knowingly as she holds out her right hand and cups her other hand over it. Suddenly there is a flash of light from between her fingers, and when she uncups her hand there is a floating, tennis ball size globe of fire in her hand.

Everyone claps politly and Casian smiles happily.

All eyes then turn to Ryan who admitted to increase strength, stamina and dexterity, as well as an ability to locate water.

Leiah states that it appears that someone will have to become hurt before it seems she will be able to show off her talents.

Ryan is quick to roll up his sleave and displays a nasty red welt running up his arm. "Fix me up little lady", he smiles.."I took this injury in a battle with some briars hanging over the trail".

Leiah moves over next to Ryan and gently passes her hand over the wounded area. Within seconds a soft glow eminates from the underside of her hand bathing the wound in light. As the light fades only a light pink line of healed flesh remains.

For an hour or so more everyone is too excited to sleep, and Leiah passes out some tasty food scraps she found in one of the packs as everyone talks about our plans for tommorrow. Finally however the events of the day begin to show in everyones faces, and sleep i the next order of business.

Pulling Ryan to the side you discuss sleeping conditions.
1111111111222111.title: Sleep

11111111112221112.content:
Before bedding down for the night you air your concerns with Ryan over your safety. He shruggs, "Jake I think it's ok here. Casian and I rode for over an hour and didn't see a thing".

You nod in agreement, "That may be true, but why would someone gift us with all these survival skills if it was perfectly safe?" You point to your wings sticking up over your shoulders. "Lets at least leave one person awake at all times. With 4 of us it'll only mean a 2 hr shift for each of us. Ryan nods in agreement.

You announce it to the girls and Casian wants to pull the first watch. Ryan is next, then yourself, finally Leiah. You all retire to your bedrolls as Casian sits on the log tending the fire.

It takes just a few minutes to get comfortable, but then you fall asleep so fast that you don't even remember closing your eyes. It's dark, cold and damp when Ryan nudges you into wakefullness. "Common Jakie-poo, it's your turn".

You sit up rubbing your eyes as Ryan passes you the flashlight and fire poker. "I've heard a few noises around the camp, but you know how it is in the woods." he says quietly. Still before I go to sleep again I'd like to look around.

You throw back your covers as you pull your boots on, and pick your daggers up out of the dirt.
"Sounds like a plan", you agree. "How do you want to do it?"

"Well I'm gonna go pretend to take a pee, then circle around the camp. If I call come help me or if I flush something out then get it.", with that Ryan heads off behind the rocks.

As he departs you think you hear some movement in the bushes off to the right. Your eyelids flutter slightly as your enlarge your arm muscles and turn your fingernails into razor sharp talon's. Whatever comes out of those bushes, you want to be ready.
11111111112221112.title: Shift Change

choices: Pull your daggers and stand between the threat and the girls
Put those lovely claws and muscles of yours to good use
111111111122211121.content:
Suddenly there is a yell (was that Ryan?)...a growl and the bushes shake. A small figure (maybe 4 ft) rushes out of the underbrush. He is covered in brown fur and has dog like features. He is dressed in leather armor and carrying a short spear, and upon spotting you he aims his weapon at you and charges. Right behind him the bushes explode and 4 more of them come rushing out, and toward you.

You decide to:
111111111122211121.title: Rude Awakening

choices: Tie up the two remaining creatures.
Kill the two remaining creatures before the wake up
1111111111222111212.content:
Your adrenlin is pumping as you release a feral growl that amazes even yourself. You launch yourself at the first of the viscious creatures, and with one powerful swipe from your right arm your talons rip clean through the throat of the dog faced creature. The smell of expelled bowels and wet dog assault your senses as you cast the limp body back at his comrades, successfully bowling over two of the attackers.

Disorganized by the ferocity of your attack, you sweep into their midst before they are prepared to attack or defend themselves. A clubbing to the head drops another to the ground as the only target standing back pedals rapidly while keeping his spear raised toward you. So preoccupied is he with your devestating attack that he doesn't even realize that a sword tip has suddenly sprung out of his chest.

Ryan wipes his blade on the dying creatures fur as he steps into the clearing. "Missed me?" he ask as he cuts down another creature which is getting up and out from under his dead comrade.

As the pounding of the blood in your ears begins to subside you stand there with three dead, dog faced creatures and two unconscous ones. The girls are also wide awake and standing together staring at the carnage.

You decide to:
1111111111222111212.title: Attacked in the Night

choices: Head off to the trail, and then to the north
11111111112221112122.content:
You look over in the direction of the girls and they appear absolutly freaked. You can see Leiah and Casian's eyes pass over you and they seem just as frightened of you as they do of the dead bodies. Becoming more self conscious, you look youself over and can't blame them. Your arms are bulged out and misshapen, with elongated claws dripping blood. Not to mention the wings.

Ryan is talking to Cas and calming her down.

You close your eyes and imagine yourself back the way you were....maybe a little more muscular... but mostly the same. It takes but a few seconds and find yourself, more like yourself.

Walking past the bodies you turn them over and remove anything of interest. The smell of death is sickening and at one point you have to stop and throw up. Ryan joins you and soon the bodies are well picked over and you have a small pile of items to look over. Perhaps they can give you a clue to where you are going or why you are here.

A groan emerges from one of the downed dog creatures, and suddenly you have some decisions to make. The girls are closer now and begin hurriedly giving instructions to dispatch the two remaining creatures, but you are not so quick to cut them apart. Maybe they can give us some answers, but the others are more afraid and would feel safer with them dispatched. "What you gonna do Jake...Keep em' for pets?", and Ryan laughs.

Everyone else is quiet as Ryan walks around and silently runs through the two remaining creatures. You and Ryan drag the bodies away and under some scrub, then decide that you had all better get out of here soon. Just in case there are others. It will be sun up soon.

Sitting around the fire you all rummage through the loot. There are a few short swords, but they are in horrible condition, and not worth keeping. There are 4 pouches containing a total of 27 copper pieces and 1 silver. There is also one poorly drawn map and a bottle of blue liquid.

Passing the map back and forth you manage to approximate your current location...if you are correct there should be a large building or something to the north at the mountains.
11111111112221112122.title: First taste of  death

choices: Put the potion away and ignore the thought.
111111111122211121222.content:
You figure you stand the best chance when you can actually see clearly. The four of you set up camp and you sit at the fire studying the blue liquid. What could it be? What could it do?

As these thoughts race through your mind, another one becomes burning in your mind. You could drink it and see what happens.
111111111122211121222.title: The Blue Potion

1111111111222111212221.content:
Leiah gathers up the confiscated items and tucks them back in a pack. "This can wait until later", she states, "and since there is only one potion and it may be useful later, we're not going to be wasting it".

Ryan looks over at you and winks, but Casian catches the jesture, and adds "Wouldn't you look foolish to defeat five of the creatures and kill yourself with a bottle of poison meant for us in the first place?"

Ryan shruggs it off, "I wasn't gonna drink it...I was gonna get Jake to drink it", and laughs.

You frown, and roll back into your makeshift bed. "Wake me for my watch!" You call out, and pull the blanket up over my head.
1111111111222111212221.title: Night #2

choices: All of you go up and see what it is
Just you and Ryan go see first
11111111112221112122211.content:
Everyone having stood their turn at watch, the night passes uneventfully. As everyone gets up the need for water is clear. Got to brush these teeth. Wow !! Stiff backs and morning breath is the topic of conversation as you all pack your gear.

Mounting up, Baron seems in good spirits as he dances around waiting for the others to get on their horses. You even feel suddenly elated and anxious to get going. Maybe even run though a field.

You realize there must be some connection between you and your fine steed. You can almost taste his anticipation for the road...and maybe even a battle.

Seeing that everyone is up you look to the crude map that was in the possesion of the dog faced creatures. You head to the trail and Ryan pulls along side as you both discuss the best way to go and pass the map back and forth.

As the minutes on the trail turn to hours, you make a brief stop to share the last of the tasty treats found in Jordans pack. As the last of the food is consumed the need for continuing meals is discussed. Ryan and Casian say that they have already spoken about this and have figured that they could provide the next meal. You agree that given the obvious abilities that you 4 possess it should be little problem to find a meal. Specially since there has been plenty of evidence of animal life along the trail. Ryan adds that he believes he can sense water up ahead..fresh water. Everyone is eager to find some and as you all mount up and get back on the trail. As you crest the top of a hill you spot a thin trail of smoke comming out of the trees on the next hill top.

You tell the others and you decide to:
11111111112221112122211.title: On the Road Again

choices: An encamped garrison of the Dog Creatures.
111111111122211121222112.content:
At first everyone was eager to see if perhaps we had run across some people, but with a brief reminded of the creatures we encountered last night, everyone calmed down and started planning.

Despite the fact that both girls were eager they seemd to calm down quickly, and agreed to just me and Ryan going. (Perhaps they calmed down too quick).

Unstrapping my javlin from the side of Baron, I find it feels comfortable in my hands and if I had to I think I could use it as a lance or spear. Plus with as fiesty as Baron has been feeling I don't think any Dog Creatures would stand a chance.

Ryan had slid his sword free of his scabbard, and thus armed the two of us decended the hill we were on and cautiously began out assent up the other.

What we found:
111111111122211121222112.title: Approaching Cautiously

choices: Draw a blade to be safe.
Go over and comfort them that they are safe.
1111111111222111212221121.content:
I should have know that Casian wouldn't give up that easy, so i also shouldn't have been surprised, but things were kinda wierd. As Ryan and I ascended the steep trail we observed the air begin to waver...you know like on a hot summer day. Suddenly the very fabric of space itself ripped apart leaving a dark lined void approximately 8-9 feet tall, and who should come waltzing out, but Leiah and Casian.

"Hello boys", they smiled "You forget someone?" and as the rip in the air faded away, Leiah and Casian were left standing on the edge of the trail. "We found a short-cut", as Casian giggled.

Ryan cussed "Damn it Cas, this could be dangerous. I thought we agreed that you both would wait until be checked things out?"

Casian shakes her head "No...you boys argeed to that. Not us, but don't you worry we girls can take care of ourselves." and as she finishes speaking she hold up her palm and whispers into the air as her hand is suddenly bathed in fire. It looks almost like she is wearing a glove made of fire. Leiah smiles and notches an arrow to her bow.

"ok..ok, but be careful", I say as I pass by the girls and continue up the trail.

Getting to the top I could see that an attack had just taken place. There were two carts overturned on the side of the road and one appeared to have been set on fire. Three to four bodies laid about in the bushes and one in the middle of the road.

Ryan taking a quick apprasial of the situation road up and indicated that he would check up the road a little ways to make sure nothing would be coming back this way. Holding his sword across his lap he galloped off the other side of the hill.

Upon approaching the carts and seeing the bodies, Leiah dismounted and began checking bodies. Soon she was calling for help, and her and Casian began tending to 2 of the fallen people.

Actually they were more like big children in size, but you could see they were older. Perhaps Dwarves or Gnomes. I had never met any, but from the glow radiating from Leiah's hands it looked like I soon would be.

I dismounted from Baron and bid him go back down the trail the way we had come and keep watch. As he trotted off I somehow new he understood and would let me know if someone was coming.

Walking cautiously around the hill top I poked my nose into all the dense underbrush to ensure we were not being observed, or had overlooked any victems. Everything appeared to be clear, and just as quick Ryan road back up and stated than he had found nothing other than foot prints for over a mile.

Ryan dismounts and together we inspect the torn, bloodied bodies, finally stopping beside Leiah. Her and Casian are leaning over 2 small bodies that appear to be breathing. Noticing Leiah swaying on her knee's over the body you reach to see if she is alright just as she colapses.

Casian is quick and catches Leiah just before she hits the ground and cradles her in her arms. As you all look at her in concern you can see that she is breathing, but appears to be sleeping.

Just then one of the bodies she has been leaning over moans:
1111111111222111212221121.title: Enemies of my Enemies, are my Friends

choices: Speak to the man to find out more.
Look for other survivors and get Leiah to heal them.
11111111112221112122211211.content:
Not taking any chances, you draw your weapons and look the body over. Then Leiah jumps forward and tells you that he's obviously an ally.

Leiah heals the man's wounds with her potion and the man sits upright.

"You are the chosen ones?" the man asks, his eyes becoming bigger as he looks upon the four of you.

"Of course you are. Only the chosen ones could have healed me. Thank you," the man continues to speak. "Your quest lies to the North, in the land of the enemy."

"What do you mean, chosen ones?" you ask of the man.

"It was prophecized that four young adventurers from a different world would come to save the Crystals of Esylla. That is your quest, I know it," the man says quietly.
11111111112221112122211211.title: Your Quest is Revealed...Chosen Ones

111111111122211121222112111.content:
You leaned in intrigued by the hint that they may finally find out why you were here. "Please sir, tell me what you've heard of us, and our quest."

The dwarf stands up and looks at the distruction of his carts, and family. He see's Leiah with her glowing hands moving back and forth over the body of his younger brother. Shaking his head he motions to the side of the road and props himself up on the side of his overturned cart. "I just wish you had arrived sooner." he looks back at his brother and continues.

"We live to the South near the plains, just before the Dark Forest. It was an enormous, wealthy and productive city. It was a great place to raise families and find work. Now with the crystals stolen it lies mostly deserted."

Ryan interrupts, "but we just came from that way and we didn't see any city after the forest, was it distroyed?"

The dwarf shakes his head, "No no, it's still there, but it isn't on the plains, it's under them. The legends say that in the days before the Great Wizard's Counsel became displeased and destroyed the wicked of Esylla, there was a mountain of great importance there. The goodly creatures of Esylla were bid to live in the cities that the they had provided under the mountain. When the they had finished cleansing the evil from the world, and the peoples emerged they found that the mountain was no longer there." he coughed a little and continued.

"To give gratitude for sparing our people, seven temples were built to show our gratitude. Each temple was dedicated to one of the Wizards, and crowned at the peak with beautiful crystals which sparkled in the sun light. They accepted our offering and gave the crystals their power, which in turn brought light and prosperity to our city beneath the mountain."
111111111122211121222112111.title: The tale of the Crystals

choices: Ask him a few more questions, yet decline. (not your problem)
Ask him a few more questions, and accept the role of Hero
1111111111222111212221121111.content:
The older dwarfs expression grew grave as he continued, "in hind sight, I don't know if you can ever destroy evil completely, but we never knew. We were too busy expanding our city and farming our fields and basking in the good life that the Wizards had provided my people. We had no idea that over the centuries and evil force was feeding and growing to the North."

You supress the urge to point out that Evil Forces had always seemed to come out of the North in all the movies. You never heard of evil leaving the warm beaches in the south to come spoil your day, but you sit back and listen to the tale...

The dwarf goes into a coughing fit, and Ryan pats him on the back, as you summon Baron over and pull some water out of a saddle bag. After a brief rest he continues. "We had no idea there was anything to worry about, until one day the city went dark. We rushed up to the temples to see what had happened, and we were cut down by evil twisted creatures. There were thousands of them in all shapes and sizes, and despite our best efforts we were forced to barricade ourselves in our city until they had left. When it was finally safe to come back out it was found that the temples were still standing but the crystals were gone. We sent teams out to find and bring back the sacred crystals, but few returned. Those that did told of a Fortress in the side of a mountain to the north where evil creatures roamed freely."

In our darkest moment, when we were at a loss for what to do, we were visited by a wizard of great power. He told us to have faith for soon would come 4 powerful Hero's to reclaim the blessings of the gods for our people. One hero would have the power to Ward off Death, and be the protector of Light and fire. Another would have the power of shape changing and be the Protector of Nature. The third would be a Sorceress of Great power, she would be able to conrtol a man's thoughts, and the last would be a great warrior of unmatched skill, strength and endurance. The Warrior would also have a kinship with water and all it's forms." He smiled tentatively, "and here you are, as foretold. Whatever I may do for you, be assured that my brother and I are at your complete disposal." Finished with his tale he stands there expectantly looking in your direction.
1111111111222111212221121111.title: The Job Offer

11111111112221112122211211111.content:
"We don't want to have anyone at our disposal," you say, starting to smile.

"However, you could help us out with some useful information," Ryan cuts in the conversation.
11111111112221112122211211111.title: Monsters, and Such

111111111122211121222112111111.content:
"Yeah," Leiah interrupts, "Like, what are we up against? What lies in our future?"

"I can only tell you that the creatures that you will encounter are ferocious beasts. There's one of them now, in the distance," the dwarf says, pointing to the sky.

Everyone looks up and sees a flying monster. You've seen this creature in the books that you have read and can tell, even from this distance, that the creature is a dragon.
111111111122211121222112111111.title: Creatures like that...

11111111112221112122211211112.content: You all look at each other not knowing exactly what to say. Finally you speak up. "What exactly will we be up against if we go to the fortress?"
11111111112221112122211211112.title: Hero's at large

111111111122211121222112111121.content: The Dwarf clears his throat. "Well the fortress houses not only our beloved crystals, but evil artifacts that date from before the time of the great destruction. These artifacts are coveted by an evil wizard, and he has surrounded himself with all manner of beasts." He pauses. "I have heard of dragons, giants, orcs, and I am told he has even brought forth the dead, because they never sleep." He stops and spreads his hands towards us. "But surely this will not be a problem for the hero's of the prophesy. Will you help us?"
111111111122211121222112111121.title: Explaination

choices: Go straight away to the Fortress..
1111111111222111212221121111211.content:
"Excuse us, if you will." The Dwarf smiles and nods. You all huddle up and begin discussing the situation. (to cut it short) It is agree'd upon that the group would stand a better chance of getting home if this mission were finished. Casian believe's she can sneak all in invisibly, that way you all won't have to fight too many beasts. Based upon these two factors, the matter is settled.

Turning around to face the elder Dwarf you smile and say, "We accept, and will return the crystals to your people".

The Dwarf is clearly over joyed, and he rushes over to see how his brother is doing.
1111111111222111212221121111211.title: We'll do it!

1111111111222111212222.content:
You drink the Potion.

All of a sudden you start sinking into the earth.

"Help me" you say.

Who grabs you first?
1111111111222111212222.title: Drink the potion.

choices: Sort it out in the morning
Try and sort it out now
111111111122211121222221.content:
Leiah grabs you quickly followed the other 2.

They quickly pull you out.

Almost immediately wings grow out of Leiah's back.

You look yourself over and notice that the scratches from going into the ground have disappeared.

"I think we switched powers." Leaih says to you.
111111111122211121222221.title: Leiah

1111111112.content: You go into the forest, forgetting about your horses that were a GIFT! You take what was on Jordan's back and disperse it evenly.
1111111112.title: No more gift....

11111111121.content: After a while you can hardly see anything because of the density of the forest. Because the going is so slow and tiring, Goblins wait until you each become so exausted you can hardly keep one foot in front of the other, then they drop down from the treetops, tie you up with unbreakable vines and they cook you for dinner!
11111111121.title: Goblins.. Oh no!

111111111211.content: HEY I WARNED YOU TO KEEP THE HORSES! BUT NOW YOU'RE GOBLIN FOOD. Look on the bright side thought, at least the Goblins won't turn to cannabalism for a while since you four will feed them for some time.
111111111211.title: Chowing down....

choices: Chuck it! And Stick with Ryan
11111112.content:
You, Ryan, and Casian gather around Leiah."Just chuck it Le, we dunno if it's a good thing or not." Ryan says.

"Well I think we should take it! Besides it can't be bad."Leiah retorts.

"Why not?" You ask her.

"Well..um..."Leiah starts to say.

"You guys I don't want to sound like Spock or anything, be it is not logical for an inanimate object to be good or evil."Casian says to the group. "I vote that we take it."

Oh great a vote, you think. Now they are gonna make me chose wether or not to take it and what if I screw up and get someone killed?

"Hello? Earth to Jake! Knock Knock anyone there?" Ryan says looking at you.

"Huh?" You say, disoriented from your thoughts being interrupted.

"Keep it or no?"Leiah asks. They did exactly as you thought they would!

So will you keep the Pendant and hope to God it isn't evil taking side with the only two girls you've ever had crushes on, or get rid of it and stick with your boy?
11111112.title: And the answer is....?

choices: One of them decides to try out their so-called powers.
111111121.content:
You decided to leave the pendant you found in the ground all alone, and stick with your best friend Ryan.

"I agree with Ryan, everybody, so we should just leave the pendant here," you say, moving right next to him.

Ryan looked at you approvingly and relieved. He nodded.
