"Oh, man. Well, I'm glad we go that over with, and, anyways, what do we do now?" asked Casian.

She frowned. Casian thought that meeting with Matir was very strange and she wondered if it was just some guy playing a prank on them, or something.

"Hmm, I don't know exactly. That guy named Matir or whatever said that we were granted superpowers and I doubt that is true. See, I don't feel any different at all," Leiah said, turning around in a circle once.
111111121.title: Leaving The Pendant Alone

choices: Tell Leigh to drop it and run!
111111122.content:
"OK, OK, let's take the pendant."

You go out, but you only walk a few steps before the pendant begins to glow. Cas, Leigh and Ryan don't notice, but you know that at least Leigh would panic if she found out.
111111122.title: Alright, already...

choices: Being Leader Is Your Right..... Right???
1111111221.content:
"Leiah maybe you should leave that pendant here." You say.

"Why Jake?" She says.

"Because it is starting to glow, and it's pretty freaky." You answer.

She drops it. The glow begins to deepen. You along with Leiah, Ryan,and Casian were transfixed by its ureathral light. Everything is silent, then Maltir's voice seemed to come up from the earth. "Keep the pendent it is your only way home."

The pendent stops glowing altogether. Leiah stoops down and picks it up. She pick it up. "So who is going to guard our way out?" She asks timidly, unwilling for the burden to be placed on her shoulders.

Ryan refuses to take it, claiming it would ruin his image.

You and Casian are both willing to adopt the pressure of the leadership weilding the pendent will place upon its holder.
1111111221.title: Your Only Way Home

11111112211.content:
You decide to let Casian have the Pendent. After all she is the most intelligent of the group, and she's had just as much world experience as you, maybe more considering that she's been through the death of both her parents at the same time.

Besides those facts she was supposedly a Mystic now, so she's bound to have some kick ass powers to protect you, Leiah, and Ryan with. Wait a sec, protection from a girl? No you'll take care of yourself!

"So guys should we see if what Maltir said about our powers was true? Or should we just rest here for the night?"
11111112211.title: Not From A Girl

111111122112.content:
"I vote for sleep!" You say, suddenly aware of how tired you really are.

"Yea guys I am pretty tired," Leiah agrees.

"Well then it's settled then unless Ryan has any objections?" Casian says with an aire of authority about her.
111111122112.title: Sleep Is Good!

choices: all fall asleep without further ado
set up a watch schedule before settling in for the night
1111111221121.content:
Ryan shrugs. "Sure, why not? I'm tired anyway."

As he says it, you realize that you're tired, too. Sleep definitely is a great idea . . .

You . . .
1111111221121.title: *Yawn*

1111111221122.content:
"Not all of us can sleep at once, remember we have no idea about where we are, or what is dagerous." Ryan states. "We need to have watch shifts. I'll go first if you all want to sleep, we can change every two hours of so."

"Ryan what would we do without you?" Leiah says with a chuckle. "Honestly though you're right we should take shifts."

"So Ryan you'll take the first watch then?" You ask, wanting desperatly to lie down and sleep.
1111111221122.title: Ryan Has Some Good Ideas

choices: It Really Is A Dream, Not Your Shirt Yet
11111112211221.content:
It was decided that Ryan would have the first two hours, Casian the next two, you third, and Leiah would take the morning watch.

You quickly fall asleep. It was the deepest four hours of sleep you have ever had. When Casian woke you up, you could have swore it was all a dream.
11111112211221.title: Deep Sleep

choices: Then You Hear Light Footfalls Behind You
111111122112211.content:
"Good night Casian, see you in a few hours." You say with a yawn. The first hour passes by slowly. You fight the nagging urge to roll up into a ball and fall back asleep, but you fight it.

The second hour goes by with not even so much as a sound.
111111122112211.title: In A Few Hours

1111111221122111.content:
‘’Leiah,wake up ‘’ you try waking her by her shoulders.But she was sleeping so cute and deeply you start feeling bad to interrupt her sleep. ‘’Great, so the next two hours are mine too’’ you say a bit angry as you look around the dark woods. And all sudden some great idea had lightened in your head.

‘’I know’’ you said excitedly ‘’Why don’t I give a try to my magical power that Maltir gave me.Perhaps I may find a way to get us out here ‘’

You quickly get up and walked into the woods,not so far away from your friends ‘’ Hmmm…now whatever should I be? ‘’ you say yourself coming up with many ideas.

’’ I know, I’ll be a bird ‘’ you say imagining yourself as a big powerful bird with huge wide shiny wings.Asking this to your magic , all sudden your legs began to change shape, a huge tail quicly comes out from your back, large wide wings unfold behind you. You look at your hands ,seeing many sharp long claws on it. You had turned into a dragon.A big powerful blue dragon with a very shiny scale and many sharp horns following your back.

‘’What!!!NO NO NO! I asked to turn me into a bird! ‘’ you say quite loudly that accidently you slip out an ice beam from your mouth, freezing the tree front you solid ice. Great,so now you were a dragon who could freeze, seeming just so odd to you. ‘’Turn me back then!‘’ You imagine your ownself, hoping your magic were to change you back.But after so many tries it seemed you were stuck as this blue dragon afterall.

‘’Great,now how I’m gonna explain my friends about this.’’ .As you were thinking one of your friends had suddenly got up from the loud noises you made. Your eyes suddenly opened big and wide, started looking all around to see what you were gonna do.
1111111221122111.title: Wake Leiah

111111122112212.content:
You wake up to find yourself in one of Casian's grandmother's guest rooms. Ryan is still snoring on the next bed. After some initial disorientation, you realize that it was all just a dream, shrug it off, and try to get some sleep . . . you did stay up awfully late playing games with Cas and Leiah, after all . . .

Meanwhile, the world of Esylla is destroyed because the only ones who could save it refused to believe it existed . . .
111111122112212.title: Only a Dream . . .

1111111222.content: Suddenly, Leigh starts to glow, and she dissapears, her clothes falling on the ground.
1111111222.title: Oh, damn...

choices: She Comes back With Leiah in Ryan's Sweater
11111112221.content:
"Hot damn! Leiah is running around naked somewhere!" Ryan shouts.

"Shut up you are such a perv I swear! Both of you stay where you are. Ryan give me your sweater," She said. Ryan hesitated. "Now!" He complied with her knowing she was not the right pwrson to pick a fight with.

"I'm going to find her, see what the hell exactly happened, and bring her back. If I'm not back in an hour, Jake, since Maltir said you could turn into anything you want, I want you to turn into a fire snorting, ice breathing dragon, stong enough to carry three people comfortably. Yuo turn into that dragon, Ryan will get on your back, and I want you two to circle around and try to find us. While I'm gone, I want Ryan to Practice with that sword, and Jake, you, need to practice changing. Got it?" She instructed.

"Mam, yes, mam," Ryan says, saluting.
11111112221.title: Mam, Yes, Mam!

111111122211.content:
"Well that was strange...Oh well, Fire snorting Ice Breathing, Three People Dragon.That's what she wanted right?" You ask Ryan.

"Yea sounds about right to me."

You concentrate on Casian's description of what type of dragon she wanted.

**************************************************************************** ************************

The hour passed, without Casian's return...
111111122211.title: Concentration.

choices: You Find Them, And They're In Trouble!
You Do Not See Them Yet.
1111111222111.content:
After an hour you have successfully managed to change into Casian's exact specifications. You slowly begin to change. Becoming taller, longer, scales appearing on your body, a tail starting to form and your wings unfold from your back. They are an awesome appendage you think to yourself. Over fifty feet across and at least a dozen feet from top to bottom. Your feet lengthen and out of them erupt fearsome claws, the same happens with your hands. You are now almost through the process, all except your head and neck. Your neck becomes thicker and stronger, and your head changes to proportion with your now immense body. Horns appear where your hairline was, and your maw would put Jaws (The Great White Shark) to shame.

You finish your transformation, it had only taken but a few seconds, you put your wing to the ground so that Ryan could climb up to his place. He knew the drill, and he scrambled onto your back, carefully though.


You had added a saddle-like device onto your back, that way seating arrangements would not be a burden.

Now that you were ready, you ascend into the air. Swooping and diving gracefully and quickly. You circle the air keeping a sharp lookout for Casian or Leiah.
1111111222111.title: The Transformation

choices: Get Leiah And Casian Onto Your Back And Leave!
11111112221111.content:
You spotted them in a clearing several miles from where you had take off. At least a score of hooded creatures were attacking them. Leiah was wearing Ryan's sweater, behind Casian. Usually you would have thought this to be a cowardly act, but she was hurtling rocks over Casian because she had no weapon. Out of Casian's left hand she flung lightning bolts, and with her right hand she was creating a ball of pure energy.

You dove to the back of the creatures, Ryan jumped off of your back, sword in hand. You began to spit (what you called) ice-bombs at these creatures.

They were take aback at the fact that now they have four adversaries to deal with rather than two. At least half of them were slain, and the rest of them were injured or running to save their sorry hides.
11111112221111.title: Hooded Creatures

choices: You Land Right At The Castle Gate
Land A While Away, No Need To Alarm It's Inhabitants.

You lift the three of them onto your back. Each of them breathing hard, and thankful for rest. You on the other hand beat your wings, trying to compensate for the added weight that you did not anticipate. "Where to?" You roar in your dragon voice.

"How about that castle down there, Jake." Casian suggests. You see the castle a few miles to the northeast.
111111122211112.title: Compensation

choices: look for that stupid amulet before it does something else
ask Casian where she found Leiah
111111122212.content:
In a few minutes, both girls return. Casian looks very worried, but Leiah only looks disoriented and confused. At first, all you can think of is how incredibly sexy she looks only wearing Ryan's thin sweater (his letter jacket--he loved wearing it, even though it was like 100 degrees outside in LA). Once you manage to tear your eyes away from all that skin, you start to get worried . . . what had just happened?

You decide to . . .
111111122212.title: The Girls Return

choices: Run over and check it out...
or stay there and let Ryan and Cas. look it over first...
111112.content:
You and Leiah stop running. She pipes up, "Whatever forget them Jacob, we'll just walk behind them. K?"

"Sure Le, whatever you say...." You answer wishing it was you with Casian not your best friend/worst enemy Ryan.

"Jacob?"

"Yea Leiah?"

"Do you think I'm attra-" Her question was cut off by what sounded like a bomb plummeting towards Earth, or wherever you were. You look up to the sky and see a dark object falling at a very rapid pace towards a feild only a few hundred yards ahead of you.

Ryan and Casian are already running towards the thing that has now hit the ground


Do you:
111112.title: Flying Objects

choices: Find Somewhere to Rest for the Night...
1111121.content:
You along with your friends run over to it. You are fast coming upon a small crater. Ryan gets there first followed by Casian, you, then Leiah. The four of you peer into this crater. In it there is a rose (that was blood red), an small blue knife(it looks a lot like a swiss army knife without the casing), a white crystal, and a small green leather pouch.

Leiah and Ryan go down into the crater. "You guys that probably isn't a very good idea." You hear Casian say. You and Casian look unsurely at each other.

Leiah picks up the rose. "Don't be such a prude Cas, besides you'd absolutly love this crystal it's exquisite." Leiah answers back. With that Casian slowly makes her way down into the crater. You watch her going into it with Ryan and Leiah, still too timid to go into it yourself.

"Yo Jake! This pouch thing-y is pretty cool man. You'd like it." Ryan shouts up to you. You take a deep breath and head down the side. Before you could get all the way to the bottom, the sky darkens and you hear a soft whispering.

"Leiah hold the rose to your heart." It says softly but still commanding. Leiah does as she was instructed. The rose began to glow and then disappeared. "You have so much untapped love, do not let it spoil and turn into hate. You are the Healer, protector of the Light and Fire."

"Ryan hold the knife in both hands." He does so, and the knife begins to enlarge and is now a full fledged sword the scabbard hanging around his waist. "You are strong of spirit and body, you are the Warrior, commander of the Four Winds, Water, and all weather which comes forth from the two."

"Casian hold the crystal to your forehead." She holds the crystal to her forehead, and it attaches to her skin imbedding itself. She looks much like the Indian women with jewels in between their eyebrows. "Intelligent, cautious, and unaware of all the gifts you have. You are the Sorceress, wielder of all magic and the minds of humankind."

There is a small swift wind about you that tells you to get your item. You descend towards the pouch, the only item left unchanged. You pick it up. The voice then speaks again. "Jacob hold the pouch up to the sky!" You do so feeling very confused. A wind swirls around your arms and head. "A true companion through and through, quick of wit, and full of soul. You are the Guardian of Nature and the animal kingdom." The air was quite for a moment before the voice spoke again. "Use your gifts wisely, my children, and also use them fully! This world and all the works in it are now in your hands!" With that the crater becomes deathly quiet and the sky lightens until all is normal once more.

The four of you exit the crater and silently make your way towards the mountains in the distance.
1111121.title: A Voice

11111211.content:
No one has spoken in what seems like hours. The four of you walk at a steady pace, each,you are sure, thinking the same thing. Casian is the first to speak her mind. " OK what the hell just happened?"

Neither you nor Ryan nor Leiah answer her unanswerable question. She speaks again. "Hello people look down at your clothes, have none of you noticed they are totally different and we each have packs on our backs containing God know's what. I have a freaking crystal on my forehead, Ryan looks like Atilla the hun, Leiah looks like she could fix anything, and Jake you look like you're royalty! Now what gives?!"

While she was speaking each of you look down and around. You are wearing a pain of chocolate brown shorts a cream colored tunic, soft black boots, the pack Casian mentioned, a set of daggars at your waist, and the pouch you found at the crater around your shoulders.

You looked at Leiah, she was wearing a tight green blouse and beige suede looking pants, what looked like ballet slippers, a bow and arrows across her shoulders, and the pack.

Your gaze reached Ryan, he had a white tunic much like your own, grey pants, brown boots, the sword sheathed in its scabbard at his waist, and a pack on his back.

When you finally looked at Casian you noticed how angry (or was it fear you saw?) she was. You also noticed her look had changed as well. She had a long black cloak on with a large hood attached, a light brown form fitting very short dress, thigh high black boots, a staff in her left hand (it had a crystal the same as the one on her forehead, except it was much larger), and of course the pack on her back.

"Well," You started timidly, looking around at the three faces of your best friends, you see anxiousness in each so you decide to continue. "Why don't we check the packs, see if what that strange voice said was true, us having powers I mean, and look for a place to spend the night."
11111211.title: What the.....

choices: Look into these so called powers....
111112111.content:
"Great idea man." Ryan says, taking the pack from his back. You, along with Casian and Leiah, follow suit. You sit on the ground, everyone else does the same. Ryan's pack yeilded a pair of sandels with a note attached saying: place them on your feet have no fear, to speed you on your way. Casian opened her's next in it was a small bowl another not: fill it with water and see what might be or what can still be changed, a vision to help you. Leiah's pack held an empty bottle a note was attached to it also: collect the wounds and use your love to make it pure, to heal you on The Journey. You opened your pack last in it there was a large piece of lined that resembled a tablecloth and as expected a note: open it and eat your fill, to sustain you and keep you strong.

"Well this makes a lot of sense." Leiah says.

"Why don't we try them out, see if what the notes said was true." Ryans says already taking his boots off. He finishes lacing the sandals and stands up and begins to walk around. "Hmm... I don't see how this will speed-" He is cut off by his own body movement. He is moving so fast he is barely a even a blur. Then you see him next to you stopped eyes aglow with wonder.

Casian looks at her bowl "Jake do you still have that Evian from Ryan's car?" You look through your pack wondering if it had made it into there, it had... You hand it to Casian. She opens the bottle and pours some into the bowl, peers in. "Guys I see a fortress of some sort nestled in the side of a mountain. Do you think this is a real place?"

"It might be." Leiah responds, "I can't try out my gift because no one is hurt..."

"I got a papercut a couple of months ago will that work?" Ryan asks. Leiah walks over to Ryan with the bottle.

"Umm... How do I 'collect the wound'?" She asks.

"Maybe just hold the bottle to to the paper cut?" You offer. She holds the bottle to Ryan's papercut, and his finger begins to glow softly.

She takes the bottle away and inside is a black liquid. She holds the bottle unsurely. "I'm supposed to 'use my love'. Umm... I love you bottle." The black liquid swirls around and turns a pure white, a white you would expect only a unicorn would be able to posess. "Well it's turned, but what do I use it for?" Leiah says looking at the newly purified liquid.

"I guess we'll just have to find out along the way." Casian states. "Jake it's your turn."

You slowly begin to unfold the linen. You stand up and lie it on the ground. "It said it to 'open it and eat your fill'." On the linen food begins to materialize, a feast fit for, well four California teenagers.

"Do you guys wanna call it a night and eat or see if we have powers?" Ryan asks
111112111.title: The Gifts

choices: They all agree and you stay up with Cas.
Ryan gets jealous and suggests something else.
1111121111.content:
You decide that you are tired and hungry. You and your three companions begin to greedily devour the food and all to soon, the food is all gone.

"Oh, man. Now what?" Ryan asks.

"Oh please, Ryan, you couldn't eat any more if your life depended on it." Leiah replies.

"Oh...right. Well, still, we have no food for tomorrow, or the next day, or the day after...."

"God, Ryan, this piece of cloth will always give us food!" You exclaim rather loudly. "Let's just set up camp for the night." You suggest as you calm down.

Everyone rolled out the bag that they had been given in their pack. You make a fire pit in the middle of the four sleeping bags and gather wood. Soon, it gets really dark and the four of you are getting really tired.

"Alright, I'm going off to bed." Ryan says, exhausted.

"Wait, Ryan!" You jump up. "We can't all fall asleep at the same time. We need two people to share guard duty."

"But I'm so tired." Ryan and Leiah reply in unison.

"Then you guys go to sleep and Cas and I will take the first shift." You suggest.
1111121111.title: The First Night in the Woods

choices: Other goblins appear and attack you.
11111211111.content:
You sit at the campfire and look deeply into Casian's eyes. She seems so sad about something. You don't know why you didn't see it before. Her expression is blank, but there is definitely something being said by her eyes. You ask her what's bothering her and she replies,

"It's this whole thing. About being here, about the four of us in a strange place. We're not on Earth, we don't know where we are, or what we are meant to do here."

You agree silently by nodding your head. Then, you see a shadow lurking behind Casian. You grab your daggers quickly and pounce forward, safely pushing Casian out of harm's way. The creature turns out to be what you recognize as a goblin from your numerous fantasy books back home.

His sharp teeth glimmer in the darkness and you can see that he has dark, green skin and dark, black eyes. He is holding a small knife and looks like he was about to attack. Holding your two daggers in front of you, Casian joins you, holding her staff in a threatening position. You lunge forward and land on the ground, just inches from the foe. A small tremor in the ground with you in the center, knocks the goblin back. You raise your daggers, threatening the goblin, and a spire rises from the ground, throwing the goblin back about twenty yards from where he was laying.

Then...
11111211111.title: A Lone, Goblin Scout

choices: The same voice from earlier speaks to you.
111112111111.content:
You approach the goblin, but out of the bushes, about twenty more appear. Casian joins you and she has apparently alerted Ryan and Leiah who join you, armed and ready for battle.

Ryan glances to the spire and says, "Jake, I would never have expected you to do that. Casian told me all about it, nice work!"

"Thanks Ryan," you reply, "But let's finish these guys off and then I'll tell you more."

The goblins rush forward. Ryan takes a defensive stand with his sword raised above his head, pointed at the oncoming attackers. A flash of light, followed by a line of fire erupts from the tip of the sword, which is now glowing bright red. Casian holds her staff in front of her and points the jeweled end at the remaining goblins. Suddenly, a blue tint covers the ground and the goblins are frozen in a thick layer of ice. Ryan sticks the end of his sword into the ground and a blast knocks the goblins loose, and sends their fiery bodies flying through the air. The surviving goblins flee and you are left to think about what just happened.

Everybody remains silent when...
111112111111.title: A Heated Battle

choices: Like you're going to let Ryan make that decision...
1111121111112.content: "They may come back. We need to high tail it outta here." Ryan hurridly suggests.
1111121111112.title: We don't want more Goblins...

11111211111121.content: You weren't one to argue, especially with litle goblin things ready to kill you! The four of you gathered everything and then Casian spoke. "I'm a sorceress now right? So why don't I just transport us a few miles away?"
11111211111121.title: The Sorceress

111112111111211.content:
It sounded logical to you. Ryan, Casian, Leiah, and yourself held hands and Casian closed her eyes. You had no idea what she had done, but a few seconds later there you were miles away from the spot you once were at. She looked a little drained. "Maybe we should stay here for the night."

"Yea, Jake that's a good idea man. I know we're all really wiped out." Ryan agreed.
111112111111211.title: Tired Casian

choices: He continues arguing, refusing to sleep!
11111211112.content:
"Uh, no nevermind I'm not that tired. I'll stay up and take first watch." Ryan quickly states.

"Look Ryan you are about to fall over you're so wiped." Casian says, observing that Ryan can barely keep his eyes open.

"Yea man just go to sleep. Cas and I will wake you when it's your, and Leiah's, turn. Aight?"
11111211112.title: Ryan Won't Sleep

111112111121.content: "Alright I'll go to bed." He stated. Then he walked over to you and leaned over. "Don't try anything." He warns you.
111112111121.title: A Warning

1111121111211.content:
The shift went by slowly. You and Casian talked very little. You thought, and asumed that she was doing the same. "Jake?" Casian said softly. You looked at her. "I think our shift is just about over."

"Aight, I'll wake Ryan up, will you go get Leiah?" You said walking over to Ryan's sleeping bag as Casian got up to wake Leiah up.

After much prodding, they were finally awake. "Time for me to get some sleep cya'll in the the morning." You said to no one in perticular.
1111121111211.title: Sleep Time!

choices: Work your Magic With The Cloth
11111211112112.content:
"C'mon sleepyhead, wake up, we need to set off soon." A soft feminine voice lilted into your half awake mind. "Jake?" It was Casian. You felt a light touch on your shoulder.

You groaned noticably. "Cassi?" You say knowing that it was her.

"Yeah Jake it's me, you need to get up now, we have to eat and run. I had a dream that we were attacked. I think that since I have this Sorceress power lets me see things. Also I checked the bowl and it confirmed my suspicions. Get up we have to go!" She said her voice rising and becoming more urgent. "Besides you are the only one who can make that peice of cloth work." She said with a laugh masking her fear
11111211112112.title: Attacked

111112111121121.content:
You had figured out that the words that made the cloth work were "eat your fill". You uttered those three words and the cloth came alive with all types of food. Sweet breads smothered in honey or candied seeds and nuts. A fizzy citrus drink that woke you up better than any double espresso could. Then there were mound and mounds of fruit.

Dispite how beautiful and tasty the food was the four of you wolfed it down, without savoring any of it.
111112111121121.title: Beautiful Food

choices: Suggest that you set up camp for the night.
Suggest that you learn more about your powers.
1111121112.content:
You have created the food, but you're not all that hungry. Instead, you pack away the food and think about the powers that you have been given.

"If Ryan is gifted with the power of 'The Four Winds, Water, and all of the weather that come from the two," you start to say, "Does that mean that he has some really wacked out power?"

"And if I have the power of Light and Fire," Leiah says, "Then I wonder what kind of powers I have."

"Jake," Cas says quietly in your ear. "I don't know if I can be a Sorceress. I don't know anything about this sort of thing."

"Well, we can work together. I am the 'Guardian of Nature', whatever that means. It could be the elemental power of Earth, but I'm not sure," you say to help Cas out.
1111121112.title: The Extent of Your Powers

choices: Just Sleep, You are Really Tired
11111211121.content: The group starts to set up camp. When it is finally done, with a fire started by Ryan, thoughts and ideas are passed around the loose circle that was formed around the fire.
11111211121.title: A Fire

choices: You listen and hear grumbling voices.
You listen, but can't hear anything.
111112111211.content:
"Ryan," You begin, breaking the silence. "Why don't you try to use your powers, I mean, that voice said that we were given powers, right?" You suggest. He picks up his sword.

"What do I do? Wave my sword around and see what happens?" Ryan asks starting to swing the sword around.

"No! Wait! You have the powers of wind and water, you'll put out the fire that way!" You yell when you remember what the voice said when it was talking to Ryan.

Just as he was putting the sword down, a surge of water shot from the tip of the sword and poured onto the firewood that had taken so long to gather. The fire was extinguished and you were left in the dark with no source of light.

"Way to go, Ryan!" Leiah yelled angrily.

"Shh...guys, I think I hear something," Cas says in a hushed tone an expression of fear across her face.
111112111211.title: Ryan Puts Out the Fire

1111121112111.content: The four of you immediatly close your mouthes. As Casian mentioned there were noises. It seemed like a heated conversation betweed two gruff sounding men.
1111121112111.title: Gruff Men

11111211121111.content:
"Maybe we should see what it is that's going on, maybe someone can help us." Leiah says.

"Yea let's check it out." Ryan replys making his way towards the voices.

You follow him, Casian and Leiah close behind you. You see two very small, wide men arguing. What they are arguing over is not apparent. You peer at them. "Yo, Cassi, are those Dwarfs?" You whisper to her.

"Sure looks like it, huh?" She whispered back.
11111211121111.title: Dwarfs?

111112111211111.content:
"Excuse me!" You shout at them. The two small men looked at you, unsure at what they were seeing.

"Two Sires? And Good Ladies of the Moon and Sun?" The seeminly younger man asks.

"Huh?" Leiah says. Sires, Lady of the Moon and Sun? Each of us were puzzled

"Good Sires, excuse my brother, he is young and knows not of good manners. Please forgive him, and our bickering that must have brought you from your sacred resting place. Please come to our humble abode."The older one said gesturing towards the cottage only a few hunderd feet away from him.

"Wait one crazy second little man! What are you talking about. Sun, Moon, Sires, Sacred Resting Place???" Ryan exclaimed.

"Excuse me in advance for being short with you, but I AM NOT a little man. My brother and I are Gnomes. Magical Gnomes for that matter." The younger one snorted out.

"Whatever." Ryan said under his breath.

"Please come and eat with us, we will explain many things." The elder again gestured to his home.
111112111211111.title: Gnomes

1111121112111111.content:
Not wanting to offend the short-statured, bad-tempered, gnome did he say?, you walk quietly towards his house.

The four of you enter and are forced to crouch down to avoid hitting your heads against the low ceiling. Finally, everyone has entered the small dwelling and the gnomes sit down at a small table.
1111121112111111.title: The Gnome House

choices: Let the Gnomes do the talking
11111211121111111.content:
"Oh I'm sorry," the elder gnome says, "We're not used to having such large company. Let me help you feel more relaxed here."

The gnome lifted his hands and muttered strange words. Suddenly, like magic, the ceiling etends higher and higher until the four of you can stand straight without hurting yourselves.

"Make yourselves at home, my friends," the younger gnome offers.
11111211121111111.title: Gnomes are hospitable

1111121112111112.content:
"Woah," you hold up your hands, "We're not going anywhere until we know what's going on. Right, guys?"

The others nod in agreement. "Yeah, you just answer some questions first." Ryan adds.

The gnomes look at each other, confused. "You mean you do not trust us?" one asks.
1111121112111112.title: Trust Gnomes?

11111211121111121.content:
The gnomes look at each other, confused. "You mean you do not trust us?" one asks.

"That's exactly what we mean." Caspian snaps.

They shake their small heads. "Where are you from that you don't know of the honesty of Magical Gnomes?"

"Try Earth." you say.

"Earth?" The gnomes' eyes grow round and they fall on their knees. "They have come, the holy ones from Earth!" they chant in unison.

"What?" Leiah says, and she isn't the only one who's confused.
11111211121111121.title: I'm sorry?

choices: Listen to the voice and tell you what it says
Try to ignore the voice or make it shut up
1111121112112.content:
You all pause to listen. "I don't hear anything, do you?" Ryan asks.

"No" Both you and Leiah reply at the same time.

Casian waves her hand at you. "Shush, I'm trying to listen."

"Listen to what?!" You're getting rather frustrated.

"Can't you hear it? Someone's talking . . ." Casian whispers, an intense look of concentration on her face.

Leiah twirls her finger next to her head and mouths 'Crazy'. You glare at her and turn back to Casian.

"Cas, are you ok?" you ask.

"It's talking to me, telling me we need to do something . . ."

"What's talking to you?"

Casian thinks, then looks up abruptly. "I think it's the crystal!"

Leiah gasps and Ryan frowns. You are simply confused. "The crystal?"

Casian touches her forehead where the crystal is embedded. "Yes, that must be it."

What should Casian do?
1111121112112.title: The voice in Casian's head

choices: "Did someone write that down?" Ryan asks
11111211121121.content:
"What is it saying Casian?"

"Follow the trail of heroes past,
With all haste toward the setting sun.
The first destination found at last,
But tarry now before it is all done."
11111211121121.title: Say What?

111112111211212.content:
"Yea, I got it!" You say quickly. "But what does it mean?"

Casian comes out of her weird state and looks a little bewildered. "What happened?"

"You just went into a trance!" Leiah exclaims.

"Did I do anything?"

"No but you said something. Jake wrote it all down." Ryan says.

"We should figure this out before going any further..." Casian say looking at your. (You had grabbed a pun from your back pocket and there was no papaer... you had to improvise)
111112111211212.title: Improvising

choices: Go to Sleep--it's Not Worth It
111112111212.content:
You look around the group and notice that Ryan keeps nodding, Leiah's head is perched sleepily on her hands and Casian is trying (with some difficulty) to keep her eyes open.

"I don't know about you guys, but I am really tired. Maybe we should get some sleep and talk about this later." you say.

"Excellent idea." Ryan smothers a yawn, "You get first watch."

Before you know it, everyone is asleep around the fire except for you. It's becoming difficult to stay awake, but someone really should keep a look-out, who knows what dangers could be out there?

What should you do?
111112111212.title: *Yawn*

1111121112122.content:
At first you can't think of any songs to sing, but one suddely hits you.

"Home, home on the range," you start singing loudly. "Where the deer and the antelope play, where selom is heard a discouraging word-"

"Shut up!" A loud male voice says. "You aren't the only one in Esylla you know!"
1111121112122.title: Couldn't you have picked a better song?

11111211121222.content:
"Guys! Guys! Wake up!" You yell, tripping over yourself.

Casian shoots up, fully awake. "Jake? What's wrong?"

"Someone's out there, I dunno what to do."

"You invite the stranger to share your fire." A large, heavily built man said walking up to your camp. "It's proper Esyllan custom. My name's Kellem"
11111211121222.title: A visitor

choices: Tell him your story thus far
111112111212222.content:
"I'm Jake, this is Casian. My sleeping friends are Ryan and Leiah."

"Strange names you have, are you from around here?"

"Not exactly..."
111112111212222.title: Strange Names

choices: Talk to Ryan about what he is thinking.
Talk to One of The Girls
11111211122.content:
No one is tired, even though its been a long, eventful day. The sun sets and the four of you gather around a fire.

Ryan is inspecting his sword and is lost in thought about something. Leiah has her arms wrapped around her knees and is gazing up into the starry night. Casian is rubbing the gem in her forehead slowly, as if it were talking to her. You feel different and wonder how the others are feeling.
11111211122.title: Sitting Around the Fire

choices: Maybe We Should Think About This A Little More....
111112111221.content:
"Hey Ry, what are you thinking about?" You say to him, breaking the silence.

"Oh man, I don't know what I'm thinking. A lot of things I guess, like how I missed my date with Katrina Daniels." He said with a laugh.

"Boys!" Leiah huffed.

"I know." Casian started. "We are stuck in the middle of nowhere, endowed with magic, brought here to do who knows what, and all he can think about is his missed date with Miss I'll-Put-Out-With-Any-Guy-Who-Has-A-Car!" She said raising her voice with every word, almost to the point of screaming. "Look guys we need to figure this all out. Does anyone actually understand half the stuff that is going on?" She finished softly

"You're right Cas, we should be thinking about a way out rather than what seems to be our former life." Ryan said a sigh.

"Well why don't we peice it all back together: Ryan drove into a forest,that hadn't been there a few seconds before, some voice pops outta nowhere and gives us powers, we get new clothes,weapons and a sort of backpack type bag, we haven't even checked to see if we have powers, and no one is talking or trying to figure out what the hell exactly is going on!" You say finishing your speech.

"Well let's try out our so-called powers then." Leiah suggests.
111112111221.title: Jake's Speech

1111121112211.content:
"How about Ryan goes first, then Leiah, then Jake, then me." Casian stated.

"Yea sounds bueno to me." Ryan started. He paused. "What was my power again?"

"God Ryan... You are Wind, Water and Storm, Leiah is Light and Fire, I'm a Soceress whatever that means and a telepath, and Jake is Earth and Animals. Got it everyone." Casian said seething. She continued. "Ryan you start out by putting out the fire, Leiah try to start it up again, Jake you try and call a bird or something, and I'll-" She stopped.

"Why don't you try to levitate? Thats a good trick Magician use." Leiah suggested.

Casian nodded. "Ok lets try it gang!"
1111121112211.title: Refresher course on Powers

11111211122111.content:
Ryan started, but then stopped not knowing what to do.

"Ryan it should be as simple as just thinking what you want done and then doing it, just like football." You said putting it into terms that he could relate with. Casian nodded in agreement.

"Ohh!" He said. The lightbulb had finally turned on. "So all I do is think about putting the fire out, and it'll happen." He said not really talking to anyone. Within seconds the fire was snuffed out, as if someone had poured a bucket of water over it. Which in fact is what Ryan did, without the bucket though.

"Quick Le, bring the fire back." Casian shouted into the darkness.

"Ok I'll try, a fire..." She said. A crackle was heard, and a small explosian. Then you openned your eyes and the fire was blazing.
11111211122111.title: Mind Over Power

111112111221111.content:
"Jake call a bird. Maybe an owl." Leiah said excitedly.

<An owl?> You thought. "Ok well umm-" <Could an Owl please come over here?> You thought. All other thoughts left your mind, and you focused entirely on bringing an owl to your campsite.

Nothing.

They all look at you as if you aren't good enough to know how to work your powers. Then you hear a soft ruffling sound. An Owl! <Do you understand me?> You thought looking at it.

It cocked its head, <Of course, Sir, But it is much easier if we actually talk rather than speak telepathically> He said.

"Ohh, I'm sorry." You say not knowing exactly what to say next. The others look at you curiously.

"Your friends cannot understand anything that you say to us animals. Your gift is a rare one. Now only Elves and Fairies can talk to us, no other Human is known to have this gift."

"So I'm the only human that can talk to animals? Wow." You started.

"Well if you will excuse me, I need to gather food for my family." He replied flapping off.

"Ohh of course. Thank you so much!" You yell to him.
111112111221111.title: The Owl

choices: Stay awake and discuss future plans.
1111121112211111.content:
"What the hell was that all about, Jake?" Ryan asks stupidly.

"I thought about communicating with an owl and he came. Then he said that I am the only one that can understand animals, out of the four of us. He left, saying that he had to gather food for his family," You replied easily, smiling to yourself.

"Hey guys, check this out!" Cas yells.

Everyone looks, and Casian is floating about three feet in the air.

"Awesome, Cas!" Ryan exclaims.

She floats there for a moment, and then her concentration was interrupted by Ryan's voice and she come crashing down to the ground. Ryan starts laughing hysterically, but you and Leiah went over to help Casian up, off the ground.

"Very funny, Ryan!" She yells angrily. "I wish you would really shut up, for once!"

Immediately, Ryan's mouth shuts, and he can't open it up, or make any sound from his mouth. Now everyone else starts laughing, and she set Ryan's big yap free.

"Maybe that'll teach you to laugh at someone's misfortune, Ryan!" You yell, still laughing and clutching your sides.

"Okay, so now what do we do?" Leiah asks.
1111121112211111.title: Cool Powers

11111211122111112.content:
"Well, I'm tired--what about you guys?" Ryan yawns to the group.

Leiah and Casian both exclaim "Ryan!"
11111211122111112.title: What's going on?

111112111221111121.content:
You join in, "How can you even think of sleeping right now? We just found out we have special powers, we are definitely not on Earth anymore, and who knows what things could attack us if we went to sleep? Aren't you supposed to be a warrior, man?"

Ryan glares at you and Casian clears her throat to get your attention before a fight starts.

"Um, guys? Why don't we just calm down? We really need to talk about what we can do."

"And where we are," Leiah adds.

"And what we're supposed to do." Ryan notes.

"So where do we start?" You ask.
111112111221111121.title: What now?

111112111222.content:
Will you talk to Leiah about the stars?

Or will you takl to Casian about her gem
111112111222.title: Who?

choices: Turn around, grasping your daggers, ready to attack.
1111121112221.content:
Deciding not to interrupt Casian's silent meditation, or whatever, you slide easily over to Leiah, careful not to startle her.

"What do you see up there, Le?"

"Huh? Oh...umm...well...there's...umm...that one's...oh...umm..."

You begin to laugh gently. Leiah looks at you, tears in her eyes, obviously hurt.

"Le...I'm sorry. Its just that..."

"Jake, look, I'm no astronomer. I just enjoy looking up at the stars sometimes. Besides, none of these constellations are familiar at all. Why don't you take a look for yourself?"

You lift your gaze to the cloudless sky. Then you notice that the stars are completely different. You see green lights, red lights, blue, white, and orange. You see shooting stars, new constellations, and who knows what else.

"Wow. Completely amazing. To think, we may be the first ones from Earth to see these stars."

"Jake...did you just say what I think you said? Do you mean we're not on Earth anymore?"

"Le, that's obvious, isn't it? I mean, we must have travelled thousands upon thousands of light years to get here. Who even knows where here is, anyway?"

"I do," said a strange voice behind you.
1111121112221.title: New Stars, New World

11111211122212.content:
"I wouldn't do that if I were you, friend." A voice in the shadows says quietly.

You make sure that your daggers are ready to del with this new foe. But before you can move anymore, your body becomes frozen. "Now, I said that you shouldn't do that."

A man steps out from the shadows.
11111211122212.title: Shouldn't Do That

choices: Do you ask the meaning of Kataran's statement?
111112111222121.content:
The man was draped in a dark green cloak. His white beard extended down, nearly past his chest. He was tall, taller than any of the four. His voice sounded aged and wise, and he looked like he was centuries old. His hand was extended in your direction, and it was glowing a soft blue.

"If I release you," he said slowly, "You will not attempt to harm me. Agreed?"

"Yes," you answer.

The old man lowered his hand, and you are able to move again.

"Who are you?" Ryan asked.

"I am known by many names," the old man says ominously, "But you may call me Kataran."

"What do you want?" you ask angrily.

'Kataran' smiled. "The question is not what I want, but what you want."

"Well, to start off, that voice was me. "the wizened old man states. "I had hoped that you would find your destiny on your own but now I realize you need an explanation. This will take a while"

He motions for you to sit. When all of you are confortable he begins. "This land is in great peril and I fear the four of you may be our only hope." He pauses a moment when the bushes start to rustle.

Ryan gets jealous once more and argues.
111112112.content:
Ryan, who is jealous at the thought of you leading the group jumps in and argues against your idea.

"We have no idea as to what could be watching us right now," he says. "We should find a cave or something and sort out the gear in hiding."

"We don't know where to go," you reply calmly. "We'll probably end up getting lost or killed. If anything was watching us, they would have already made their move. I say that we set up camp here, explore our powers and then go off to bed in pairs with two people guarding the camp at a time."

"I think that Jake is right, Ryan," Cas and Leiah agree together. "Besides," Leiah continues, "I'm so tired, I wouldn't be able to make it to the nearest cave."

"It's settled then," you state, standing up, "We'll make camp here."

The four of you empty your packs and set up a make shift camp for the night. Ryan looks physically worn out, but you know he won't openly admit it. Now, however, you have to decide who will stand guard and when they will be able to sleep.

"Alright, I'm willing to take the first shift for guard duty," you say walking to the middle of the camp.

"Have fun with that, nature boy," Ryan says, exhausted.

"I'll stay up with you, Jake," Cas says as she walks towards you.
111112112.title: The First Long Night

choices: Start a conversation about the first thing you think of.
1111121121.content:
You and Cas quietly talk among the two of you. Ryan and Leiah quickly fall asleep. You are amazed that Ryan didn't object to you pairing up with Cas.

You peer into the fire and Cas gets up.

"Where are you going?" You ask defensively.

"I'm just stretching my legs," she replies. "Besides, if you're not going to talk to me then I'll just walk around the camp by myself."
1111121121.title: Cas gets up to go.

11111211211.content:
"Aren't the stars awesome, tonight, Cas?" You ask to keep her with you.

"What?" she asks with a smile on her face.

"I said..." you begin.

"No, I know what you said. Why did you say that?" she asks as she makes her way back to your side.

"I don't know, I just didn't feel like we should be alone. You know, I mean..." you say as you start to blush.

"That's so sweet," Cas says in a quiet voice.

Cas sits down on the log next to you and looks into your eyes. Suddenly, it appears as if she gets frightened and looks past you. You turn around, not knowing what to expect and see a band of what look like goblins.

You unsheath your two daggers and approach the band. Cas grabs her staff and calls out to the others. She yells for Ryan and Leiah, but its no use, they're sleeping too heavily to hear her.

The first goblins come at the two of you and you fight them off. Cas defends an attack and points her staff at the goblin, ready for another assault.

"Take this!" she yells as she thrusts the staff forward.

The goblin jumped out of the way and dodged the staff. However, it wasn't prepared for what happened next. A powerful flame jumped from the crystal atop the staff and burned the goblin. You stare in amazement as Cas realizes what she had just done.

The goblins get frightened but continue fighting. You raise your daggers, one above your head and the other, by your knees. You crouch down and jump into the middle of a ring of goblins. As you hit the ground, a ring of rock forms around your feet and knock down all of the goblins. You raise both daggers above your head and a great spyre shoots up from the soil, knocking the goblins back even farther.

The other goblins start to retreat.
11111211211.title: The First Attack

choices: Ryan tries to kill the goblins
Ryan tries to get rid of them by other means
1111121121111.content:
"Should we kill them?" Cas asks.

"No," you reply. "Apparently I have nature powers. Maybe I can talk them into helping us."

"I guess so," she says.

One of the goblins yells something, and somehow you instantly grasp their whole language. "Hello," you say to them.

The goblins look at you for a few seconds, confused. "What do you want?" one of them replies briskly.

"Why'd you attack us?" you question.

"I won't tell!"

"Do you want to help us?"

"No!"

"Can I convince you otherwise?" you touch the pouch at your side for some reason.

"Uh, sure," the goblin says. "Yeah, master, we'll help you. What do you need?"

Surprised by the goblin's sudden change, you glance at the pouch suspiciously. You shrug and tell the goblins to come with you. They obey almost mechanically, following you and Cas -- who has suddenly become quite skeptical -- back to the camp. When you return you find the other two awake. Seeing your goblins, Ryan's face looks confrontational.

Ryan pulls out his new sword and lunges at the goblin band. They simply stand there as he cuts one down. Off guard and confused, you command the goblins to attack back. Ryan cuts them all down within a few seconds, though a goblin dagger sits embedded in his leg.

"They were helping us!" you yell.

"Helping?" Ryan snaps back. "They attacked me! And you told them to!"

"You attacked them first!"

"So what? They're filth!" Ryan turns and stomps off into the woods, leaving the dead goblins behind. The girls glance between you two, but they decide to follow the Warrior. You are left alone.

Casian walked over to their watery prison. You followed close behind. Casian reached into the cage to pull the red-one out, it bit her on the hand as she grabbed him. She threw it to the ground, you rushed over and placed a dagger at its' throat. "Tell me," She started, a look of pure hatred writtin on her face as she bandaged her hand. "Why did you attack us?" She asked.

The goblin did not answer, which is not a smart idea when Casian is mad, she takes great insult when anyone, or thing, doesn't answer her questions or act the way she thinks he/she (or it in this matter) should. "Jake put him back in the cage, and form a stone structure over the water."

"But Casi, if I do that they'll all die!" It just didn't seem fair to you, they had learnt their lesson, right?

"Jake just do it!"

"No! I won't just execute them. That's not my call." I yelled at her

"You're right it's mine." She went to put her staff down so she could kill them herself.

You shook her trying to get some sense back into her head. "Casian if we do evil with our powers, we'll be evil! Aren't we fighting evil? Even if we don't know what it is were fighting." I said still shaking her. I stopped. She just stared at me, silent not saying a word.

She sat down on the log we had been sitting on earlier, placed her head in her hands and started to cry. She wasn't a loud cryer but you could tell because of the way she breathed, ragged short breaths. You went over to her and spoke softly, "Casi, what's this about?"

She looked up at you, tearstained face and all. "Jake those things could have killed us! I don't have parents, and I don't want to loose my best friend!" She paused a moment as if she were searching for the right words. "Jake you're always there for me, not like Leiah she doesn't listen to me. She's to busy with her own life." She stopped. "God I must look horrible, C'mon, I'd say its time to wake Ryan and Leiah for their shift."

be just another way for Ryan to do what he always does, make everything about himself.

Cas?

"I didn't really want to kill her," He said, standing up. He looked into Cas's eyes and saw how they were filled with something, not quite fear, more like instant loathing. "It was just a test."

"Easily manipulated," the boy reiterated. "There are powerful evil forces here in Esylla and I needed to know if you could be easily swayed. Happy to say, you passed."

"Thank you for that test, but next time, I think I'll take the written."

Ryan studied the faces of everyone in the group. Cas still had an apprehensive look on her face, but she nodded. Leiah smiled and nodded her head. Ryan looked at you and you smiled.

"Ok Jake."

Anything for you Jake, you hear in your mind.... Wha... Casian? You think. Nothing..... Jake look up.... You do what the voice says.

You see the stars rearranging themselves, like a beautiful dance. A ballet of the stars... Ryan and Leiah are both looking into the heavens. "Well guys guess that mean I can control the cosmos to." Casian says with a laugh. "Anyone want to see more?"
1111121121212.title: Dancing Stars...

choices: Go to bed! You Are Wiped Out!
11111211212121.content:
"Well the way I figure it," Casian continues. " Our powers have to protect us right? Well that also means that whatever we think of or say they will do." She pauses for effect. "So you see I told the stars to put on a show." She says and then looks at you. A show for you Jake, her voice resonates in your mind, clear as a bell. Oh man, you had to be making this all up.

She holds her palm out. "A small light please." A glowing ball begins to appear in the palm of her hand. She blows on it and it cirles around each of your heads before snuffing itself out. "You see guys, it's relativly simple."

"So," Leiah starts. "Since im Fire and Light all I have to do is think "Fire" and-" Before she could finish a nearby bush was set ablaze.

"Ryan put it out you're water!" Casian yells.

"Water-" He says looking at the bush, and with that a stream of water appeared and the bush was left a charred, smoking plant.

"Well Leiah you do have to focus your thoughts, have somewhere you want your power to be directed at and let loose. What Jake experienced earlier was his powers protecting him from harm, that is why he didn't have to even think about it." Cas explains. "Of course this is only, so far, a working theory." She says looking at you.
11111211212121.title: Casian's Theory

111112112121211.content:
"So Casian all I have to do is focus and aim right?" Leiah asks.

"Yea, Leiah that's exactly it."

"Sorta like a camera then." Leiah adds.

"Hey guys I have an idea," You start. "Leiah throw a fireball into the sky, Ryan douse it with a stream of water. That way we can learn to work our powers as one maybe even eventully combine them to form one huge super power." Everyone agrees with you.

Leiah holds her hand out and closes her eyes. A small flame appears in the palm of her hand, it grow a bigger until it reaches the size(roughly measured of course) of a softball. She sends it hurtling into the sky.

Ryan sent a jet of water screaming through the night air it missed the fireball by a few inches, but he quickly recovered it sent it around and it hit the flying target.
111112112121211.title: Fireballs and Jet Streams

1111121121212111.content:
"Alright guys let me see if I can do something." You say.

"How about an earthquake, not too big mind you." Leiah suggests.

You think about the ground moving under your feet. Concentrating only on the earth beneath you.

"JAKE!! That's enough." Leiah screams. You open your eyes, you didn't even realize that you had closed them in the first place. The ground had spilt and was forming a treacherous opening. You never thought of something this powerful, but when you saw what you had done a surge of pride swelled through your being. You quickly close the earth that had split at your very feet. You look around you could tell that your friends were impressed.
1111121121212111.title: Too Much Jake!

choices: Casian wakes you up for your watch
11111211212121111.content:
Having flexed your abilities for the first time you all find yourself feeling somewhat in need of rest. You decide with the others to get some sleep, but breaking up the night into four 2hr shifts will ensure that everyone gets some sleep.

After a short conversation Ryan agree's to pull first watch, Casian Second, You third and Leiah last.

Everyone rapidly pulls the packs off Jordan, and unhooks the tack from their mounts. As always Baron is right behind you, but with some gentle nudging he steps away to graze on some scrub grass with the other mounts.

Your bed roll is laid out, and no sooner than it takes for your head to touch your makeshift pillow you are asleep.
11111211212121111.title: Power Drain

11111211212122.content:
"Maybe later, Cas. I want to see what I can do!" Ryan says. You wait for him to demonstrate his power, only to have him, embarrassed, look around. "So," he says, "what is my power, exactly?"

Leiah laughs and you roll your eyes--that's Ryan, for you--Casian is left to tell him. "Water, Ryan. Remember? Water and winds and all the weather that comes from both."

"Cool, so I can make it snow?" Having lived in sunny California all his life, Ryan was somewhat obsessed with the idea of snow.

Cas shrugged, "why not? I mean, if I can do illusion . . ."

"What?!" Leiah exclaims. "Illusion?"

Cas shrugs, blushing, "You didn't really think I made the stars dance, did you?"

You all laugh, then turn to Ryan.

He concentrates and soon a flurry of snow surrounds all four of you. Ryan is so excited by his success, it is hard to get him to stop. Finally, he stops the snowfall. Even though the snow's gone, it has become quite cold.

"Hey, Leiah," you say, "I guess it's your turn. You're light and fire, right? Well, why don't you start a fire to warm things up."

Leiah nods, looking both excited and nervous
11111211212122.title: Ryan's Power

choices: Greet the visitor with open arms.
Greet the visitor with drawn weapons.
11111212.content:
You decide that you better leave the crater and continue on the way. The four of you start hiking towards the open field that lies before you.

As you approach, you see something sticking up out of the ground in the middle of the otherwise empty field. You get closer and the object appears to be a shrine of rocks. It is glowing softly and you stop before getting any closer.

"What is that thing?" Ryan asks anyone that will answer.

The voice that commanded you guys to get your items comes back and replies, "That, my children, is the source of power for the Crystals of Esylla. However, the crystals have been taken from the shrine and it is your quest to retrieve them and bring them here."

"Why us?" Leiah asks.

"I have been watching the four of you for quite some time now. The four of you have remarkable talents that will help you along the way. Anyway, if you would like, I will send one of my assistants to guide you in the use of your powers."

"No way!" Ryan shouts. "I want some answers, now. I want to know who you are and where we are. You can't do this to us, this is kidnapping, its illegal where we come from."

"You mean Beverly Hills, California? You ignorant fool, don't you realize that the fate of our worlds are at stake and you're worried about something as trivial as who I am?" The voice becomes angry and louder. "You will never meet me in person, and knowing who I am can't aid you in any way. It is irrelevant and of no concern to you. My assistant will be arriving shortly. Goodbye."

With that, the voice disappeared with the breeze and the four of you were left alone once more.

"Well that went well, thanks a lot Ryan," Cas scolds Ryan. "Now that creepy voice thing is mad at us."

"I'm sorry, I just wanted some answers," Ryan tries to say for his defense.

You notice somebody approaching you in the distance and alert the others.
11111212.title: The Shrine

choices: You Agree Casian Should Be leader!
Hell No!!! You Want To Be Leader!
111112121.content:
"Well there is no need to make this voice any angrier at us than it already is, so lets just welcome this 'assiatant' and find the crystals. Then we can go home." Casian says glaring at Ryan the entire time. "So guys lets just please be on our best behavior, ok?" She asks looking each of us in the eyes and lingering at Ryan.

"Look its not my fault, c'mon people when have I ever let you guys astray?" Ryan asks the group.

"We there was that time when we stole your dad's Mercedes and you said 'it's ok he won't mind." You say. "And what happened? I got grounded for 3 months!"

"Oh man I remember that was so hilari-" He starts, "You're right i did screw up and get you in trouble."

"Yea buddy and I can name at least two dozen other 'screw ups'! Let's just let Casian take care of it, I mean she has never been vindictive like me, or naive like Jake, or just plain dumb like Ryan. No offense guys." Leiah says trying to sound like a D.A in a court room, arguing her case.

"I dont really care guys, but we do need to decide quickly because our little helper is fast aproaching." Casian says looking to the visitor who keeps getting closer.

choices: The Assistant is a Human Sorcerer
1111121211.content:
"Even though I resent your remark about being naive, I do think that Casian being our leader per say is the best way to go." You say giving your vote of confidence to Casian.

"Well I guess it's settled then-" Leiah starts.

"What the hell are you talking about, its all settled my ass! I haven't voted for her yet." Ryan says with anger in his voice. "Not that it matters, but I think Casian taking charge is a great idea."

"Ryan you are so- Oh never mind!" Casian says. "I hope we are all done arguing then?" She says looking around, "Because our Voice's friend is here."
1111121211.title: Take Me To Your Leader....

11111212111.content:
A tall pointy eared woman walks up to you and your friends.

"What is this a Lord of the Rings Convention?" Ryan laughs.

Leiah jabs him in the ribs. "Shut up will you!" She hisses.

"Childen of the Light, welcome to Esylla." The woman smiles bowing low. "The time has come for your powers to awaken fully. Come with me."
11111212111.title: The LOTR Convention

111112121111.content:
You all follow the elf to the shrine. There are four slots, presumably where the crystals are supposed to go.

"Casian, to the North. Leiah to the West. Ryan to the East, and Jake to the South." The Elf says.
111112121111.title: Four Points, Four Crystals, and Four Teenagers

choices: Find out what your object is, and where to go next.
11111212112.content:
It was a man, you immediately guessed he was a mage because he held an oak staff with a quartz crystal clutched at the top by a silver claw. Yet, the rest of his attire was nothing like the fantasy stories. He didn't have a long beard, in fact he looked like he was your age more or less. He was clad in a dark blue shirt, with long sleeves, and regular looking black pants. He could've passed off for a normal teenager, if it wasn't for the huge silver loop earrings that he had goign through one ear. His eyes were a dark brown. His skin was dark brown as well, and he was rather slender.

"I am Raziel. I'll be assisting you. I hope that we get along while we journey, for it is a long journey indeed."
11111212112.title: 'Black' Mage

choices: Nobody says anything and you try to make a decision.
111112122.content:
Not wanting to take any chances, the four of you draw your new weapons and stand around eachother, watching the visitor approach.

The stranger turns out to be a man dressed in a dark blue tunic with black pants. He's carrying a pack and a long, wooden staff. He approaches the shrine and goes down on one knee. He lays his weapon on the ground next to him and looks up at the four of you. He has his hood up so you can't see anything above his mouth. He appears to be human, but you don't want to jump to conclusions.

"Greetings, warriors. I am Eldrock, guardian of the Crystals of Esylla and protector of the shrine. I will be your guide throughout this perilous journey," he says in a somewhat comforting voice.

He removes his hood and the sight takes your breath away. Up to his neck appears almost human, but then the flesh of his neck turns deep green and the rest of his face is reptilian.

"First," Eldrock says, "you must decide what we are going to do, Jacob."

"Why me?" you ask.

"Because you are the most fitting for this type of situation among all the humans on your world. You are the team leader."
111112122.title: Eldrock, the Guide

choices: See if Everyone would like to stop for the night.
Keep walking until Eldrock decides to stop.
1111121221.content:
Stepping forward, you slide your daggers into the sheathes at your waist. "I believe we could use a little direction, and a few answers at this point in time. We would be glad to have your company on this journey Eldrock."

Eldrock rises off his knee and retrieves his staff. "It will not be not be an easy journey to be certain, but I will do what I can to assist you all in your endeavors".

"Well you can start by telling us why we're here", Ryan cuts in.

Casian elbows him sharply and you can feel that words are being exchanged even though they aren't spoken.

Eldrock speaks again. "I cannot tell you why you were selected over others, but I can say that it is a great honor to be chosen. Only the wize one knows for certain." Eldrock begins walking slowly towards to the mountains.

You all step away from the shrine and begin walking next to and behind Eldrock as he answers various and all questions that you have to the best of his abilities. For the most part you learn that your current destination is a mountain fortress 2 days to the north. There are rumored to be tunnels behind or beneath the fortress that lead through the mountains to a hidden land. This is were the Crystals are believed to be taken.

"You must be ever vigilant during the dark hours as we get closer to the fortress". Eldrock states. "Since the fortress fell during the mage wars over a century ago it is rumored that there are powerful scentient artifacts left in the darkest dungeons and high towers." He looks around like a story teller weaving a ghost tale and checking its effects on his audience. He continues after a dramatic pause, "The tainted items draws the dark things to it."

Everyone is quiet and lost in there own thoughts for the next few miles. You hear Cas's thoughts poppin in your head a few times {You believe him Jake?"}

Not answering, you just shrugg your shoulders.
1111121221.title: The Journey Begins

choices: Ryan concedes and follows your leadership.
Ryan still insists on leaving by himself.
1111121222.content:
"Jake is the leader of our group?" Ryan shouts loudly. "I thought that the leader would be somebody that can take charge, somebody strong! Somebody more like me!"

"Ryan," Eldrock begins. "Those traits are important, but a good leader also needs to know about the world, about how to stay open minded. Jake is very intelligent and he is the most prepared to lead the group. Jake will be a successful leader, you may not realize it now, but with time, you will appreciate this decision."

"If Jake is going to be the leader, we're all doomed. I'm out of here. You guys can try to save this world, or whatever it is we're supposed to do together, but I'm on my own unless anyone wants to come with me," Ryan states as he gets up.

"You may do as you wish, but I guarantee that if you separate now, the quest will be doomed to failure," Eldrock explains.

"Ryan, I'm staying here with Jake," Cas says. "There was a reason Jake was appointed leader by someone else. I trust that decision."

"I'm staying too. We need to stay together," Leiah says confidently.
1111121222.title: Ryan's Big Decision

"FINE!," Ryan says."But I'm watching you Jacob".
"Good,"says Eldrock. "Let the instruction begin"! Suddenly you find yourself surrounded by...

or stay with Leiah and risk her thinking you like her....

"Jacob?"Leiah timidly asks...

How the hell should I know? Stupid damn blonde! You think, then you camly state, "I really don't know, and furthermore, I really don't want to know."

"Jacob I'm scared will you stay here with me I don't want to see what it is either" She says latching onto you.

God I wish she wouldn't do that I mean I don't like her right? I like Casian...beautiful, intelligent, oh so wonderful Casian. Not Leiah...but Leiah is just as beautiful as Casian maybe even more...She can be incredibly cunning and resourceful at times too...but do you like her?

choices: Forget about her weird behavior u have caught up with Ryan and Casian

1111122111.content:
"Ryan, Cas', hold up! We're coming over." You yell, jogging across the feild, Leiah in tow. You find the two staring at the pod-like, dark object sitting in its impact crater. They're so mesmerized, they lack even the courtesy to look at you as you draw closer. "Hey. You guys alright? Man, where the heck do you think we are, and what is this thing.." Your voice trails off as you notice the two still aren't paying you any attention, then you walk around them to see what has them so fascinated.
         You inhale sharply. A humanoid figure is sprawled inside the cracked mettalic object, groaning feebly. It doesn't have skin. Instead, his body is coated in glossy, onyx black scales, overlapping and seeming to repulse light, making their owner hard to look at. A saurian head twists back and forth, trying to shake of a tangled restraint harness. For a moment, you wish you could have scales so flawless, so tough looking and shiny... You snap out of it, partly due to a peculiar itching on your arm, you scratch at it irritably, shaking your head to clear it, but then notice that your skin feels hard, and smoother than before. A glance down-wards shows a multitude of little black dots, which shrink apart and into you and vanish while you watch. "C'mon guys, we gotta help him!" Yells Caisia suddenly, leaping forward. Both Ryan and Leiah also step forth. Still puzzled by the trance-like feeling you had had earlier, and by the mysterious markings on your arm, you walk up to the pod and look at how the thing is tangled. "Here, he's trapped under a section here. maybe we can move it..." You know it to be a false hope. The part is too big and too heavy looking for anyone too- Whet the heck?! Ryan reaches forwrad, and, muscles straining, wrenches the piece back. "Get. Him. Out!" He growls, obviously straining. Still unable too believe it, you pull the dazed reptiloid out from under it, while Leaih untangles him. Her fingers occaisionaly brush against his reptilian hide, and a gash on his forward startes to close. What on earth was going on? After finally freeing the now unconscious lizard-thing, you drag him over in the feild, and all sit down nearby to discuss what the hell just occurred back there.
1111122111.title: What on earth(or wherever you are)?!

You are shocked. "Uh, well, umm." You stutter.

She walks away.

"Yea?"

"Well I just wanted to let you know that I really-" You are cut off.

"Would you guys hold up!" You hear Jake yelling behind you.

Everyone's hearts, including your own, lifted at the sight of the beautiful wildflower filled meadow.

It is breathtaking. It is like a whole world in here, the blue sky and the white clouds above, the hills in the distance, the gravel path leading to a village, a serene lake behind it, a meadow full of beautiful flowers, more beautiful than the ones in the clearing, and children playing, and a forest beside it, where birds sing and fly.How this fits into such a tiny cottage Ryan has no idea. Until Malgawrath came and claimed that Esylla was his, and he unleashed the most powerful dark forces and became "king" of Esylla." "Wait, Molger-who?"Leiah interrupted. "Malgawrath, an evil highly skilled mage, swordsman and archer.He slayed anyone who got in his way, even children."The elf said as she looked at the children playing the meadow."Sorry foe asking,but,what are you exactly" Jake asked.The elf looked at him, and said,"I am a dark elf, and I am called Mayserta." An old guy with long white beard and long white hair stood at the door way, typically looks looks the same wizards in those fantasy movies.He gasped when he saws the four of you."Did they came out of nowhere?"He asked Mayserta.
