111121221.title: She's Really Mad!

111122.content:
You pull Casian aside where Jake cannot see you two, and you look into her eyes. "Casian I really, really like you. I've liked you since before I can remember. In case something bad happens I want you to know."

"Oh Ryan! I didn't know, I mean I like you too." She says surprised at her own confession. She looks to the ground, you lightly touch her chin and lift her head up. She looks at you like she wants and needs you as much as you want and need her.

You lean down softly wrapping your arm around her waist. She reaches out to you with the look of a girl who just has to be kissed and with that look encourages you to stoop down more capturing her lips with yours.

"Umm excuse me Ryan darling this is not exactly the time or place for a make-out session with my best friend, and Casian I expected more out of you." You and Casian look at each other knowing that event though this was anything but a make-out session, you were, nonetheless caught in the act. "Oh well whatever, Jacob says he has found somewhere we can stay for the night. I suggest you two try and hop off Cloud 9 to help us working people figure out what the hell exactly we will be doing." With that she turned on her heel and sauntered towards where you guessed your would be campsite was.

Should you:
111122.title: Confessions

choices: Jake is okay after a little while....
Jake does not appear to be breathing and you hear a rustling in the bushes...
1111221.content:
Leiah had turned on her heel and was sauntering off when both you and Casian notice that on the back of her suede pants it says "princess" in what you presumed were diamonds, her father was always showering Leiah with expensive clothing accessories jewelry and not to mention clothing with jewelry on it... "Well I guess that we should follow the 'princess'." Casian says laughing at her own joke. You both laugh good-naturedly at Leiah's pants knowing that if Jake were there he would have enjoyed it immensely as well.

You and Casian walked several yards behind Leiah, not wanting to be noticed and at the same time not wanting to get lost. The land is was fast turning into hill country, not too much, but enough to make you not want to climb them. Leiah gets up over the top of the first hill and she yells down to you "Jake's clearing is right down-"

She was cut off but her own scream... "JAKE! Are you okay?!?!?" You and Casian look at each other for a moment and run to the top of the hill. You look down and see that Jake is lying,either unconscious or dead,in the middle of a beautiful meadow. This should be on a greeting card its so gorgeous you think to yourself. Wait a sec Ry did you just think 'gorgeous'? Oh man I must be loosing it! You think chastising yourself. The two girls are already running down the hill, you snap you head and run after them. You quickly catch up to them at the bottom of the hill in the clearing.
1111221.title: Is Jake O.K.?

choices: Find out what is in the bushes.
11112212.content:
You feel for a pulse, but there is nothing. You don't see or hear any sign of breathing, but something is in the bushes about five feet to your right.

What do you do?
11112212.title: Jake is Hurt Badly...

choices: Its the same voice from earlier.
111122121.content:
"Casian...Leiah...there's something in those bushes over there. I'll stay here and try to help Jake," you say as you look over Jake for any sign of a wound or anything.

Casian and Leiah turn to the bushes and prepare for the worst when a little, white rabbit hops out and runs away from the meadow. Casian returns to your side, but Leiah pokes around the bushes to make sure nothing else is there.

You make a fire and continue looking over Jake, but you can't find out what's wrong with him.

"Oh, Jake, what's wrong with you? What happened?" Casian asks. She grows silent, but her eyes grow bigger. It appears she is hearing something that nobody else can hear.
111122121.title: Tending to Jake

1111221212.content:
Casian just stood there, listening.Then a big, sharp chunk of ice flew at her.You push her just in time and look in the direction the ice came from.A white boy with spiky blue hair,a white sweater and blue jeans, boots, and one loop ear ring in his left ear.
"Oops! These powers are getting a bit out of hand."

"Who are you?"You ask.

"The name is Zake.I happen to be a cryokinesist, if you jugheads know what that means."

His ego was almost as big as yours.

"Well I really don't care, buddy! You almost killed my girlfriend! Wait..."
1111221212.title: Jake's mind speaks to Casian.

choices: The Griffin is actually protector of this forest
111122122.content:
"Whatever is there get out! Now! I'll have you know that I know Tai-kwon-do, Judo, and-"You are cut off.

"-5 other Japanese words." You hear Leiah mutter.

"Shut up Le, I mean it whatever is there get out now!"

"I suggest if you want you friend to live that you cease this abhorrent behavior at once." The voice belonged to what would closely resemble a Griffin. At least that what it appeared to be, after taking that summer Mythology class a Griffin would be. Regular Griffins had the head wings and forepart of an eagle and the back and tail of a lion. This creature however had none of the eagle's features and the lion part had been moved up to the front of it. Head legs and body of a lion and wings and tail of what you would think a drangon would have.

"Are you the one that did this to Jake!?" Ryan asks standing defensivly over his best friend.
111122122.title: A Griffin?

choices: The Griffin leaves without answering your questions
1111221221.content:
"My name is Jireo, I am the protector of this forest. I was finishing my daily route when I saw your friend being attacked by a Firiat, I scared it away and waited in the bushes, just in case further assistance was needed. Now that I see he will be taken care of I will leave." The creature announced.

"No wait please don't go yet. We need some answers, maybe you can help us out." Casian asks it.
1111221221.title: Questions

11112212212.content:
You all gape as the Griffin--what was his name?--leaves without saying a word.

"Man, we're really not getting anywhere are we?" you mutter.

Leiah glares at you. "Well, maybe if you and Casian hadn't stopped back there to 'talk', Jake would still be ok!" You've never seen her so mad before.

Casian blushes, but you protest. "Hey, that's not fair. Jake should be able to take care of himself."

Now Casian glowers at you. "What did you say? We don't even know what happened to him--he could be dying and we don't know why. Whatever got him could get us, too. How was Jacob supposed to 'take care of himself' when he was attacked by something we've never even heard of?"

"Geez, chill out Cas, I didn't mean anything," you raise your hands in defense.

Casian sighs. "I know . . . it's just, what should we do about Jake?"

Everyone's eyes are drawn to Jake's still body.

What should you do?
11112212212.title: Arguments and Decisions

1112.content:
Choose who you are:

Casian is intelligent and level-headed with all of the characteristics of one who will succeed later in life.

Leiah is street smart and has the cunning of a top-notch attorney.
1112.title: Who are you?(female)

choices: You pretend not to hear him and keep going...
11121.content:
"Leiah, Ryan and I are ready so were going to go on ahead. Tell Jake to hurry up too okay." You say.

"Sure thing Cas." Leiah answered.

"C'mon Ryan lets go." You and Ryan set off at a normal pace. Both of you talking about the what exactly happened. While you were talking with him, you realize that when he puts his egotistical jock image aside he has a nice personality. Plus he's really hott. Ok, you think to yourself, now where did THAT come from. You turn your face so that he doesn't see that horrible shade of red your face just turned. You are still trying to figure out how that thought actually entered you head when a voice interupts your thoughts.....

"Would you guys hold up!" You hear Jake yelling behind you.
11121.title: Casian is having weird thoughts

choices: Go back to the car and try to drive away
111211.content:
"Listen guys," Jake says running up to you and Ryan, Leiah at his side, "We can't split up, we don't even know where the hell we are! I mean how did we end up in a forest when there isn't one for miles around?"

"Your right." you say. "We stick together then." Just then you here a strange noise, it's a deep hollow sound that sends shivers up your spine.

"Okay, what was that?" Leiah says grabbing Ryan. You suprise yourself at the wave of jealousy that sweeps over you.

"Nothing," you respond, "It was probably just the wind." and you turn and begin to walk, the others begin to follow when you hear it again.

"That sure as hell isn't the wind." Ryan says.

"I vote we just get out of here, this forest freaks me out. Let's just get in the car and go, we can't be far from the highway. I mean it's impossible to get lost in America, we don't have a wilderness." Leiah says.

"I don't know" Jake begins, "Aren't you a little curious, I mean what IS that sound? I say we go investigate."

"What do you say?" Ryan asks you. "You're the intelligent one, what's are best option?"
111211.title: Options

choices: Stay try to fix the car
Go find shelter before it gets dark
1112111.content:
You try to head back towards the car, but when you get there the car is overgrown with vines.

All of a sudden Leiah starts to cry. "What are we gonna do!!!!! I'm to gorgeous to be stuck in a creepy forest!!!"Her crying is beginning to get unbearable.

"Leiah! SHUT UP!" You yell "If we are going to find a way back home we need to think not be pathetic." Did you,the ever so rational girl, just have a panic attack?

"Calm down Cas, its okay." Jake says trying to cool you down.

You compose yourself and camly say "So once again, do we stay here at the wreck or go elsewhere?"
1112111.title: Break Downs

choices: Sigh and keep trying to help the boys
11121111.content:
The boys begin hacking away at the vines. They aren't making much headway, but you keep yelling out ideas, instructions and suggestions, trying your hardest to help as much as you can.

You look over at Leiah, she's standing there inspecting her nails.
11121111.title: Nail Check

111211111.content:
"Leiah!" You yell. She jumps back, a bit startled. The boys cease their work and just stare at you two. "What the hell is your problem? Are you trying to piss me off?"

She looks at you, and then-
111211111.title: Ohh... Mad Casi!

1112111111.content:
"I, I-I'm s-sorry casi." She stammers. "I'm useless! Utterly useless."

She is such a drama queen! You think.

"Girls! This is seriously not the time for yelling and crying. We need to get out of this damn forest!" Jake says over Leiah's wailing.

"You're right Jake," She sniffs. "I'm being selfish again... What do we do though?"

"Leiah." You say softly. "I'm sorry. I shouldn't have yelled at you. I guess my nerves are just really wacked out right now. Jake's right. We need to at least find shelter. The night's coming, and I don't think we should stay here."

"Well maybe we should stay here." Ryan says. "I mean, we can hack our way into the car, and sleep there."

"What if the vines grow over the car and we're stuck in there forever." Leiah asks.
1112111111.title: Apologies

11121111112.content:
"We'll be fine." Ryan says. "C'mon Jake, help me get to the passenger door."

Jake nods and helps ripping the vines away once more. After what seems like ages, a pathway to the door is finally made. The four of you slip inside and Ryan tries to turn the car on.
11121111112.title: Entry into the BMW

111211111121.content:
"Wow!" Ryan says. "Should we see if this wreck will go anywhere?"

"Try it man, couldn't hurt." Jake says.

Ryan began to back the car up. Vines ripped free of the car.

"So where to now?" Leiah asks.

"Yea, I mean we are in the middle of a bunch of trees..."
111211111121.title: Woo hoo!

choices: Try To Leave These Creepy Woods
1112111112.content:
"Look, Cas, you know I'm not used to this sort of thing! None of us are! What's your problem, huh? Aren't you even a tad bit wierded out?? I, for one am about to come completely unglued in this place! Wherever it is!!" Leiah yells right back at you, waving her perfectly tanned arms in emphasis of how odd it was to be transported from sunny California to dark woods.

You listen in unbelief to her insane tirade. "You think I'm not worried? I don't care or something? I'm just as clueless are you are right now, only I'm trying to deal with it--unlike a certain drama queen I know of!" You can't believe how good it feels just to yell out your feelings.

The guys, meanwhile, have stopped chopping at vines and are now gaping at the two of you. Ignoring them, you go on. "You are so insensitive! Why, of all the girls I know, did I have to be stuck here with you?" you can't seem to stop, even though Leiah is openly fuming and seems ready to pounce. "You think you're too good to help? Well, guess what princess, this isn't your castle!"

With a shriek, Leiah starts forward at you--manicured nails slashing towards your face. You surge forward as well, all your sense having flown out the window. Just as you two are about to clash, you see Jake grap Leiah. Ryan snatches you.

"Woah!" Jake exclaims as Leiah trys to claw her way free. "Cut that out! What do you think you're doing? Both of you! We need to work together to figure this out!" You stop struggling against Ryan's grasp as his words begin to make sense to you. Rational thought returns and you calm down somewhat. Leiah, too, seems to cool off and starts putting her hair back in place.

"Geez, what got into you two?" Ryan says, looking shocked.

"You wouldn't understand." You and Leiah say it at the same time and you both burst into laughter.

"I'm sorry," you say. "I guess this place is just getting on my nerves."

"That's okay, I'm sorry too," Leiah sighs. "I just feel so useless." As you hug to make up (the boys looking on in bewilderment), you hear yet another strange sound.
1112111112.title: Cat Fight!

choices: Whatever you arn't scared of some noise...
11121112.content:
"Well, kids, we're not in Kansas anymore." Jake said quoting a movie line.

"You've got that right," you say, "I mean think about it, it simply isn't logical, none of it. There's no way we could have crashed into a forest where there isn't one, and look at the car! Have you ever seen vines that grown so fast that they can engulf a whole car in a matter of minutes. Something strange is going on here."

"No shit Sherlock" Leiah says getting frustrated.You give her a warning glare not to mess with you right now and she adds quieter, "so what are we going to do?"

It suddenly bothers you that everyone automatically looks to you, how are you suppose to know what's going on, you're just as lost as they are. "Why are you asking me?!?"

"Because you always know what to do." Ryan says. For the moment your too scared and angry to even realize that what Ryan was saying is a compliment.

"Fine!" you say in clipped tones, "We might as well find somewhere to rest then, it's getting dark and I for one am not staying by this car, I don't intend to wake up finding myself completely covered in vines."

"Ok, sounds like a plan," Jake says, "where are we going then." you look around a second and then pick a direction at random.

"This way." you say and begin walking.

"Not that way." Leiah says, "that's where the noises came from."

"It was just the wind!" you yell, "If you want me to make the descions then I suggest you follow them, this is the way I'm going." you walk off not looking back but after a moment you hear the sounds of them following you and Jake saying quietly, "That definitly was not the wind."
11121112.title: Heated Discussion

111211121.content:
Suddenly you feel a hand grab you swinging you around as another hand clasps over your mouth. You hear shouts from your friends and assume they've been attacked as well. And there's the soft sound of someone chanting in the backround. Suddenly you feel like someone slammed a brick wall against you, it leaves you weak and somehow . . . incomplete is the only word you can think of to desribe it.

"She hasssss been sssheilded." a voice that sends shivers up your spine says in a hissing voice.

"This is her, then." the gruff man holding you says as another man comes to stand beside you.

"Yessssss."

"Be careful." one man cautions the man holding you.

"No need, ssssshe can not usssse her powersssss now." Powers? What?

"Take her then and remember she is not to be harmed in any way, HE wants her unspoiled."

"What about the others?"

"Take them to. We can't have them alerting the Vasians that we have taken their princess." And then your vision is lost as a blindfold is placed over your eyes and a gag shoved in your mouth. Powers? Vasians? Princess? It was obvious that they have you confused with someone else. But one question remains, where are they taking you?
111211121.title: Attack

1112111211.content:
They pick you up and set you down somewhere soft, you believe a carriage of some sort. You feel movement and a steady clopping noise. Your mind swims with thoughts, trying to form an explaination to this mess you seem to have gotten yourself into. Vasians....you had never heard of a civilization in which the people were Vasian. And talk of a princess.... you were no princess at least not to your knowledge. HIM....'C'mon' you think to yourself 'I mean who the hell came up with nameing some guy, HIM.

While you are still trying to sort out your thoughts, you hear a mumbling "Cas are you okay?"

You find you are able to move the gag away from your mouth. "Yeah im fine, Ryan?" You say shakily.

"Yeah it's me."

"What is going on here?" You ask him.

"Well I overheard one of those creepy guys saying something about 'the master being pleased' and how the ultimate evil shall finally be released."

"Oh well that's increadibly comforting." You say sarcastically. "The thing I don't get is why they said I had powers unless they're talking about the power to get straight A's."

"Maybe this princess they were talking about has powers and you two look similar?" Ryan asks quietly.

"That is definitly a possiblity." you respond half talking to yourself. You start to ask something else, when you stop moving. " Put the gag back Ryan!" You hiss to him. You nudge your gag back into your mouth.

"Grab her Slithe." You hear one of the kidnappers say, remembering the voice of the gruff man that had been so scared of you.

"Yesssss of coursssse, SSir." The other named Slithe answers, picking you up and throwing you over it's shoulder. "SSShall I bring her sssstraight to the Massster?"

"Yes dimwit of course you shall! Don't forget her three friends the Master wants to see them, too." The gruff man spits out.
1112111211.title: What's going on?

11121112111.content:
They take you into an underground cave. Your friends are slung on the shoulders of other men, but they are behind you and you can't see them.

They take you to the heart of the cave before setting you down. There is a wall of fire in front of you. a figure emerges from the flame.

"You have the Vasian court, I trust? All four of them?" he asks. You recoil at the smell of his breath. He must've feasted on garlic and garbage his whole life, you think.

You take a good look at him. He is...
11121112111.title: The Master Emerges

choices: You lose your head and tell him off for taking the wrong people
You wait to see what he has to say
111211121112.content: You gasp and spit out your gag. The man who had emerged from the flames was gorgeous. He had black hair and eyes the color of eyes--a clear blue. He looked strong and . . . what are you thinking? He just kidnapped you and your friends! Your dazed look turns to a glare as he continues to approach.
111211121112.title: Gorgeous . . . but evil!

choices: Fight back the guards and demand a better answer
Stare in confusion as they pull you away
1112111211122.content:
He grabs your chin roughly and studies your face, his hot breath on your cheek.
"Well done." He turns to the men that brought you here. "Take her to the dungeon."
As they come to drag you off, you burst out. "Wait! What is it that you want with me?"
"That is not your concern at the moment."
1112111211122.title: Hot breath

11121112111221.content:
'Not my concern? Not my concern!' you yell, grappling with the guards and pulling free. 'Who are you? What do you want with me and my friends?'
The man looks at you coolly. 'My name is Robespierre. I am the ruler of these lands. The Vasians are a brute race trying to overpower me. And you, my dear,' and he leaned really close, 'are their leader's daughter. So I should think it is obvious what I want you for.'
And he laughs, a horrible, evil laugh. 'Now bring her to the dungeon. Her friends too.'
This time you have no way of escaping, and you are thrown into a dungeon with a little bit of straw in the corner, and some stale bread to munch on and water to drink. You curl up on the pathetic amount of straw, and begin to cry. What was going on? How did this even happen?
You fall asleep for a few hours, and when you awake, you see Robespierre standing outside your cell.
'What do you want?' you yell at him.
He doesn't say anything, and walks away.
You clamber up and hurry to the bars of the cell. 'Come back!' you shout. 'Please. I need to talk to you.'
11121112111221.title: Locked Up

1112111212.content: The chanting continues as they carry you slung over their shoulder. You can hear your friends behind you, murmering in protest and it sounds as if they have been gagged. Nothing is said untill you reach a large clearing. You see no children or women only men painted in various colors. It looks like a warring tribe from some ancient Indian book or something. They set you and your friends down and hog tie your hands and feet. They then walk off and start to whisper in there horrible hissing tongue. Pssst... you hear behind you. you turn your head and see a young girl about your age. "Pleasssse," she hisses. "I will untie you but you musssst follow me quickly." You look over to your friends and see them nodding furosiously. Hmmm...
1112111212.title: Back At Camp

choices: Stay right behind the girl if you want to get out of here!
11121112121.content:
You nod your head vigurusly. She unties your hands and feet. You get up and she starts to move away quickly.

What about your friends?
11121112121.title: Friends?

111211121211.content: You rush before the girl as quickly as your feet will let you. Soon enough you come upon an occupied cell.
111211121211.title: Occupied

1112111212111.content:
Ryan looks up from the ground as you approach as quietly as you can. The girl that freed you, seeing that you weren't following doubled back to find you.

"I came to help youu," she said looking nervously towards their captors. "I'll get in troublesss"

"They're my friends," You say pointing to them angrily, not wanting to leave the only people you know you can trust here. They all nod vigiurously and you move to untie Ryan's bond.

Seeing little chance to pursuade you otherwise, the girl helps to untie Jacob and Leiah, telling them to be quiet. Silently as possible in shoes definatly not made for walking in, the four of you follow the girl into a hut away from the captors and fires in the camp.

"My name isss Casss," she said seeing the way was clear for the moment. "Yoursss?"
1112111212111.title: Escape

choices: Let Cass go and make your way to the town she pointed
Convince Cass to stay and lead on.
11121112121111.content:
You introduce yourselves quickly, and she smiles with a nod to each. When the coast is clear, she waves her arm telling you guys to follow and leads you out into the forest night.

You guys make your way along sevreal trails, and seem to be walking at a quick pace all night. Fear keeps your feet moving far past the time you would have normally quit. When the sky starts to lighten, Cass stops and points to a clearing in the trees where a dirt road lies.
"Follow that road into town. You will be safe there." She turnes to go back into the wood.
"What, you aren't comming with us?" Jacob said as they all stopped and sat on the ground. Leiah looked to be in a bad temper with leaves caught in her hair as if it was a crime for them to be walking through the filth. Cass shook her head.
"I have to go back," She said almost fearfully. "Beffore I am missssed."
"You probably are," you point out, indicating that they had been traveling most of the night.
11121112121111.title: Freedom

choices: Say, "No way - not until we free my friends!"
111211121212.content:
Well, you're only of use to your friends if you're free and able to regroup. You scamper off behind the girl, and she leads you behind and between tents until you burst into the forest. After a few minutes of running deeper, she slows and stops.

"Princesssss," she hisses pleadingly. "You are our last hope. Pleassssse use your powers to free my people from the power of the Dark Lord!"

You begin to feel rising panic. You're alone with a strange, alien girl who's telling you that you need to save an entire nation with powers you didn't know you had! Things are feeling beyond out of control.

"Look, I don't know what you're talking about, I don't have any powers, I just got in a car collision with my friends and I'm probably having a dream while I'm comatose in the hospital or something."
You catch the girl's eye, and she is looking at you with the same confusion as you're experiencing yourself.

"Princessss?" she asks desperately.

You heave a sigh. "Yeah. Yeah, what."

"I will take you to the city of Adroa. You will begin your work there!"
111211121212.title: Just go with it!

1112111212122.content:
"No way, not until we free my friends!" you say, shocked that she would think you would just abandon them.

The girl hissed, frustrated. "There is nothing we can do for them! They are not important, Princesss, it iss you who are to desstroy the Dark Lord!"

"Not without my friends, I'm not!" you whisper fiercely, glancing back to make sure none of the wierd creatures had come after you yet. "Now, will you help me or should I do it myself?"

The girl grimaces, looking over her shoulder towards the camp. "You can't go back there, they will recapture you."

"If you could free me, what's so hard about doing the same for my friends?" you don't understand why she's being so difficult. Doesn't she get it? Those are your best (and only, now that you're in this wierd place) friends back there, you can't just leave them!

"It is easier for two to flee than for five." Ok, you'll admit that makes sense, but you don't care. It's bad enough being called 'Princesss' and told you have to 'save Esylla' with your friends around to help, but without them . . .

"Look, I'm going to go back and help. Give me your knife." you hold out your hand, hoping she'll just give it to you and leave. Or, even better, that she'd actually help you.

The girl heaved a sigh that seemed to say 'fine, it's not my problem' and gave you the knife. "Good luck. You'll need it." Before you can reply, the girl has disappeared. Should you . . .
1112111212122.title: Abandon my friends?  No way . . .

11121112122.content:
You shake your head, not trusting the strange girl. One of your captors see her and run her off with a frown, before moving you closer to their sights.
Your one chance for escape now gone, you can do nothing but wait as they take you to him.
Your adventure is over before it even had ha chance to start, and you will never get to see the store filled malls of Beveryly Hills again. Worse, you'll never even get a first kiss, because He'll drain you of your life essence before the fall of the second day in this strange place.

End
11121112122.title: Lost Chance

111211122.content:
"I...I think, that you're right Jake...." You say shakily. " Maybe we should back away and run like hell!" Even as the words are said a pack of wolves (that resemble pictures of the Tasmanian Tiger an extinct wolf species with striped markings)begins to surround your small group.

You quickly turn around see at least a dozen of these creatures behind you. You know that you are surrounded.
111211122.title: Tasmanian Tigers???

choices: These Shri'la Guys Have To Be Better Then Some Mongrels
1112111221.content:
The four of you form a rough circle, backs inward, ready to fight and probably die trying. You and Jake had been taking Judo classes together since 1st grade, so you enter the ready position. Jake follows suit. Ryan enters a low football stance ready to tackle the first creature to leap. Leiah, having never been the one to put self-defense high on her priority list, crouched into the same position as you and Jake had. Honsetly she looked rediculous because she had no clue what she was doing, but you held back the immense urge to break down in a laughing fit.

"Braveness is a rare treasure in those bred for a life of danger, yet to find young ones who abound in it is quite another thing in itself." The largest of the pack announces.

Mouth agape, you relax yourself, face the leader full front, and speak softy remembering one of Gram's tidbits of wisdom, always speak with respect and humility when addressing one who yeilds power. "Excuse me, but did I understand what you said?" You say standing tall and keeping your guard up.

"Yes, humanchild, though you are not from our world, while residing in ours you may take advantages of things such as speaking with the more educated animals, mainly owls, wolves, deer, mice, and horses there are exception to that rule mind you." He says. His voice is not what you would have imagined an animal usually known for its viciousness would sound like. You find it pleasent but firm, and educating but not domineering or patronizing. You like him more and more with each word he speaks. "My name is Neale (Nee-all-ee) I am patron of these my family."

He paused and his ears pricked forward. You strained your ears to hear what his superior ears had heard. "We must make haste the Shri'la have found you out. Hurry or you shall be at the mercy of their foul claws and hideous fangs! For they want you also, except they want you dead." He makes a low grumbling sound, and the rest of the pack bolt into the trees.

I shall wait until you are rested to explain what exactly you were summoned here for." His parting were, "Your destiny is unlike any imaginable. On the morrow we shall speak again and all of your questions will have answers."
1112111221112.title: A unique destiny

11121112211121.content:
Over a half hour had gone by since Neale had left. Conversation was all that had happened in that time. So many questions and, so far, no answers. You have always considered yourself to be a logical rational person, but right now all you felt was fear and incertainty. You were still playing the part of 'the intelligent one,' but inside your mind was swimming.

A soft scratching on the door to your room halted all speech. Ryan got up to check the outside. He cautiously openned the door. A lean but muscular animal entered your room. "Hello O Promised Ones, I am Firin youngest sister of Neale. I suppose that he told you I would bring in anything you could need."

"He did indeed tell us that you were going to grace us with your presence." You reply softly not wanting to incure any wrath with this species.

"A gentile speaking human child how odd, pleasant, but odd." She replies. Looking at the rest of the group, she speaks again. "I have brought bedding, clothes, seeing that you are in dire need of decent clothing, and nourishment that should suffice any hunger pangs you are feeling." She barked outside the door, and half a dozen of the same creatures came into your room carrying plush matresses, blankets pillows, an assortment of clothing, and "nourishment" that really seemed like a feast fit for a royal banquet. When they had entered your room, you noticed that they were walking on their hind legs and carrying your items in their fore legs. You thought to yourself how curious these animals are.

"Firin may I ask you a question?" You ask her.

"Of course child, I do not suppose I am the right person to ask, but I shall try to answer your question." She replies.

"Well Neale said that all of our questions would be answered tomorrow, but one question has been tugging at my mind ever since I encounterd your pack." You pause. " What is you species? I assume you are not a wolf, or a coyote, but you do resemble a species on Earth called the Tasmanian Tiger." You finish, hoping to God that you have not offended her.

She chuckles, at least that is what you believe she did. Then she responds, "Our species in your language is called Bakinit.We have been described as being as cunning and swift as wolves are, intelligent and strong as tigers are, loyal and dependable as canines, and as agile and stubborn as felines. Though to which we are closest to I do not know." She stops for a moment. "With that I shall give you my leave." She then exits the room, leaving you and your friends dumbfounded by their hospitality and their presice yet respectful speech.
11121112211121.title: Bakinit

Not just any ordinary staff, but one you would expect to see with Merlin, with the crystal on top. Only mine had a hidden blade inside. The cloaked man had told you that you would be the most powerful in the magic department. Something about having a "mind" for it. You didn't know what exactly he meant by it. "Who will be the bravest?"

Not one perticular color, but several. He began to speak. "Blue for water. Red for fire. Green for earth. White for the mind. Black for the winds of time. Yellow for life. Silver for the body, and Gold for the Ultimate. Go now, share your gifts with your friends."

You didn't understand what he was talking about at all, then a voice, came out of your mouth. You didn't know the words, but it felt right. It all just came out. You went to Ryan. "Blue for Water." Then to Leiah. "Red for Fire." And last to Jake. "Green for Earth."

Then a voice came into your head. You looked around to see if any of my friends had heard it. No one seemed fazed, it was as if time had stopped. "You redily shared the three most precious of your gifts. For that I will give you all." The voice faded and time began again, you exited the trance like state you had been in.

You searched slowly through the bushes, leaf by leaf by leaf. Then, all of a sudden a raptor's head popped out. It snarled at the gang a bit, sniffed them, and came out the bushes and talked.

"Right this way". He said as he hissed with a gargly tone of voice. "By the way, the name's Balbok." Then the thing that had introduced itself as Balbok lead the group to silver looking road with blue skies hovering over it. "Oh yesss, another thing, our destination is the city of Calronih the captital of Esylla." After that, Balbok got up into his carriage that was larger than a mini-van, instructed you and your friends to do the same.
11121122.title: The Bush creature

choices: Balbok and the rest finally arrive at the capital
111211221.content:
Balbok got right into his carriage in the driver's seat. the gang followed toward the back of it. The gang heard a slight snarl sound from the front.

"What was that?" Ryan asked nervoulsy.

"Don't worry", Balbok replied, "Instead of horsepower in your terms, this is running on dragonpower."

"What?" Ryan said. He looked out the right side of the carraige and saw two, green, scally 16-foot dragons hovering 3-feet above the silver road. "Oh...ok...I got ya now" He said as he winked at Balbok straight in the eye.

"How did we get here?" Leiah asked.

"Well..." Balbok started repling while staring toward the back. "You found me...bassically."

"What??!!!"

"When you found me in the busshess, and might I thank you for that, I was a born as a tour guide for Esylla. I've been waiting so long to pass on knowledge of this fascinating world!"

"Where did our normal lives go then?"

"I believe, sadly, that you don't have a normal life anymore. The chambers are already locked to the outside world forever, as you can see."

All in the back looked behind them, astonished. There were two 70-foot doors, locked with a strip of wood Then, the doors disappeared into thin air.

"Oh my God, you guys!" Leiah said excitedly. "We're on permanent vacation! I got to call my mom!"

"I'm sorry, me lady" Balbok said in a serious, regretful tone. "No telephones or anything may be used to contact the outside world."

Now, the tides have turned. Not only is this just a story anymore, it's a life or death situation.
111211221.title: Balbok:the tour guide part I

1112112211.content:
You feel utterly disgusted at what Balbok has just told you. No way back to your normal life? You certainly don't agree with Leiah's point of view that this is a permanent vacation. The thought of being trapped in this world forever, never seeing your family again, nearly has you in tears.
"Isn't there any way of escaping?" you ask Balbok.
Balbok looks at you closely, and sees how upset you are getting.
"Well, I have never heard of it being done, but the wizard Merrybeard is a very powerful fellow, maybe he could help you."
"Where can we find him?" Ryan asked.
"He is in the city of Calronih, where we are headed for now. I'm just warning you though, do not expect him to send you back home for free."
You consider this idea, imagining all sorts of scenarios of retreiving broomsticks from Wicked Witches, a la "The Wizard of Oz". You comfort yourself with the fact that Dorothy returned home, so why shouldn't you?
The carraige reaches the city walls, which are very tall and impenetrable. Balbok leaps off the carraige, and knocks on the door.
"Who is it?" a man's voice calls out gruffly.
"It is Balbok, with our latest guests", Balbok replies.
Something about the way he says "guests" unnerves you.
"You may enter", the man replies, and the tall wooden gates open.
"Follow me", Balbok says.
1112112211.title: To Calronih

11121122111.content:
"Woah, you guys," you say as everyone starts towards the doors. "Why should we trust this . . . uh . . . guy," (is that the right term for a raptor? you think, confused),"we don't know anything about this place."

They stop and Jake speaks up "Well, what else are we supposed to do?"

"I don't know!" you say, exasperated, "I just don't feel that going into that place is right."

"Ok, ok . . . no need to get excited about it. I just though you might have an idea, being the smartest one in this group." Jake shrugs.

Balbok, standing by oberserving, interrupts impatiently. "It'sss imperative that you come into the city."

"Hey, who are you to say what's 'imperative'?" Ryan turns on him.

Balbok shrugs this off in one sinuous movement and continues, "The woodsss are dangerouss at night . . ."

Leiah, who had been straightening her hair, pipes up. "Well, duh--look what walking in all that dirt already did to my shoes!" She turns a well-shaped leg so all can view the miniscule amount of dust on her designer platforms.

You clear your throat and try to ignore Leiah's comment. "Look, it's not that we don't trust you . . . it's just that we don't trust you." You slow down as you finish, realizing what you just said. Balbok looks thoroughly confused.

Jake whispers to you out of the corner of his mouth, "Cas, I don't think that made sense."

You sigh, "Well, that's beyond the point. All I'm saying is that I don't want to go into that city. I think we should just figure things out for ourselves."

"Okay, Cas. You're the one with the brains." Ryan steps over to join you a few feet from the city wall. "Let's go, you guys," he says, "See ya, Reptile dude."

Leiah shrugs and follows Ryan away from the city back into the forest. Jake hesitates a moment, then runs to catch up. "Heck, who am I to disagree?"

You are soon among the trees again, but you're not certain which way to go. Plus, you're all getting a little tired. What should you do?

"How come you didn't tell me?" He hissed.

You decide to trust Balbok. Your friends, scared of the powers they have just seen you exhibit, are a little more hesitant.

"Come on!" You say. "It's our only choice." You look helplessly at your friends, willing one of them to stand up for you.

"She's right" Ryan says. "We'd better trust him."

The weird feelings for your long-time friend come flooding back. You push them away and silently thank him for taking your side. Balbok leads you into the bar, a shifty looking place with creatures loads stranger than Balbok seated, standing, and even dancing. Jake moves, as if to sit down.

"Not here", Balbok whispers. "It'sss not sssafe."

The four of you follow, a little reluctantly, as Balbok heads to a small door you hadn't noticed on the far wall. When he opens it, a wave of stench like you've never experienced hits you and your friends.

"Oh gawd! What is the stink?" exclaims Leiah.

Balbok pulls you in quick. "You mussst not draw attention to yourssself!" He cries.

Leiah scoffs, then turns to walk away. "We don't need him, guys. We're from Beverly Hills- we can survive anything on our own."

Jake starts to follow, but Ryan and you don't move. Do you follow her, and risk encountering who knows what? Or do you continue to trust Balbok, your strange Esyllan guide?

         Leiah keeps a fare distance away as she watches it with eyes the size of saucers. You turn back to look up the leathery hide at the large mouth. The thousands of teeth you can see are covered in the debris of wanton eating. The smell, was coming from the things...mouth?
         "Your Majesssty!" called Bolbok again. His voice seemed to be getting hoarse.
         The lizard sighs and looks down on them with mild irritation. His voice booms out like thunder, "What is it?"
         It's not the sudden rumblings from his voice that flatten you and your friends...it's the stench as his breath hits your full in the face. He waits as you pick yourselves up. What do you say such a creature, anyway?

11121122112122.content:
You shake your head, trying to figure out what to do. Meanwhile, Ryan takes the matter into his own hands. "Dude, you think we'll trust you to help us? You were trying to ditch us! We're better off without you."

He looks around to see if we all agreed. No one says otherwise, so he turns and heads off down the street. Jake shrugs and follows. Leiah gasps at the thought of being left behind, grabs your hand and you both run to catch up.

Soon, you are completely lost in the weirdest city you've ever seen (and you grew up in LA!). It's hard to believe that just a few hours ago you were leaving your Grandma's house in Beverly Hills . . .

Jake comes to a halt and you nearly run into him. "What?" you ask.

"We have to talk to someone or we'll never get out of here--I mean, what else can we do?"

You all agree that he's right, but who should you talk to? Looking around, you notice a reptilian shopkeeper selling fruit who looks nice enough . . . yuo also notice a normal-looking woman buying some bread. You decide to . . .

Jake (as open jawed as the rest) slowly walks around waving hands in front of some of the frozen inhabitants of this new and wonderous city.

"Gu..uu..yy..ss?" Leiah asks, her face almost as frozen as the inhabitants themselves.

"what on earth (not that this seems to be earth anymore!) is happening. One minute I'm yelling out the back of the car about a spending spree in the mall the next I'm seeing weird freaky creatures appear in a weird world and Cas freezes them!"

You giggle nervously looking at your hands amazed.

Leiah rubs her chin thoughtfully.

"Somehow we ought to be able to use this to our advantage. And I wonder if the rest of us can do things like Casian can?"

Trust Leiah, you think to yourself, on how to take advantage of the situation!

Ryan motions toward the huge, oddly shaped creature that was rushing the four of you, but now finds itself literally frozen in its tracks.

"Maybe we ought to take a look around and get out of the range of big ugly there, and see what's happening around the city."

The rest of you emphatically agree with Ryan and quickly disembark from the still frozen carriage.

You're not more than 100 yards away when everything starts moving again. The creature that Ryan dubbed "big ugly" almost falls over when it sees you've disappeared. It scans around, spots the four of you, and immediately rushes toward you. You make a motion and the world freezes again.

A voice behind you says, "Your freeze spell would last longer if you directed at, say, just one individual, rather than the local area."

All four of you spin around and see the oddest man. He can't be more than four and a half feet tall, is wearing a drab gray robe and cloak, is completely bald on the top of his head, with a multi-coloured beard that extends down to his knees.

The strange man bows deeply from his waist. "The wizard Merrybeard at your service. And that creature," he gestures toward the frozen 'big ugly', "is..."
1112112211221.title: Just who is big ugly?

"He was sent to meet you so that..."

111211222.content:
You step into Balbok's carriage and find yourself in a city. Staring agape at what just happen, you turn to find Balbok gone and your friends just as confused as you are.

"Anyone know what just happened?" Jake asks.

Everyone looks at each other, shaking their heads. Then one by one, they turn to you.

"Well?" Leiah demands. "What now?"

"I don't know." You murmur. "I don't understand what just happen and I don't know where we are."

"Great!" Leaih shouts throwing her hands up in the air. "This is what we get for following the 'intelligent' one. Just great!"

"Hey lay off, Leiah." Jake intercedes quickly. "Do you know where we are?"

"Well no, but..."

"Then don't lay into Cas. She's just doing the best she knows how." Jake glances at you and grins encouragingly. You smile softly back, thinking maybe Ryan isn't the one you should be going for.

"Sooo what do you propose we do then?" Ryan asks after a second.

Jake turns to Ryan and the mood is broken. "Propose? Did you just say propose? I think that's the biggest word I've ever heard you use Ryan. Are you sure you know what that means?"

As Jake continues to heckle Ryan, Leaih sidles over to you. "I'm sorry, Cas." She murmurs. "I' just scared and I don't know what to do. I guess I took all my fear out on you."

"Don't worry about." You smile. "I understand. I'm just as scared and confused as you are." You assure her.

"But you don't look it." She comments quietly and then turns, leaving you speechless. As she walks over to Ryan and links her arm with his, you catch Jake watching you. It dawns on you that he started teasing Ryan so that you and Leaih could make up and you feel grateful to have him as your advocate.

As you walk toward Jake, a voice snakes out from behind you. "Are you the chosen ones?" It hisses.

Whirling you prepare yourself, only to find Jake and Ryan in front of both you and Leaih. "Back off." Jake growls as Ryan adds, "You don't want to mess with us."

The snake-like creature just advances, paying no heed to their warning. When it's close, but still out of stricking distance, it shoots a ball of blue flame from it's hand.

Crying in fear, you watch in horror as the ball hits Jake in the chest. Rushing forward you stand amazed as you notice that nothing has happened. You and Jake exchanged surprised glances as Leaih cries out, "He's doing it again."

Hurriedly you spin, and out of instinct more than anything else, you make a scooping motion with your hand and then you shove your hand, palm out, in the creature's direction. The creature lights on fire and you watch as it slowly burns to death.

As one, you turn and look at each other. What is going on?

"Welcome to Calronih, Chosen Ones." An equine voice says. "I do you homage."

A unicorn stands in front of you, with a bowed head. All around her stand other fairy tale creatures, wolves, tigers, griffins, dragons, fairies, and elves.

You look at each other and realize, You're not in Kansas anymore.
111211222.title: The Chosen Ones

choices: You and Ryan are seperated from everyone elce
You are all taken to a dungun.
1112112222.content:
Some of the creatures go down on one knee, others bow low. You look at your friends, who are all looking back at eachother. You are thoroughly embarrassed and confused. Who were these "Chosen ones" and how did they have anything to do with them?! Suddenly Jake stepped forward and bowed, and you all followed his lead.
As they all stood up Jake said "I thank you for welcoming us into your home." Then a little girl with amazing paper-like wings started to walk up to Jake, and reached for his hand, but an arrow shot the ground in front of her, surprising her, making her leap back. Just seconds latter, knights surrounded them, taking you and your friends by the arms and forcing you onto your knees, and you feel the cold steel of a knife on your neck. Jake put up such a fight that he ended up prostrate on the ground. Wow, you think, that was fast, the
It is really loud as Jake yells and some of the creatures try to fight the knights, but all their effort was in vain.
Suddenly everything went quiet. A small gap was made in the circle of soldiers around them, and in glided a woman. So smooth and light was her motion that you think that she IS gliding. She was dressed in a dark blue dress with a roman style to it. On top of her head sad a diamond tiara; Sapphires, diamonds and pearls hung from her neck and ears, and were beaded into her dark brown hair. You look at her eye shadow and are surprised to see so much dark blue sparkly stuff surrounding her eyes. In a pattern all over her pale face were white sparkles, and her lips were a frosty white. You think that you have never seen a more beautiful woman in your life, and you look to Ryan, and can tell that he is thinking the same thing. You felt such a surge of jealousy rise in you, along with a genuine hate already for who ever this was. Luckly all Jake could see were her shoes!
"I am the Queen of Eyslla, Hannaneel Poti-Phera." Her voice was filled with autority and power, and just from this statement, you felt like falling down and doing whatever it was that she asked out of fear.
"Hariek, get them on their feet, I want a better look at these "Cosen Ones." She said, in a moking tone. A man at her side showted orders ant the four soldiers were were holding you and you friends, and they volently pulled you up onto your feet, hands behind your back. The Queen walked up to you and looked at you in the eyes, and you thought to your self that you had never seen such blue eyes in your life. They were such a bright blue that you didnot beleve they were real. She walked around all of them, and then walked back the way they came, stoping to whisper something to Hariek, pointing to you and to Ryan, then she dissapeared into the gap between the soldiers.
1112112222.title: Hannanel Poti-Phera, Queen of Esylla

"YOU GUYS!!!" You hear Leiah shrieking behind you. "Hello people this outfit was NOT made for running through the woods!"

"Leiah, no one cares." Ryan says looking back at her.

"Excuse you?" She retorts quickly glaring at Ryan

"You heard what I said Leiah, no one cares anymore. I know we are all sick of hearing you whine and complain about what you look like and how hard it is to be perfect little you." Ryan states.

"I could say the say about you mister egomanic All-American Quarterback!"She says back "Hey man look how big my muscles are." She says making fun of his physique.

You say throwing your hands up in the shear stupidity of it all. "Look we have to find somewhere we are going to be staying tonight if you haven't already noticed its late afternoon, and we don't know where we are."

"Aight."...Ryan

**************************************************

"Be quiet a moment guys!" He hisses.They all stop talking and look up seeing something flying, well actually falling through the air.

"THAT LOOKS LIKE A PERSON!" You yell. Watching it rapidly decending to the earth below, you take off running towards where it looks like it will fall. 11121211.content:
Maltir smiles at you and your friends. He is a fairly stereotypical wizard, with a long white beard and a blue hat. In fact, he looks uncannily like that Merlin fellow from the Disney version of "The Sword and the Stone". (If you haven't seen it, rent it. You have to hear that really cool song the tortoise sings under the water. It rocks.) So anyway, this wizard guy is smiling. And you're thinking, 'Hey, this wizard guy hasn't even spoken yet, but I like him already. Maybe it's the blue hat. Blue is my favourite colour after all.' (And I did not spell colour wrong by the way, that's the way we spell it in my country.)
"Welcome to Esylla", Maltir says in a firm but commanding voice. "This is the land where dreams can come true."
"You mean I'll finally lose my virginity?" Jake snorted. I elbowed him.
Maltir glared at him, then continued. "Esylla is a very strange, yet very wonderful land. Don't ask questions of why you're here, just enjoy it while it lasts. The time will pass very quickly. And now I'll leave you with a choice. Do you want to pass through the green door or the red door? Both doors hold a mystery to them, one equips you with the magic of your forefathers, while the other will do nothing. You may also chose to not go through any door at all, but the answer must be unanamous."
With a wave of his wand two doors magically appeared, looking freshly painted. Which door do you go through? Or will you go through one at all?
11121211.title: Doors

"Let's chose a door guys." You said. They all nodded their heads, the answer was unanimous, but now to choose a door.

Logically speaking-the Green Door seems as if it would represent freshness, new life. Red door seems like a death color.

1112121111.title: Wise

11121211112.content:
Birds chirped overhead and you slowly began to wake from the dream you had been having about laying on the pool side, laughing with R-

“Ryan!!!”

Leiah’s whining voice was the final sound that pulled you to the waking world. She sounded as if she were in a panic. Sitting up slowly, you moan at the aching that rippled through your shoulders. Your bed seemed very far away at that moment. Lifting your head you looked over to the others, only to see Leiah sitting up, looking very disgusted.

“Wha?” Came Ryan’s muffled reply, he was laying face down on the ground, still not awake. One of Leiah’s arms was underneath him.

“You... you drooled on my arm!” She protested, pulling away from him.

“Do you two ever stop fighting?” Jake complained as he rolled over, groaning. “There’s a rock there..” He explained, finally sitting up himself.

You didn’t say anything though, having noticed that you weren’t were you had all fallen asleep the night before. And that wizard was nowhere to be seen. Standing up and stretching your arms, you played over in your head the events of the night before. Before the wizard had left he had said something. Behind you, the other three were still arguing and complaining, or complaining about arguing. Either way, it wasn’t interesting you. You need to remember what he said to you.

“All of you, be quiet!” You suddenly turn on them, watching as they stare up at you, having stopped in mid-sentence. “That.. Wizard. He was here? That wasn’t a dream, was it?”

Ryan shook his head. “I ah, kind of have been hoping it was, but, if what you’re asking is do we remember it, yeah, I do.”

You let out a sigh, pulling a hand through your knotted hair slowly. “Well, if he was real, then I think, it is in our own safety, to assume that what he said is real.”

Leiah rolls her eyes. “What do you mean, what he said is real? What did he say?”

You sigh again. “You have been given powers, that’s what he said. And I don’t want to make the mistake of not believing him and getting ourselves in trouble. We have to assume that we have all been given powers...”
Jake actually grinned. “Alright! What kind of powers? I wonder if we can control the elements or something cool like that! Maybe we can make fire whenever we want!” He stood up. “Fire!!”

Nothing happened, and Leiah and Ryan began laughing at how funny Jake looked with both hands held out in front of him. You didn’t find it so funny. “Listen to me!” You say in annoyance. “We can’t just... play around, trying to figure out what kind of powers we have!”

Leiah raised a brow at you, flipping her hair over her shoulder. “Then what do you propose, Miss-know-it-all?”

Ignoring her comment you begin pacing. “We have to find that wizard, or somebody else that can help up. Magical powers can’t just be... used. We have to learn how to handle them, or we’ll end up only doing more damage or something. I think we need to start exploring again. That wizard has to have come from somewhere. And he can’t be the only person in... where-ever this is...”

Ryan yawned. “So where do we go? You have any idea where civilization is?”

You shook your head. “There are mountains that way..” You gesture to your right. “And there is a river that way, I can hear the water running..”

Jake watches you. “So? Which way do we go?”
11121211112.title: Awakening

111212111122.content:
"Don't be stupid," Ryan shoved Jake as he joined in the conversation. "Everyone knows if you follow a river you'll be certain to find people."

"Who are you calling stupid?" Jake was obviously becoming irritated. "I think it's stupid not to just try out our powers ourselves. I mean, if we're the only ones who have them . . ."

"Come on," you cut in, "what makes you think we're the only ones with powers here? The only other person we've come across here certainly had some powers of his own!"

Before Jake could form a scathing reply, Leiah jumped in. "Um, you guys, I totally think we should head for the river. I mean, water's good . . ."

"No duh, Leiah," said Jake.

"I wasn't finished." Leiah put on her best pout, the one she'd been practicing in front of mirrors since she was six. "Look at those mountains," she pointed a well-manicured finger at them as she spoke, "they look kind of creepy to me anyway."

Staring at the mountains, rising like gloomy, fog-shrouded sentinels in the distance, you can't help but agree. Still, appearances could be decieving . . . and you hadn't even seen the river yet. It could be just as creepy-looking as the mountains, couldn't it?

Ryan turned to you, trusting in your intelligence to make the right decision. "So, where should we go?"

Trying not to think of your dream and avoiding his eyes, you try to think of the problem at hand.

"Yeah, Casian, which way?" Jake asked.

With Leiah giving you her familiar your-smarter-you-decide look, you open your mouth to state your decision:
111212111122.title: Rivers and Mountains and Fights, Oh My!

You feel no pain, but see the puddle of blood in your lap and a large jagged piece of glass protruding from your chest.

I, Casian, stand my ground with the wizard. Maybe it is that great hat or the fact that I've always been fascinated with wizards and witches, fairies and dragons, spells and potions. This may be one heck of a great dream I'm in and I intend to explore the possibilities here in this strange forest.

I walk around with my hands behind my back as if I'm freakin Nancy Drew trying to solve a great mystery.

"Uh Mr. Wizard, sir? You say we must pick a color of door to go through?"

He nods his head yes and his white beard, reaching his waist, bobs up and down. He waits patiently while the rest of the group are retrieved. I tell them not to be party poopers and for us to have fun with this, they reluctantly agree.

"I think we should pick the green door. Obviously, green means go, go through the door and red means stop, stop and think before you enter, duh, red, devil...something evil...yes, definately green. Are you guys with me?"

They shook their heads yes and we waited for the wizard to give us some great parting words of wisdom and he did.

"Go then on the path you have chosen but remember that things are not always as they seem."

Oh great, I thought, it sounded like we were about to embark on a strange through the looking glass adventure where babies wern't babies but piglets and giant cards would be chasing us. It couldn't be any worse than Fear Factor could it?

"Well go on.", Jake snapped at me.

I reached out and turned the knob to the green door.

11121211221.content:
The door slowly swung open and behind it I could see . . . nothing. Well, obviously there was something behind the door--just not what I expected. I stood there, stunned, when Leiah peered over my shoulder.

"Hey, what sort of a joke is this? All I can see are trees." She sounded as if she were actually looking for something more. I sighed. Once again, I had to explain.

"That's because the door doesn't lead anywhere." I stepped through the doorway and turned around to face everyone else. "See? I'm still in this stupid forest in this stupid clearing with this stupid wizard, and did I mention that this just isn't fun anymore?"

Leiah, looking puzzled, started walking around and through the doorway. Ryan rolled his eyes and stepped over to me. "Doesn't it actually make more sense that it doesn't lead anywhere but here? I mean, rather than teleporting us somewhere or revealing some monstrous creature," he whispered.

"Yes," I replied, somewhat sullen. He was right, of course, but I didn't have to be happy about it. What I had really hoped to get out of the green door was answers--where are we? how did we get here? why are we here?

Meanwhile, Jake had turned to the wizard--Maltir?--and his bad mood seemed to have become even worse.

"What's the big idea? I knew your whole 'pick a door' thing was . . ."

"Well done," Maltir cut Jake off (which did not improve his attitude). "You have chosen correctly. Now I may serve as your guide and guardian if you so choose." He made a sweeping motion with his arm and the two door disappeared. Leiah jumped as the doorframe she had been examining disappeared. Ryan grabbed her hand and brought her over to where I stood with Jake. We all stared at the wizard.

"That's it? That's what we get for choosing correctly?" I was beginning to feel rather frustrated myself.

"Hey, Casian, it doesn't sound that bad," Ryan tried to soothe me. "After all, who doesn't need a 'guide and guardian' these days?"

Maltir nodded majestically, apparently oblivious to the sarcasm dripping from Ryan's words. "I will aid you, if you will have me. Or you may simply speak the word and I will leave."

He looked at us expectantly. I glanced around at the others, only to find them looking at me. Uh-oh--it looked like I would, once again, have to make the decision.
11121211221.title: The door to . . . nowhere?

"Hey," says Leiah, giving the man a seductive look.

You can't believe that just because this thing is apparently alive and male, she is automatically flirting with it.

"I am Aurkan," When the man speaks, the entire earth starts to shake. You begin to think that it would have been a whole lot better if you had just gone the other way.

"What is your quest?" the man asks. Everyone looks at each other, to afraid to answer.

"Um well, we don't really have a quest." Jake stumbles.

"Then you sahll die," Aurkan proclaims

"There's definitely something I don't like about this dude," Ryan mutters in your ear.

"Yeah, I'm thinking we should probably leave." you whisper back.

"Cas, I'm scared," Leiah whimpers, staring terrified into Aurkan's eyes. She looks rather like a frightened rabbit, and you'd laugh if you weren't shaking so hard.

"Who is this guy?" Jacob hisses.

"How am I supposed to know?" both you and Ryan answer at the same time.

Meanwhile, Aurkan is raising his hands to do . . . something, and whatever it is you don't want to find out. "Run!" you're not sure who said it, but you entirely agree and your legs are already moving before your brain quite catches up.

"Leiah, come on!" Jacob shouts from behind you and you glance back to see him grab her arm and yank her into motion.

"Hurry!" You just know that something awful will happen if you hang around where this Aurkan guy is. What did he mean, 'then you shall die'? Not while your legs still work!

Soon, all four of you are deep in the woods again. What should you do now?

1112121212.content:
"I think we've lost him!" Leiah gasps as she stops to catch her breath.

"C'mon Leiah! You can't stop now!" Ryan exclaims.

She pulls off a shoe and waves it in his face, "You see this? This isn't a Nike or some dumb sneaker, this is a Dansko! And it isn't made for running!"

"Shhh! Leiah!" You try to calm your friend. "Look, I think you're right. We seem to have left him behind."

"What do you think he meant by our having to die because we didn't have a quest?" Jake asked, "What type of place is this where the first person we see wants us dead?"

"Well it certainly isn't Beverly Hills!" Leiah sobs.

11122111121.content:
The door is hard to open. The boys find their strength has been depleted due to the accident and getting out of the car through the trees.

Once it is open, a strange, unusual and powerful odor overwhelms them. They fall to the ground, gasping for air. Their mouths are dry. Noses are running and eyes are burning. The odor worsens and weakens them. They are near to being unconscious.

They crawl away from the odor. Strangely, they are going deeper into the hole and don't realize it. At present, their only goal is to get away from that ghastly odor.

Time seems like days as they crawl along. The horrible odor decreases and relieves their senses gradually.

They are now able to sit up and gaze at each other. They find their eyes are still cloudy and they can't focus on each other clearly yet.
They can't hear any noise. Breathing is still labored.

They reach over to each other and hold hands for support. They shake and tremor as they grab each other. Everybody's skin feels like rubber.

They attemtpt to cry and scream in fright. Their eyes are clear. They can all see each other. But nobody can hear anybody. They can see their mouths moving; but nothing is heard.

As they look at each other and hope to hear their familiar voices, they hear animal voices coming from each other. Each of them now can make sounds like horses, dogs, wolves, pigs, monkeys,birds. They try to cry; but their tears are like animals.

Their brains are functioning and know what is happening. It is frightening to each of them; but they can't control the voices or texture of hands.

They try to stand and find they can't. Their only stance is on all fours. They all resemble animals walking around. They all have the power to move around in the same fashion as any of the voices they use.

Have they regressed back into an evolutionary time? Is this punishment for their carefree lives. Each still has control of his or her mind; but can't communicate the thinking process to another.

You looked at your once human friends.

Jake had turned into a black cat with startling green eyes of a meadow with blue around the edges, as if a lake, and white at the paws and tip of the tail.

Ryan into a dog the colour of hay, and a big black patch over his left eye of the sea.

And Casian into a bobcat, coloured dark brown and grey, except the white freckles over her face, with the eyes of a storm.

You look down at yourself, what would you be?

Past your black-flecked long snout, with a big black wet nose at the tip, you had tuffed grey-silver fur, with a big white streak down your front, you lower your eyes down more and find huge paws, with black claws, a grey bushy tail . . . .

You were a wolf.

So, 2 dogs and 2 cats.

How were we ever going to change back?

And, where were we?

It's not fair, why us?

Suddenly, the warm, karmatic glow that once surrounded Lariel dims and in it's place, an incomprehensible darkness begins to surround Riav. The bell turns black.

With that Queen Jart'ja descended the tower to her chambers where she would spend time contimplateing her next move.
