Unaware that they were being watched, the four teenagers stumbled upon a small village.
1112221.title: The Evil Queen Jart'ja

11122211.content:
The village was not in any way the Ritz Carlton, which you visited on all of your overnight major shopping trips. Even though it wasn't posh you couldn't complain, no icky stick goo, and no infernal forest!

A small inn was quickly found near the town square, but sooner then naught you all realized that their currency was almost definitly not American Dollars.
11122211.title: Oops, Wrong Type Of Money

111222111.content:
"Well, we do need food and a place to rest for a few," Casian remarks and looks at you.

Jake and Ryan look at you also. You notice then staring at your neck and for a moment you wonder why.

"What? Do I have a hickie showing?" You ask jokingly.

"No, but you do have something we may be able to sell to get some useful stuff."

As your hands close around your great grandmothers diamond necklace you think you might cry. How could you give it up? Great grandmother Patricia was the greatest woman... until she died.

Your eyes wandered away for a moment to a weird looking person. Or at least you hoped it was a person. It looked like a mixture of a hobbit and elf from the 'Lord of the Rings' movie you watched.

Where are you?!

"Something isn't right here," You state plainly and reach for the clasp of your necklace.
111222111.title: Grandmother's Necklace

1112221111.content:
It's only a material item, you try to tell yourself as you hand the neckless to Casian. She smiles at you with understanding.

Ryan and Jake don't really seem to get the point. As you feel tears filling your eyes Jake asks you a question, "What's the big deal? I'll buy you another one when we get back home."

Casian elbows him in the side so hard he lets out a yelp and falls to his knees.

Ryan smirks for a second and looks away. "What is that?!" His eyes become wide and he jumps back nearly knocking Casian over Jake.

Jake is looking at the Hobbit/Elf person who is... no he isn't levitating furniture out of that house! Around the town you notice more and more weird looking people. That's the least of your problems because it's getting dark out now and you have no where to go!
1112221111.title: Creatures

11122211111.content:
"Maybe he could help us," You offer and look at Casian who just nods.

"Jake is slowly recovering and finally stands up. "I'm not going to walk up and talk to any freaky looking men in a freaky little town with it's freaky currency."

And you thought you were the panicy one.

"I'll go talk to him." Casian says and starts for the man.

Ryan looks at you and Jake and then sprints off after Casian.

The sky seems to go pitchblack all of a sudden and you notice people rushing to get inside.

"We better go after them," You tell Jake.

"I'll stay here and wait,"

"I don't know if-"

There's a loud screech from behind you which sends you spinning around. You peer into the dark woods. There's nothing there. You turn back around to see Jake looking at you. With an unspoken agreement you two run for Casian and Ryan.
11122211111.title: Noises in the night

111222111111.content:
"Hurry! Hurry!" The Elf/Hobbit urges the four of you into the house. "The woodland creatures of the night aren't very forgiving for people to be woundering around in."

"Woodland creatures of the night?" Jake asks with a small smirk.

"heh," You try to give a cool and calm smile back.

The elf/hobbit looks at you as if seeing you for the first time. "You brought one of them into my house?!"

"Wha-What!?" You manage and back behind Ryan. "I'm not a woody creature."

You admit you look horrible, but you didn't think you looked that bad. Your hair is matted with mud to your head and there are clumps of tar on every part of your body.

"She just needs a bath, we've had a very hard day Mr.-" Casian starts.

"Jarth." The man rises and walks for the back room. "My name is Jarth. Your friend can follow me to the wash room."
111222111111.title: Woodland Creature

1112221111111.content:
You wearily follow this Jarth fellow into a comfortable looking room. He leads you to the adjoining room which is the bathroom. He turns on the tap. Oh thank God for small favors, Running Water! You think to yourself excitedly.

"Would you like regular soap, Paltina soap, or just plain?" He asks seeming quite nonchalant about it. A plain bath was out of the question, regular was pretty boring, but you had no idea what this Paltina soap was.
1112221111111.title: Yes A Bath!

11122211111111.content:
"Paltina?" Your answer was more of a question, but Jarth just shrugged and dropped the soap on a table by the tub and left.

"Thanks... I think," You call out and step towards the warm bath.

You quickly undress and jump into the clean warm water. Taking the wash rag and the soap from the table you start to wash. The water is already brown but once the bar of Paltina touches it, it turns clear again and a smell of tangerines and apples fills the bathroom.

You dunk under the water and once you resurface you are spotless, it doesn't look like you touched a but of mud.

"This is great," you say to yourself and get out of the tub, wrapping yourself in a large, white, cotton towel.

You have to find out where he gets that soap and bring some home.

That's if you ever get home.

You drain the water from the bath and quickly dry off and change. When you step out of the bathroom you can see Casian sleeping on the chair like object in the corner of the room. Jarth and Ryan are sitting at what you believe is a table and Jake is sleeping on the floor.

You're pretty beat yourself.
11122211111111.title: Bath of a lifetime

111222111111111.content: You fall asleep. The most restful rem cycle you've had in ages!
111222111111111.title: Sleep

choices: ask about the "horrible grotesque things from the forest"
ask about the crystals of Esylla
111222111111112.content:
"So..." you begin, wandering to the table. You might be tired as hell but there is no way you could sleep at a moment like this. Besides, you really want some of that soap. "not interrupting, I hope?" you slip into a chair and watch their blank faces for a moment.

Ryan looks tired. Hell, everyone looks tired. But he looks dogeaten and downright dirty. It's kinda gross. And Jarth, well, he looked gross to, but you guess he always looks like that. The hobbits in that movie did have awfully dirty feet, you remind yourself with a shudder.

"Okay what?" you form your features into the pout that gets you anything and everything, and watch their glum faces.

"Sorry Leiah," Ryan stutters, "we were just...uh, talking."

"About what?" you ask, placing a hand deftly against your chin to lean on. You notice, not for the first time, how blue Ryans eyes are. Is it just you, or does he look a lot better of late? You dismiss the thought, its probably just the fact you've been flung into a world full of dirty little hobbit-elf things.

"We were talking about the Crystals of Esylla," he says simply, tossing a meaningful glance from you to Jarth. "Its why the villiage is plagued by the horrible grotesque things from the forest. You know, the things that looked kinda like you," he throws in as a small little joke.

You smile sarcastically, nod with a smirk on your face and turn to Jarth. He might not look as good, but surely he can explain these crystals and the ahem, quote; "horrible grotesque things from the forest" a with a little more clarity than Ryan?
111222111111112.title: Getting the facts straight

1112221111111121.content:
"Right. Jarth, was it?" you manage to grin at the, um, whatever he is. "These forest-y things, what are they?"

"They are the woodland creatures of the night," he says solemnly, a slight tremble to his earthy voice.
1112221111111121.title: Woodland creatures of the night

11122211111111211.content: "Okay. Not liking these creatures right now," You grin, "they're not really that disgusting looking are they?" You add as an afterthought. They can't be that bad, can they? Not if they resemble you in any way.
11122211111111211.title: Resembling who?

111222111111112111.content:
"Oh, no, Miss Leiah," he adds quickly, and you insanely think he looks rather like a tree trunk for a second. "They are not as horrible looking as you."

You're stunned for a moment. Then Ryan's snort of laughter breaks the silence. You turn from one to the other, exasperated. Finally you settle your withering glare on that detestible little tree-trunk-hobit-elf-man.
111222111111112111.title: Not as horrible as you

1112221111111121111.content:
"I am not horrible looking, thank you very much. You're no Mr Universe yourself, Frodo." you say, holding back the bubbling of anger. You turn to Ryan.

"I am so not horrible looking..." you say to him, as a conformation. He grins his classic lopsided grin, then shrugs.
1112221111111121111.title: No horribe looking!!!!!

11122211111111211111.content:
"Guess he's got different standards," He laughs, squeezing your hand reassuringly. "'Cause you look goof, Leiah."

"Thank you," you manage, ripping yourself away from him with a triumphant glare at Jarth. "See. I'm fine."
11122211111111211111.title: See? I told you!

111222111111112111111.content:
"No, no, you are quite repulsive," He assures you with a stupid smile. You groan. Honestly.

"Okay, so what's the deal with these woodland creature things?"
111222111111112111111.title: Jerk

1112221111111122.content:
"What are the crystals of Esylla?" you ask.
Jarth looks warily at you, but did not say anything.
"What? Did I miss some mud or something?" You ask looking down at your body.
"No, Leigha. It is just that, well you are a girl. Jarth feels it isn't right to talk of such things with a woman."
"What!" you exclaim. "I have every right to know what is going on. I am here too damnit. What makes you in charge and decideweather I am worthy to here about it or not? I asked a question and I expect it to be answered. NOW."
Ryan looks at you with a bedwildered look on his face. Jarth looks angry, and your other two friends are sleepily staring at you.
"So are you going to tell me what are the crystals of Esylla are?"
"No. I am not." Said Jarth.
"Fine." you say through gritted teeth. You glare at Ryan hoping he saw that you will get him back for this. He new better than to treat her this way.
You stand back up, and stomp out of the room, towards what you think might be the kitchen. You could use some food anyway. After you leave the room, you find yourself in a hallway. The kitchen you can see is on your left, but a door is on the other side of the hall. Light is shining from under the door, and you wonder what is in there.
1112221111111122.title: Woman's Rights

choices: You Exit the Room And Try To Find Your Friends
11122211111112.content:
"I'm not feeling adventurous today, just regular if you please." You reply. "Jarth, My clothes are ruined, do you by any chance have some I can borrow?"

"Oh yes of course Leiah-" He was cut off.

"How do you know my name?" You ask him, suddenly on guard.

"Well I was sent by the One who summoned you here, I know everything about you, but we shall go into that later on. You new clothes are in the armoire. Your friends will also be presented new clothing. Also other gifts from the One. My Master has taken quite an interest in you four. But I am babbling, enjoy your bath." He finished, then he swept out of the room to no doubt attend to your friends.

You finish your bath. (And what a wonderful bath it was you have never felt so clean in your entire life.) You walk to the armoire, open it, and see the most beautiful gown you haveever laid eyes on. It was softer then chanile or cashmere, had a plunging neckline, and empire waist. The inside was satin it cooled your skin as soon as you had put it on. The color however was the most magnificent part of this dress, it was silver, almost metalic. It seemed to catch light and all color then disperse it throughout the dress.
11122211111112.title: Lots Of Questions Now!

111222111111121.content: You walk down the hallway to the end. You see Casian, Ryan, and Jake in the living area. Jarth is sitting in an old style rocking chair. You join your friends. "Well now that we are all assembled, shall we put some answers to the questions that you most likely have?"
111222111111121.title: Rocking Chair

choices: Calmly ask Jarth what that is...in a screaming tone of voice!
1112221111111211.content: You look around at the other's clothes. They were also very nice. Casian was wearing a pale pink dress that actually looked very nice with her deep brown hair. Casian's brown eyes drooped, as if falling asleep. Jake and Ryan was wearing attire similiar to a king's. Jarth peers around the room, as if looking for something. You look out the window and see a pair of yellow eyes peering in!
1112221111111211.title: Clothes

choices: You decided to tell them about the creepy yellow eyes
No way are you going to let them think you're crazy . . .
11122211111112111.content:
You let out a scream, pointing to the awful apparition. The awful yellow eyes blink and disappear before anyone else sees them.

Ryan raises an eyebrow, "What? You see some sort of ghost?" he laughs nervously.

Jake moves over to the window and peers out at the street. "I don't see anything."

"Are you alright?" Casian sounds worried. You can only stare at her.

Are you alright? What does she think?

Jarth draws everyones attention when he asks the first sensible question. "What did you see?"

You're about to answer when you wonder, what if they don't believe you? What if you just imagined it?
11122211111112111.title: Disappearing Eyes

11122211111112112.content:
“Uh-Jarth?” you whisper frantically.

“Eh?” he mutters, staring at the floor.

“What in God’s name is that?” you ask, pointing to the eyes.

“Who’s God?” He asks.

“He’s-Oh never mind, just what is that?” you demand.

“Oh.” He says, glancing at the creature, “Those are the night creatures. They look like humans, but a completely black. They dwell in those pits, like the one you fell in. The suck anyone who steps in one deep into their world. Their world is awful, greedy, mean, and extremely dangerous.”

You gulp. Danger?!

“Anyway, they hate light, and they prey on the young and beautiful, like yourself.” He said, grinning.

“There isn’t anything to smile about.” Casian snapped.

Jarth sobered immediately, “I’m sorry, I am no longer young, and I have never been beautiful (you can agree with that) so I just think that it is very funny to tell this to the young and beautiful.”

“Ok…” you say, “By the way, thanks for the dress, it’s beautiful.”

“Don’t thank me. Methinks that my boss sent it. She seems extremely interested in you.” Jarth murmured, taking out something that looked like knitting.

“Oh, um, cool.” You say, unable to say more. Who is this person, his boss? Why was she so interested in you?

“Leigh, you look great!” Jake commented, just noticing her gown.

“Really? Maybe this will be come all the rage in LA!” You tease.

Jarth looked interested, “LA? What’s LA?”

“Where.” You answer, “Doesn’t matter.”

Jake stands up and twirls you around, your dress whirling around. “Beautiful.” He murmurs.

You blush. Since when has one of your best friends said that to you? Of all the guys you've dated, mostly football players, none had called you beautiful. And Jake wasn’t even your boyfriend! Was being short, 5’4", with dark hair and bright blue eyes been beautiful. You had a nice complexion, but that hardly counted.

“Ok, as soon as this love-fest is over, can we get to who this ‘boss’ is?” Casian asked. Of course, how typical of Casian, ruin the love.

“Sorry,” You apologize, just then realizing the word ‘love-fest’, “CASIAN!”

Everyone laughs, Jarth even chuckles. This is nice, being clean and warm, being safe (for the moment) and sharing a funny moment. All of a sudden, you begin to feel drowsy, like you had taken a sleeping pill…

BACK AT THE CASTLE

Queen Jart’ja smiled maliciously as she watched Leiah fall to the floor in dead faint.

“Milady?” A little goblin asked gruffly.

“What is it?” she snapped. Finally a glorious moment! The jewel had been found! And a stupid little stuffy goblin had to come and screw it.

“Um, she uh…woke up.” He squeaked, even though he had an extremely low voice.

This took a moment to sink in, then, “WHAT?!”

“She must be extremely strong milady, nobody has ever broken that spell before!” He babbled.

“I KNOW YOU IDIOTIC MORON!” she screeched.

“Ma’am, I mean, Milady, I’m sorry, but this cannot be blamed of anyone but the girl!” he continued.

“Oh SHUT UP!” she hissed and turned back to her mirror. And just like the goblin had said, there was Leiah, awake!

“I need that girl…” she growled.

“I-I know.” He stammered.

“TELL THAT STUPID SERVANT TO HURRY UP!” she screamed. The goblin jumped at the increased volume in her voice, then scurried away, as fast as his big, ugly, hairy feet would take him.
11122211111112112.title: Beautiful

111222111111121121.content:
RUDE AWAKING

“Oh my God Leigh, what happened?” Casian breathed urgently.
“Uh, what?” you ask groggily.
“You, you just, fell, like fainted, but Jake caught you.” Casian pieced, breathing hard.
“Ok something weird is happening, and I don’t want to stay to find out what.” Ryan said, his eyes darting around the room.
You see Jake’s blue eyes peering into yours. But his looked much more frightened.
“W-What happened?” you asked calmly.
“You were laughing, then you just…fainted.” Jake said quietly.
After getting you standing up (you had been in Jake’s arms) and holding a cup of something or other in your hands (it tasted like café a latté but it looked like blood.) you told them about your dream.
“I was in a castle, but it looked as if it were made of crystal. It was beautiful. There were blue silk carpets on the floor. I was standing there, in this white dress, silk I think, but it was sleeveless, and I had long gloves on. I had long white gloves on and my hair was really long, pulled up really prettily, with spirals hanging around my face. I had roses in my hair too. A woman entered, she looked like me, except with silvery hair and she looked older. Then three more people entered, one girl and two men. One of the men I seemed to be in love with. The girl, probably about my age, was wearing this white gown, plainer than mine, but still pretty. She had deep brown, almost auburn hair and it was pulled up completely, with a gold tiara, a plain one, in it. She had thick gold wristbands and gold anklets. At her waist their was a sword. She looked like a bodyguard, a feminine one.
The men looked like knights, but were dressed a little nicer. With black cloaks. The ends of the cloak were connected with a silver chain. Then, the woman directed the three to stand in front of her. She started to say, "Saranna, Sir Daylon, and Prince Alexander, I..."
"Then what?" Casian persisted. You gasp, Casian looked almost exactly like the girl in the dream, slightly different though, a little more modern...
You sigh and continue, "She didn't finish, suddenly there was a crash, knocking us to the ground. This motherly woman, she must have been a queen, gasped, not in fright, but in pain.
I wanted to call her mother, I did I think. But anyway, this woman came out of nowhere. My mother-I mean the queen shouted for the three to protect me-ME and then this beautiful but evil woman broke down the walls, cursing everything around us. Many people in attire for a ball were screaming, many were already dead, as an army marched forth. Then she turned on me..."
You stop and look around, "And then I woke up."
Everyone kind of stands there, as if this is hard to take in. For some reason this seems familiar, as if this dream were Deja Vu. Then Casian speaks, "How did that all happen in like ten minutes?"
You take this in, "I don't know." you admit. Jarth looks like this is familiar also. He looks familiar somehow, like he was in the dream...
"Jarth?" you ask.
"What?" he is startled.
"Um, I saw you, or at least somebody who looked like you in this dream."
"Oh." he answered.
Jake is staring at you, incredulous. Just then, a screech is heard outside. This was a human screech though...
111222111111121121.title: The Dream

choices: Return to the subject of your dream
1112221111111211212.content:
"Uh, Jarth, what was that?" you ask, everyone else seems too stunned to speak.

Jarth seems relieved at the change of subject. "Oh, that's just the woodland creatures. They come out at night and roam the town." He notices everyone's shocked look and chuckles. "Don't worry; you're safe in here. They don't like light or heat."

You want to explore Jarth's possible connection to your dream, but you're also curious about these "woodland creatures" . . .
1112221111111211212.title: Woodland Creatures of the Night

choices: Everyone has stopped what they're doing and are staring at you
1112221112.content:
Just as you're about to offer your precious necklace to the creature your better judgement takes over. What if It thought it was a gift and just took it? Could they even speak English? Simply thinking about the possibility makes you ill.

"You guys, I just can't part with this . . ." you try, but can't keep the whine from your voice. Your eyes turn to Casian for sympathy--after all, she knows how much you loved your aunt.

Casian smiles at you, then turns to the guys. "Leiah's right, you guys. I mean, diamonds might not even be worth much here. We need to find out more before we try to barter anything." Way to go, Casian! you think. She always was the sensible one.

"Well, who should we talk to then?" Jake asks quietly, still ashamed about his inability to save you from the black goop.

As the others discuss this, you glance around and are stunned to find . . .
1112221112.title: Second Thoughts

choices: Approach this man and ask for help?

As the others discuss this, you glance around and are stunned to find that there was no longer a single person in sight.

"Guys?" you ask, aware of the fear in your voice.

"Yeah?" Casian asks you.

"Look around, everyone's gone..."

The others quickly glance over the area and determine that you're right! There isn't a single person in sight!

"Wait! There's someone!" Ryan says, pointing to the distance where a man in with long black hair wearing a large trench coat - also black - and at his hip was what appeared to be a sheathed sword of all things!

Do you...
11122211121.title: Where did everybody go?

choices: Casian has always been the smartest, she probably has the right idea about going
Jake's right, it is getting rather dark . . . and you are tired . . .
111222111212.content:
You may be stuck in some strange place and covered with nasty black good, but you are not stupid! You kick off your designer platforms--they were ruined anyway--and run for it.

Stunned, the others follow suit. You keep running until you've left town completely and collapsed in the forest. Once Ryan has caught his breath, he turns on you. "What was that all about? That guy might have been able to help us!"

Casian nods, still out of breath. Jake, however, comes to your rescue. "Hey, I'm sure Leiah had a reason. She wouldn't have run like that if she didn't."

You give Jake a nice smile, even though you know he's probably just still feeling guilt about letting you sink into the goo. "Jake's right. Did you guys see that man? He was positively creepy! And he had a sword! And he totally didn't fit in there; I mean, a trenchcoat? In some weird backwoods town? Plus, if he was good why would everyone have disappeared when he came?"

Ryan still looks skeptical, but Casian speaks up. "You're probably right. Besides, we're not any worse off than we were before. Maybe we should just keep looking for some way to figure out what happened to us."

"I dunno, it's getting kind of dark--I think we should just try to get some sleep and try in the morning," Jake says.

"Well, I think you're all crazy. Our best bet is to head back to that town and ask someone there where we are," Ryan stubbornly insists.

You look from one to the other, trying to decide which plan is best . . . (obviously you weren't going back to the town, but otherwise . . .)
111222111212.title: Run!!

choices: You are awakened by a noise in the woods.
1112221112122.content:
You all searched for and found a clearing and gathered wood for a fire. Soon, the four of you are huddled together in front of a roaring fire. Rumbling stomachs issue thier desires for food and this only makes you and the others laugh. Soon however, you all find comfortable positions and lay down to sleep.
Time passes, suddenly......
1112221112122.title: Camping out

11122211122.content:
The whole village was unsettling in the first place. It looked like something out of Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves. The villages themselves looked like a cross between the elves and hobbits in Lord of the Rings. Everyone spoke English, even if it was with a weird lilt. But the freakiest thing was happening now.

Everyone in the village had stopped talking and was looking at your group.

Specifically, they were looking at...
11122211122.title: The talk of the town

choices: you bring yourself too to ask what they mean.
continue standing there and have to be led to an inn.
111222111221.content:
All the eyes looking at you make you stare at yourself. What's left of the black goo doesn't look like it's going to stain your clothes but the way they're looking at you makes you feel like they see a monster. Slowly, they all turn to each other and start whispering. You catch bits and pieces of conversations such as 'Is it really her?' 'Can she have really come back after all this time? The....princess?'

The statement shocks you and.....
111222111221.title: you (Leiah}

choices: Leiah sleeps soundly, and wakes up with the sun streaming through the curtains.
Something happens in the middle of the night.
1112221112212.content:
One of the villagers approaches you tentatively.
'Princess... Leiah?' he asks. He is very small and has upturned ears. But he has a friendly face and a polite manner.
You laugh. 'No, just Leiah.'
'Okay... Just Leiah. Can I bring you to my inn? It would be an honour for you to rest with us tonight. And your loyal subjects of course,' he added, indicating the rest of your friends.
'Well...' You look at Casian. She nods. 'Sure, why not?'
You follow the strange man through the town, and eventually you come to his little inn. It is small, but clean. There is a similiar-looking woman standing at the counter, who you guess is the man's wife.
'What is your name?' you ask him.
He gives a slight bow. 'I am Parnissus. I live here with my wife Tilly.'
'And, tell me, Parnissus, what makes you think that I am a princess?'
Parnissus started to stutter. 'Because... I mean - wait here.'
He dashed out of the room through a door in the back. When he returned, he was holding a card. On the front, in black and white, was a family. They were clearly royalty. There was the king and queen, a handsome young prince, and there was... me?
I looked at the photo again. It was me! But how was this possible? 'I don't understand', I said.
Jake and Ryan also looked at the photo, and started laughing. 'This is some messed up world if you're a princess', Ryan laughed. 'Although I guess you act spoilt enough at times!'
'Hey!' you reply. 'The only reason we have a place to stay tonight is because of me, so shut your mouth.'
I handed the photograph back to Parnissus. 'I'll show you to your rooms', he told us. He led Casian and I to a small twin room that was clean and comfortable. Ryan and Jake had a similiar room across the hall.
We spent the rest of the evening chatting with Parnissus and his wife, and dined on some meat and potatoes. Ryan and Jake wanted to try the beer that Parnissus kept offering us, but Casian and I persuaded them that we would need clear heads in the morning if we were going to figure out what the hell was going on. At around ten o'clock, we said goodnight to the innkeeper and his wife, and went to bed.
1112221112212.title: Parnissus the Innkeeper

111222112.content:
"I think we're better off wondering the woods at night." You say like an idiot.

It will be dark in a matter of an hour or so. Casian looks reluctantly at the woods and then towards the town.

"Well, if that's what you think is best." She says.

Ryan shrugs and Jake just watches. It a matter of seconds the sky goes dark. The four of you look at eachother in the dim light that is produced by the town.

A screech breaks through the silence of the forest. You can hear the noise becoming louder and louder from behind you until it's sounding from overhead. You scream and fall into Ryan.

"Run!" Jake hollers.

The four of you break out into a run. Well, you mostly break out into a stumble because of your shoes. No one seems to notice how far behind your lagging until they step into the light of the city and your still at least two hundred feet back.

Before your eyes the city just disappears. Vanishes into thin air along with your friends.
111222112.title: Night time

choices: Give up and try to survive the nught
Keep looking and risk getting lost for good
1112221121.content:
"Guys?" You manage. The screeching has stopped and now there are no sounds.

This is worse then the screeching. You keep moving forward towards where the city was. It seems pretty hopeless after about five minutes of walking.
1112221121.title: Lost

11122211211.content: You quickly find a small cave. It's not the Ritz, but it works. You fall unsleep, it turns our to be a very restless night. You wake up from dawn's light pouring into the cave entrance.
11122211211.title: Cave

111222112111.content:
"Ohh guys! I was so afraid that I would be lost forever!" You wailed.

Casian gives you a hug and smiles. "We didn't knowwhat had happened to you. We made it to the town. There's a nice elderly couple who are going to give us shelter until we can figure out what to do."

"The lady, Karis, is an awesome cook too." Ryan said.

You touch your stomach, realizing how hungry you are. "Do you think we could go see this gret cook?"
111222112111.title: Hungry

1112221121111.content:
Your three friends lead you on. Soon, you come upon a cute little cottage, a white-bearded man sits in a rocking chair with a black wolf at his feet. A pretty older woman comes out of the cottage, arms wide.

"Darlings! You're all back, and with your other friend I see!" She said.

"Karis, this is Leiah." Jake said.

"Leiah, beautiful name. I've made a late breakfast. Oriun, off of your chair and help the children set the table."
1112221121111.title: Karis and Oriun

choices: You wake up where you passed out.
You wake up in a soft bed.
111222112112.content: You wander, not knowing where you are going. Everything seems blurry, after hours of walking, you pass out. Maybe it was from lack of food or water, or maybe fatigue.
111222112112.title: Passed Out

1112221121122.content: You slowly come out of your deep sleep. A sense of fatigue washes over you, as if the sleep had not helped at all. You then notice that you are laying on a soft bed, you are dressed in thin, but warm clothing, and there is someone in the room with you...
1112221121122.title: Still Tired

11122211211221.content:
"Shh," A soothing voice calms you. A tall good looking man steps out of the shadows. "I saved you."

You stare blankly at him.

"I apologize if I frightened you. My name is Prince Kesin of Esylla. You are in my father's castle."

"Leiah Trene."

"You have the look of one with royal blood? Do you come from a far off land?"
11122211211221.title: Prince Kesin

111222112112211.content:
"Yes. Princess Leiah of California." You say, a nearly wicked smile on your face.

"That will please my parents greatly." He leans forward and kisses your hand lightly. "I had the royal tailor make you this gown. We're having a feast tonight in your honor."

You sit up, and look at the end of the bed. A beautiful pale pink and white dress is lying at your feet. Your eyes widen at it's elegant beauty. "Ohh Prince Kesin! It's beautiful."

"I would be honored if you would simply call me Kesin. I believe that I would like to be on friendly terms with you Princess Leiah."

"Well, Kesin," You say smiling sweetly and flutter your eyelashes. "If you should like me to call you by your first name, it would only be fitting for you to call me by mine."

You like this whole "Princess" gig. It could be truly benificial, a drop-dead gorgeous Prince who wants to "be on friendly terms" with you.

Could it get any better?
111222112112211.title: Princess Leiah

1112221121122111.content:
"Leiah, I must ask you a question."

"Yes?"

"Are you aquanited with the other girl who is here? She looks your age and wears the same strange attire."

"Casian? She's here?"

"Princess Casian, yes, she is the one. Is she your sister?"

"Well, yes."

"That is good to know, my older brother Karis will be pleased to be able to tell Princess Casian that her younger sister is well. Hopefully it will bring my brother further into the lady's good graces. Karis has grown quite fond of her in the past few days. "

He's not the crown prince? You think to yourself. Dammit, I got the wrong one.
1112221121122111.title: Wrong Prince?

11122211211221112.content:
"My brother is escorting her to the feast as we speak. I'll be waiting in the hall." Kesin says, leaving you to get changed.

You pick up the dress, wondering how exactly to put it on. "Aren't there supposed to be maid in waiting for this kind of stuff?" You mutter to yourself. You finally put it on properly and put your hair into a messy fishtail braid. You open the heavy wooden door. Price Kesin's jaw nearly hits the floor, but he quickly recovers and extends his arm.
11122211211221112.title: On to the Feast

111222112112211121.content:
"Casi!" You yell across the hall, unaware that this behavior is totally unbefitting of a princess. You run over to her. She wore a pale blue and silver dress that was much more extravagent than your own. It looked as though she had a privat meeting with the royal tailor. She looked stunning, but you would never tell her. The focus was supposed to be on you!

"Leiah? You're here too? Prince Karis said they found soeone else, but I never thought it would be you."

Kesin walks over, a taller man by his side. "Leiah, this is my brother Karis."

Karis was only a year or so older than Kesin, and certainly as handsome. Karis leans over and kissis your hand. "Princess Leiah, 'tis a pleasure to see you up and about. Princess Casian has told me much of your journey from the land of California." You look over at Casian. Hoping that she hadn't said too much. "She thought that perhaps you were still in the wild lands of Esylla. We are seraching for the Princes Jacob and Ryan at this moment, but in the meantime my father has thrown this feast in your honor."

You finally understood, "your honor" was not just you, it was Casian too. You look to Casian and she speaks, filling you in along the way. "I must thank you both for helping my sister and I. We are in your debt."

"There is no debt." Karis said quickly, careful to exert his social standing as Crown Prince. "We are honored to have two such beautiful ladies in our court."
111222112112211121.title: No Debt

1112221121122111211.content:
The King raised his hands and everyone quietly sat down. On the right side sat Karis and beside him, Casian and on his left sat Kesin and then you.

"Attention!" A sturdy older man said standing in the middle of a large dining room table. "Our fair and beautiful country has been made even more fair and beautiful by two traveling princesses. Their presence has been especially note by my two sons, Crown Prince Karis, who origionally found the two ladies in the woods and Prince Kesin who care for them alongside the royal healer. This feast is for these youths who are so resiliant and strong-willed."
1112221121122111211.title: A Speech

choices: you go back to your room
you pass out again in Kesin'
11122211211221112111.content:
Casian and you smile. During the feast another wave of fetigue comes over you. You begin to fall asleep when you sit up quickly. Kesin sees you and looks at you worridly.

You turn to him and smile then look across the table at Casian and frown. She nods and goes back to dinner.

You feel fine and then the feast is over and you and Kesin are outside in the garden. You walk around while talking and getting to know each other.

Soon Casian comes out too. She takes you away from Kesin and she asks you what happened. After you told her she asked you if you felt alright otherwise.

"Well after I passed out both times I feel something buzzing in me but that is it." you say.

Casian looks worried but says nothing more.
11122211211221112111.title: After Dinner

choices: Wake up in the middle of the forest
11122211212.content: Wandering aimlessly, you keep going. Ever onward, becoming even more lost than before. Finally you collapse.
11122211212.title: Passing out...

111222112121.content: You wake up, hungry and thirst, in the middle of a godforsaken forest. Standing up slowly, you make ready to set about for a full day's wandering.
111222112121.title: Godforsaken Forest!

111222112122.content:
"What am I doing here!" You yell as you look around.

"Well hey there missie. Back in the land of the livin' eh?"
111222112122.title: The Ship

1112221121221.content:
"That's right missie. A pirate. Most feared black heart in all the five seas."

"Don't you mean seven seas?"

"Seven? No. There are only five seas in Esylla." He laughed. "But back to business. You're the new ship's cook."

"I don't know how to dook."

"What? Every woman knows how to cook, ain't you a woman?"

"Well yes."

"So then you now how to cook."
1112221121221.title: Ain't You A Woman?

11122211212211.content:
Pirates and galley slaves alike spat out the soup concocted by you.

The captian (Evan, you had learned his name was) pulled you up by the arm and tossed you out of the kitchens.

"I thought you could cook."

"I told you I couldn't! I'm a material girl, not a Betty Crocker!"

"Who?" He askjed. "Makes no difference. You cain't cook, so you're of no use to us. We'll toss you overboard."
11122211212211.title: Not Betty Crocker!

111222112122111.content:
"Wait! I can't cook, but I can buy." You say quickly. You don't want to die in the middle of an ocean.

"What?"

"I can buy things for you. You know bargain."

"You mean you're a merchant!"

"Well, sort of. I stay on as professional ship buyer, and you don't kill me. Is it a deal?"

"You strike a hard bargain. You're hired missie!"

"By the way, my name is Leiah, not missie."
111222112122111.title: Can't cook, but I can shop!

choices: Speak up about this unfair transaction!!!
No way, no more walking and you can smell halfway decent again!!!
11122212.content: The villiage did not look like a very pleasant place to be. Of course what is pleasant to a spoiled Daddy's girl? But you as you were going through this little town, people threw waste (and no I don't mean half eaten apples) out of the window, there were rats the size of Chihuahua's, and you could see fleas jumping from person to person. You were extatic when Ryan announced that you were just "passing through." He did however come across a merchant who wanted the "noisebox" (Jake's MP3 Player.) The merchant offered to trade the "noisebox" for two tunics, two pairs of pants, a blouse, a skirt, a dress, and four pairs of boots, along with a few loaves of bread, some cheese, and wine. Ryan was not convinced that this was enough, and he conned the merchant to give him a large bag of gold and four horses. You knew the merchant was being sucked in, and that the MP3 was not worth THAT much.
11122212.title: The Noisebox

choices: The trade closes perfectly and you leave the town
Secret police come and charge Ryan with "Trade Piracy"
111222121.content:
"Look Mister, I don't know how dumb you are, but there is no way that the mp3 player is worth all that stuff you want to give us."

"The cheeky female says you are trying to cheat me sir." The merchant said, addressing Ryan.

"Oh no, you see she is a woman and knows nothing of matters concerning fair trade." Ryan quickly said. When he said it though, you shot him an "if looks could kill" glance, wishing that looks did kill because you were pissed.

"True, sir, shall we close the deal with paperwork, or would you rather it be a secret trade."

"Either is fine with us" Ryan said not knowing which way he should "close the deal."The two men, well the merchant and a very shrewd seventeen year-old, stood off to the side chatting about arrangements to get the stuff that was promised.
111222121.title: A Cheeky Female

1112221211.content:
"I can't believe you Ryan!" You yell at him after leaving the town with horses(and their tack), food, new clothing, weapons, and a map. All that stuff for a stupid MP3 player!

"Look Le, he was an idiot. We have stuff we can use now, that's all that matters, right?"

"Sure we have stuff Ryan, but did we have to cheat that man?" You asked him.

"It was the only way!" He stopped his horse and everyone gathered around him. He brought the map out. The seemed to be a castle to the north, only(by Casian's estimate) about 6 miles away. There was also another town to the west, only 3 miles away.
1112221211.title: Which Way?

11122212111.content:
Everyone agreed that a castle was probably a better way to go and find answeres to your questions. By midday the castle was spotted, still far away. The only distinguishing feature was the tall tower, it was the only one.

**************************************************************************** ************************

Queen Jart'ja once again stood looking out of her tower window. This time she saw the four teenagers on horseback coming towards her castle! "This is an unexpected move! I shall be their 'hostess' tonight, they will trust me. Then I will KILL them all!" She laughed that hideous laugh.
11122212111.title: The Castle

111222121111.content:
The group stopped to eat lunch, change, and prepare for anything that could be in the castle.

Lunch was hurried, though no one could figure out why. You guessed that it was probably because they were nervous to see the weapons and new clothes.
111222121111.title: Hurried Lunch

1112221211111.content:
There was an assortment of fine handcreafted weaponry the merchant has traded. There were two swords, for the boys. Two long daggers, for you and Casian. Three sets of bows and arrows, each had taken archery lessons, but Casian had never been comfortable with arrows. She instead recieved a tall wooden staff.

The new clothes were also dispersed. Among the wide array of items the boys each took cream colored tunics, pants(Black for Ryan, Green for Jake,) and shoes. Ryan took a pair of short boots, and Jake took what were more like moccasins. You took a tight blouse, leggings, and a pair of slippers, while Casian took a short dress, and tall thigh high boots. There were also cloaks, Jake and Ryan took them waist long, you took one about mid thigh with a hood, and Casian too the longest. It was so long that it drug on the ground, it also had a huge oversized hood, and several hidden pockets. Casian commented about it being extremely heavy on one side. She checked the pockets and found a book in one.
1112221211111.title: Weapons And New Clothes!!!!

11122212111111.content:
Casian opens the book. It had no title, but the pages were filled with what looked like incantations, spells, and charms. A wind started turning the pages, and it stopped at page that said: "For the Chosen Ones Only!"


Casian started reading from the page, her voice began chanting the words on the paper. You had the sudden urge to join in. You were thinking of joining the chant when Jake and Ryan started chanting as well.
11122212111111.title: The Book

111222121111111.content:
You started chanting in sync with your friends. After going through the whole page, the book started to glow. Four colored winds swept up. Green. Blue. Red. And a rainbowed one. The green one incircled Jake. The blue one went to Ryan. The red one came to you. And the multicolored one went around Casian. A soft whispering came to your ears. It seemed like it was from the book, that was still glowing.

"Green is for Nature,and all its Creatures. He is Guardian. Blue is for Wind, Water and Storm. He is Warrior. Red is for Light and Fire. She is Healer. A rainbow of colors is Magic and Mind. She is the Mystic." The winds entered all your bodies, the book ceased glowing, and you felt this incredible energy flowing through your veins.
111222121111111.title: The Winds

1112221211111111.content: You suddenly snap back to reality and realize every one is shaking thier heads and looking a bewildered as you feel. You stare at the book sitting closed on the ground, looking harmless. As you bend down to pick it up Cassian snaps at you, "Don't touch it!" You glare at her as she picks up the book and she tucks it in her robe. Suddenly you palm starts to glow and then bursts into flame, you yelp and start to try to put it out, but you relize it doesn't hurt.
1112221211111111.title: Fire/Light

choices: Uhh, ok... Well on to the castle.
11122212111111111.content:
You notice that everyone else has something going on. Jake, who was leaning on a tree stump, jumped back as the seemingly dead tree started to grow at an alarming rate. Ryan fiddled with his sword and a spire of water suddenly flew from the tip of it. Mulit-colored lights flowed all around Casian. It was like sparks of energy had ingnighted in all of you.

You noticed that everyone had changed in some way. Jake seemed peaceful and serenely aware of his surroundings. Ryan was confident and stong. Casian, if it was possible, looked like she had aquired the knowledge of the ages, for it shone brightly in her eyes. You wonder to yourself how you have changed. Casian looks up, one hand in her pocket, presumably on the book. "We're leaving now. The witch awits us."

You lok at her. "Huh? What are you talking about?"

"We were sent here to kill the witch. She is peering down at us this very moment from her tower in the castle. She may, or may not know of our new found magic. Gather your things. And be ready."

You went to say something, but Casian's final words seemed to have closed the subject for discussion.
11122212111111111.title: All Have Powers

choices: Becoming aquainted with the four noble horses
111222122.content:
OK you felt sorry for the poor guy, but not that sorry. Ryan and the merchant finish the transaction with a handshake, and the merchant runs away giddily, looking like he just got away with murder.

You each now have a horse, a change of clothes, some food, and hey you're rich again. Other than being able to take a long hot bath, things couldn't be better.
111222122.title: Getting away with murder

choices: Mount and leave this god-forsaken village
Find an inn w/ a stable to rest for the night
1112221222.content:
Jake immediatly fell in love with the Friesian, a very rare pitch black horse (origionating from the Netherlands.) It seems as if the Friesian stallion, that he had promptly named Baron, wanted to be Jake's companion as well.

You claimed the Andalusian for your own, that breed being know for its noble, almost regal, Spaniah heritage, you named her Majesty.

Casian made her way to the Golden American Saddleback, a bold and intelligent breed, coat the color of an untarnished gold coin, mane and tail that of creame, and a white marking on her forehead. She promtly named her Starburst, its namesake being that the white marking on its forehead resenbled that of a star.

Ryan was usually timid with horses because he had been bucked off as a small child, but nonetheless he promtly found his way to the Salle Francais this breed that was known for being the epitome of the sporting horse: athletic stong and swift. Normally midnight black colored with hints of brown along the back, flanks, and legs this magnificent horse was no exception though it had a white diamond between its eyes. Ryan named him Chavallier (for Maurice Chavallier a french actor renouned for being the epitome of the french gentleman.)

**************************************************

Well you have your horses now what?
1112221222.title: All the Pretty Horses

choices: Agree with Jake, it does seem like a better idea
Ryan is your self-appointed leader he must know what he's doing
11122212221.content:
"Can we puh-leeze get out of here its gross!" You wail.

"Yea Le, sounds like a good idea. We'll ride the remainder of the day and try to find somewhere to rest. What do you say Jake?"

"It's all gravy with me," He says though you hear him mutter. "I mean it's not like we have any clue what we're doing anways."

**************************************************************************** ************************

You quickly exit the village. Riding is tedious work, and your behind was hurting by the time Ryan anounced that it was time to dismount and set about making camp.

"Wouldn't it be better to camp out in that rocky outlet over ther Ry? I mean out in the open like this could be very dangerous." Jake asks.

Ryan seems miffed that his authority has been undermined.
11122212221.title: Stopping for the evening

111222122211.content:
"Ryan, I think Jake may have a point. I mean I don't want to be stuck out in the open if something bad happens." You say timidly.

"Well I suppose he does have a point. Well gang, lets move all our stuff over to the outcrop." Ryan said. He still seemed as if he were mad, but he didn't act like it.

It did not take long to fumble your way to Jake's suggested area. Jake did indeed have a nack for picking out a great place. It was cold damp, but nonetheless it was sheilded from the wind,a fire could also be started without giving away your position. That was if the wood didn't smoke too much, and if you even were going to have a fire in the first place.
111222122211.title: Cold and Damp, But Safe

1112221222112.content:
Queen Jart'ja sat stroking her leathery pet, the only living soul left that she had touched. She looked out of her Tower window and spoke into the light that she usually cursed."To give me all that I want, I will do all in my power, Just give these childern their merry jaunt, to the place of death that I call my Tower." She chanted evilly.

"Well darling, they should be here by the morrow."She cackled. "They will not walk away from me. I will have all I want, and four so-called Promised Ones shall NOT stop me!" She shouted, standing up leaving her gargoyle stunned on the freezing stone floor.

Jart'ja strutted over to her bookshelf where she held the chosen body parts of those she had killed. She brought a bowl out and looked into it, two glazed eyeballs rolled about. "Fitting isn't it, that the Seer who said that I would be destroyed by teenagers, lost her eyes to me." She laughed her hideous laugh again. "She will never see again, unless she sees the flames of Hell, that is."

**************************************************************************** ************************

Nothing had happened that night, but you awoke aching from yesterday's riding. The saddles that were given to you were not quality made. The campsite was packed up, leaving not one trace that four people had been there the night before, except for the faint smell of sulfur that the fire had created.

The campsite was left and the four of you set off. All throughout the day it felt as if the horses footsteps were being lead, towards an unknown destination.
1112221222112.title: Acursed Light

choices: Stay On, You Can't Just Leave Them!!!
11122212221121.content:
"Well the sun should be going down in less than an hour, I suggest we find a campsite for tonight." Ryan said thoughtfully.

"How about that grove of trees over there?" Casian asked pointing to where they stood.

"That should work Cas, we'll find lotsa firewood there, and we still have a bit of food left from the MP3 transaction." You said trying to pull Majesty towards the grove. "Majesty! Ho!... You guys Majesty won't stop walking!" You said still trying to bring her about.

"Baron, turn!" Jake shouted. Ryan and Casian tried to move their horses, but they would not veer off of the path Queen Jart'ja had laid down.

"What's wrong with them?" Ryan asked.
11122212221121.title: Horses Wont Budge!

choices: Storm Clouds that seem to be pouring acid rain...
Large flying beasts.... coming towards you!
111222122211211.content:
The horses were obviously spooked. You all took defensive stances, ready to face whatever was awaiting you.

"Guys..." You said looking up at the skyline. "I don't like the looks of that!"
111222122211211.title: Uh-Oh!

choices: Try to Move The Horses And Get Out!
111222122211212.content:
These horses were already like family to the four of you. The group decision (unanimous) is that each would stay atop his or her horse until the destination was reached. You slept restlessly on Majesty. It was hard trying to get comfortable on a horse. The next day was even harder because of the small amount of sleep and the tired muscles that were from riding. By midday the group was nearing a huge castle, with one tall, lonely looking tower in the middle. The horses stopped at the entrance, the drawbridge was lowered, it hardly made a sound except the soft thump when it hit the ground. The horses continued into the castle. No conversation was happening between you and your friends, each of the group, including yourself, was amazed at the grandness and beauty of the castle. It was stunningly well kept, not a leaf or blade of grass out of place, but it was also eerily quiet.

The horses stopped at the stable and a note was attached to the door: Follow the stone path to the Great Hall. No signature was found and there was no indication of anyone around. The horses stood in their stalls, not moving an inch.
111222122211212.title: The Castle

choices: You changed your mind... go back!
1112221222112122.content:
"Well, let's see what happens..." Jake suggests.

"All right. But we have to be careful." Casian said.

You all followed the directions and soon found yourselves in front of a great wooden door.
1112221222112122.title: Keep going...

11122212221121221.content: you see some one in black sucking the blood out of a demon, then he sees you...
11122212221121221.title: Is it the Great Hall?

111222122211212211.content:
he tells the four heroes he is a vampire prince fighting evil. he said this with a canadian accent and notices they are from calforia and tells them that he went to their world before once. he then joins them on their jouny to kill the evil one.
he proposes to leiah to marry him.
111222122211212211.title: he wants to marry leiah

choices: the bad guys tries to kill prince curse and the four heroes
vampires tell prince curse the bad guys are attacking his vampire kingdom
1112221222112122111.content: they are now a married couple
1112221222112122111.title: she said yes

1112221222112122112.content: she becomes pregnet with curse
1112221222112122112.title: she gets laid

choices: They continue with a 'normal' life, and now have a family to raise...
Something happens and they're forced to go on another adventure!
11122212221121221121.content: She is now married to Curse. What happens next?
11122212221121221121.title: she then marries him

info.brief_description: Teenagers sent to save a parallel world? Are they really cut out for the job?
info.description:
Esylla, a world where magic (and the forces of evil) reigns supreme... Four teenagers, thought to have the perfect lives, from Beverly Hills, California suddenly find themselves with magical powers, plus very deadly enemies. Will they ever find their way home?

If you have a suggestion, idea, whatever, just email me.

EXTRA SPECIAL THANKS TO: FinneasMacabre, George, and Tetiana you guys have added so much to this story. You're AWESOME!


Please guys- I need reviews.
